      JOIN pg_catalog.pg_class c ON  a.attrelid = c.oid
     WHERE pg_catalog.pg_table_is_visible(c.oid)
       AND c.relname = $1
       AND a.attname = $2
       AND attnum    > 0
       AND NOT a.attisdropped

Function: public._get_col_type(name, name, name)

Returns: text

Language: SQL

    SELECT pg_catalog.format_type(a.atttypid, a.atttypmod)
      FROM pg_catalog.pg_namespace n
      JOIN pg_catalog.pg_class c     ON n.oid = c.relnamespace
      JOIN pg_catalog.pg_attribute a ON c.oid = a.attrelid
     WHERE n.nspname = $1
       AND c.relname = $2
       AND a.attname = $3
       AND attnum    > 0
       AND NOT a.attisdropped

Function: public._get_context(name, name)

Returns: "char"

Language: SQL

   SELECT c.castcontext
     FROM pg_catalog.pg_cast c
    WHERE _cmp_types(castsource, $1)
      AND _cmp_types(casttarget, $2)

Function: public._get_db_owner(name)

Returns: name

Language: SQL

    SELECT pg_catalog.pg_get_userbyid(datdba)
      FROM pg_catalog.pg_database
     WHERE datname = $1;

Function: public._get_db_privs(name, text)

Returns: text[]

Language: PLPGSQL

DECLARE
    privs  TEXT[] := _db_privs();
    grants TEXT[] := '{}';
BEGIN
    FOR i IN 1..array_upper(privs, 1) LOOP
        BEGIN
            IF pg_catalog.has_database_privilege($1, $2, privs[i]) THEN
                grants := grants || privs[i];
            END IF;
        EXCEPTION WHEN invalid_catalog_name THEN
            -- Not a valid db name.
            RETURN '{invalid_catalog_name}';
        WHEN undefined_object THEN
            -- Not a valid role.
            RETURN '{undefined_role}';
        WHEN invalid_parameter_value THEN
            -- Not a valid permission on this version of PostgreSQL; ignore;
        END;
    END LOOP;
    RETURN grants;
END;

Function: public._get_dtype(name)

Returns: text

Language: SQL

    SELECT pg_catalog.format_type(t.oid, t.typtypmod)
      FROM pg_catalog.pg_type d
      JOIN pg_catalog.pg_type t  ON d.typbasetype  = t.oid
     WHERE d.typisdefined
       AND pg_catalog.pg_type_is_visible(d.oid)
       AND d.typname = LOWER($1)
       AND d.typtype = 'd'

Function: public._get_dtype(name, text, boolean)

Returns: text

Language: SQL

    SELECT CASE WHEN $3 AND pg_catalog.pg_type_is_visible(t.oid)
                THEN quote_ident(tn.nspname) || '.'
                ELSE ''
            END || pg_catalog.format_type(t.oid, t.typtypmod)
      FROM pg_catalog.pg_type d
      JOIN pg_catalog.pg_namespace dn ON d.typnamespace = dn.oid
      JOIN pg_catalog.pg_type t       ON d.typbasetype  = t.oid
      JOIN pg_catalog.pg_namespace tn ON t.typnamespace = tn.oid
     WHERE d.typisdefined
       AND dn.nspname = $1
       AND d.typname  = LOWER($2)
       AND d.typtype  = 'd'

Function: public._get_fdw_privs(name, text)

Returns: text[]

Language: PLPGSQL

BEGIN
    IF pg_catalog.has_foreign_data_wrapper_privilege($1, $2, 'USAGE') THEN
        RETURN '{USAGE}';
    ELSE
        RETURN '{}';
    END IF;
EXCEPTION WHEN undefined_object THEN
    -- Same error code for unknown user or fdw. So figure out which.
    RETURN CASE WHEN SQLERRM LIKE '%' || $1 || '%' THEN
        '{undefined_role}'
    ELSE
        '{undefined_fdw}'
    END;
END;

Function: public._get_func_owner(name, name, name[])

Returns: name

Language: SQL

    SELECT owner
      FROM tap_funky
     WHERE schema = $1
       AND name   = $2
       AND args   = array_to_string($3, ',')

Function: public._get_func_owner(name, name[])

Returns: name

Language: SQL

    SELECT owner
      FROM tap_funky
     WHERE name = $1
       AND args = array_to_string($2, ',')
       AND is_visible

Function: public._get_func_privs(text, text)

Returns: text[]

Language: PLPGSQL

BEGIN
    IF pg_catalog.has_function_privilege($1, $2, 'EXECUTE') THEN
        RETURN '{EXECUTE}';
    ELSE
        RETURN '{}';
    END IF;
EXCEPTION
    -- Not a valid func name.
    WHEN undefined_function THEN RETURN '{undefined_function}';
    -- Not a valid role.
    WHEN undefined_object   THEN RETURN '{undefined_role}';
END;

Function: public._get_index_owner(name, name)

Returns: name

Language: SQL

    SELECT pg_catalog.pg_get_userbyid(ci.relowner)
      FROM pg_catalog.pg_index x
      JOIN pg_catalog.pg_class ct    ON ct.oid = x.indrelid
      JOIN pg_catalog.pg_class ci    ON ci.oid = x.indexrelid
     WHERE ct.relname = $1
       AND ci.relname = $2
       AND pg_catalog.pg_table_is_visible(ct.oid);

Function: public._get_index_owner(name, name, name)

Returns: name

Language: SQL

    SELECT pg_catalog.pg_get_userbyid(ci.relowner)
      FROM pg_catalog.pg_index x
      JOIN pg_catalog.pg_class ct    ON ct.oid = x.indrelid
      JOIN pg_catalog.pg_class ci    ON ci.oid = x.indexrelid
      JOIN pg_catalog.pg_namespace n ON n.oid = ct.relnamespace
     WHERE n.nspname  = $1
       AND ct.relname = $2
       AND ci.relname = $3;

Function: public._get_lang_privs(name, text)

Returns: text[]

Language: PLPGSQL

BEGIN
    IF pg_catalog.has_language_privilege($1, $2, 'USAGE') THEN
        RETURN '{USAGE}';
    ELSE
        RETURN '{}';
    END IF;
EXCEPTION WHEN undefined_object THEN
    -- Same error code for unknown user or language. So figure out which.
    RETURN CASE WHEN SQLERRM LIKE '%' || $1 || '%' THEN
        '{undefined_role}'
    ELSE
        '{undefined_language}'
    END;
END;

Function: public._get_language_owner(name)

Returns: name

Language: SQL

    SELECT pg_catalog.pg_get_userbyid(lanowner)
      FROM pg_catalog.pg_language
     WHERE lanname = $1;

Function: public._get_latest(text)

Returns: integer[]

Language: PLPGSQL

DECLARE
    ret integer[];
BEGIN
    EXECUTE 'SELECT ARRAY[id, value] FROM __tcache__ WHERE label = ' ||
    quote_literal($1) || ' AND id = (SELECT MAX(id) FROM __tcache__ WHERE label = ' ||
    quote_literal($1) || ') LIMIT 1' INTO ret;
    RETURN ret;
EXCEPTION WHEN undefined_table THEN
   RAISE EXCEPTION 'You tried to run a test without a plan! Gotta have a plan';
END;

Function: public._get_latest(text, integer)

Returns: integer

Language: PLPGSQL

DECLARE
    ret integer;
BEGIN
    EXECUTE 'SELECT MAX(id) FROM __tcache__ WHERE label = ' ||
    quote_literal($1) || ' AND value = ' || $2 INTO ret;
    RETURN ret;
END;

Function: public._get_note(integer)

Returns: text

Language: PLPGSQL

DECLARE
    ret text;
BEGIN
    EXECUTE 'SELECT note FROM __tcache__ WHERE id = ' || $1 || ' LIMIT 1' INTO ret;
    RETURN ret;
END;

Function: public._get_note(text)

Returns: text

Language: PLPGSQL

DECLARE
    ret text;
BEGIN
    EXECUTE 'SELECT note FROM __tcache__ WHERE label = ' || quote_literal($1) || ' LIMIT 1' INTO ret;
    RETURN ret;
END;

Function: public._get_opclass_owner(name)

Returns: name

Language: SQL

    SELECT pg_catalog.pg_get_userbyid(opcowner)
      FROM pg_catalog.pg_opclass
     WHERE opcname = $1
       AND pg_catalog.pg_opclass_is_visible(oid);

Function: public._get_opclass_owner(name, name)

Returns: name

Language: SQL

    SELECT pg_catalog.pg_get_userbyid(opcowner)
      FROM pg_catalog.pg_opclass oc
      JOIN pg_catalog.pg_namespace n ON oc.opcnamespace = n.oid
     WHERE n.nspname = $1
       AND opcname   = $2;

Function: public._get_rel_owner(bpchar, name)

Returns: name

Language: SQL

    SELECT _get_rel_owner(ARRAY[$1], $2);

Function: public._get_rel_owner(bpchar, name, name)

Returns: name

Language: SQL

    SELECT _get_rel_owner(ARRAY[$1], $2, $3);

Function: public._get_rel_owner(bpchar[], name)

Returns: name

Language: SQL

    SELECT pg_catalog.pg_get_userbyid(c.relowner)
      FROM pg_catalog.pg_class c
     WHERE c.relkind = ANY($1)
       AND c.relname = $2
       AND pg_catalog.pg_table_is_visible(c.oid)

Function: public._get_rel_owner(bpchar[], name, name)

Returns: name

Language: SQL

    SELECT pg_catalog.pg_get_userbyid(c.relowner)
      FROM pg_catalog.pg_class c
      JOIN pg_catalog.pg_namespace n ON n.oid = c.relnamespace
     WHERE c.relkind = ANY($1)
       AND n.nspname = $2
       AND c.relname = $3

Function: public._get_rel_owner(name)

Returns: name

Language: SQL

    SELECT pg_catalog.pg_get_userbyid(c.relowner)
      FROM pg_catalog.pg_class c
     WHERE c.relname = $1
       AND pg_catalog.pg_table_is_visible(c.oid)

Function: public._get_rel_owner(name, name)

Returns: name

Language: SQL

    SELECT pg_catalog.pg_get_userbyid(c.relowner)
      FROM pg_catalog.pg_class c
      JOIN pg_catalog.pg_namespace n ON n.oid = c.relnamespace
     WHERE n.nspname = $1
       AND c.relname = $2

Function: public._get_schema_owner(name)

Returns: name

Language: SQL

    SELECT pg_catalog.pg_get_userbyid(nspowner)
      FROM pg_catalog.pg_namespace
     WHERE nspname = $1;

Function: public._get_schema_privs(name, text)

Returns: text[]

Language: PLPGSQL

DECLARE
    privs  TEXT[] := ARRAY['CREATE', 'USAGE'];
    grants TEXT[] := '{}';
BEGIN
    FOR i IN 1..array_upper(privs, 1) LOOP
        IF pg_catalog.has_schema_privilege($1, $2, privs[i]) THEN
            grants := grants || privs[i];
        END IF;
    END LOOP;
    RETURN grants;
EXCEPTION
    -- Not a valid schema name.
    WHEN invalid_schema_name THEN RETURN '{invalid_schema_name}';
    -- Not a valid role.
    WHEN undefined_object   THEN RETURN '{undefined_role}';
END;

Function: public._get_sequence_privs(name, text)

Returns: text[]

Language: PLPGSQL

DECLARE
    privs  TEXT[] := ARRAY['SELECT', 'UPDATE', 'USAGE'];
    grants TEXT[] := '{}';
BEGIN
    FOR i IN 1..array_upper(privs, 1) LOOP
        BEGIN
            IF pg_catalog.has_sequence_privilege($1, $2, privs[i]) THEN
                grants := grants || privs[i];
            END IF;
        EXCEPTION WHEN undefined_table THEN
            -- Not a valid sequence name.
            RETURN '{undefined_table}';
        WHEN undefined_object THEN
            -- Not a valid role.
            RETURN '{undefined_role}';
        WHEN invalid_parameter_value THEN
            -- Not a valid permission on this version of PostgreSQL; ignore;
        END;
    END LOOP;
    RETURN grants;
END;

Function: public._get_server_privs(name, text)

Returns: text[]

Language: PLPGSQL

BEGIN
    IF pg_catalog.has_server_privilege($1, $2, 'USAGE') THEN
        RETURN '{USAGE}';
    ELSE
        RETURN '{}';
    END IF;
EXCEPTION WHEN undefined_object THEN
    -- Same error code for unknown user or server. So figure out which.
    RETURN CASE WHEN SQLERRM LIKE '%' || $1 || '%' THEN
        '{undefined_role}'
    ELSE
        '{undefined_server}'
    END;
END;

Function: public._get_table_privs(name, text)

Returns: text[]

Language: PLPGSQL

DECLARE
    privs  TEXT[] := _table_privs();
    grants TEXT[] := '{}';
BEGIN
    FOR i IN 1..array_upper(privs, 1) LOOP
        BEGIN
            IF pg_catalog.has_table_privilege($1, $2, privs[i]) THEN
                grants := grants || privs[i];
            END IF;
        EXCEPTION WHEN undefined_table THEN
            -- Not a valid table name.
            RETURN '{undefined_table}';
        WHEN undefined_object THEN
            -- Not a valid role.
            RETURN '{undefined_role}';
        WHEN invalid_parameter_value THEN
            -- Not a valid permission on this version of PostgreSQL; ignore;
        END;
    END LOOP;
    RETURN grants;
END;

Function: public._get_tablespace_owner(name)

Returns: name

Language: SQL

    SELECT pg_catalog.pg_get_userbyid(spcowner)
      FROM pg_catalog.pg_tablespace
     WHERE spcname = $1;

Function: public._get_tablespaceprivs(name, text)

Returns: text[]

Language: PLPGSQL

BEGIN
    IF pg_catalog.has_tablespace_privilege($1, $2, 'CREATE') THEN
        RETURN '{CREATE}';
    ELSE
        RETURN '{}';
    END IF;
EXCEPTION WHEN undefined_object THEN
    -- Same error code for unknown user or tablespace. So figure out which.
    RETURN CASE WHEN SQLERRM LIKE '%' || $1 || '%' THEN
        '{undefined_role}'
    ELSE
        '{undefined_tablespace}'
    END;
END;

Function: public._get_type_owner(name)

Returns: name

Language: SQL

    SELECT pg_catalog.pg_get_userbyid(typowner)
      FROM pg_catalog.pg_type
     WHERE typname = $1
       AND pg_catalog.pg_type_is_visible(oid)

Function: public._get_type_owner(name, name)

Returns: name

Language: SQL

    SELECT pg_catalog.pg_get_userbyid(t.typowner)
      FROM pg_catalog.pg_type t
      JOIN pg_catalog.pg_namespace n ON n.oid = t.typnamespace
     WHERE n.nspname = $1
       AND t.typname = $2

Function: public._got_func(name)

Returns: boolean

Language: SQL

    SELECT EXISTS( SELECT TRUE FROM tap_funky WHERE name = $1 AND is_visible);

Function: public._got_func(name, name)

Returns: boolean

Language: SQL

    SELECT EXISTS( SELECT TRUE FROM tap_funky WHERE schema = $1 AND name = $2 );

Function: public._got_func(name, name, name[])

Returns: boolean

Language: SQL

    SELECT EXISTS(
        SELECT TRUE
          FROM tap_funky
         WHERE schema = $1
           AND name   = $2
           AND args = _funkargs($3)
    );

Function: public._got_func(name, name[])

Returns: boolean

Language: SQL

    SELECT EXISTS(
        SELECT TRUE
          FROM tap_funky
         WHERE name = $1
           AND args = _funkargs($2)
           AND is_visible
    );

Function: public._grolist(name)

Returns: oid[]

Language: SQL

    SELECT ARRAY(
        SELECT member
          FROM pg_catalog.pg_auth_members m
          JOIN pg_catalog.pg_roles r ON m.roleid = r.oid
         WHERE r.rolname =  $1
    );

Function: public._has_def(name, name)

Returns: boolean

Language: SQL

    SELECT a.atthasdef
      FROM pg_catalog.pg_class c
      JOIN pg_catalog.pg_attribute a ON c.oid = a.attrelid
     WHERE c.relname = $1
       AND a.attnum > 0
       AND NOT a.attisdropped
       AND a.attname = $2
       AND pg_catalog.pg_table_is_visible(c.oid)

Function: public._has_def(name, name, name)

Returns: boolean

Language: SQL

    SELECT a.atthasdef
      FROM pg_catalog.pg_namespace n
      JOIN pg_catalog.pg_class c ON n.oid = c.relnamespace
      JOIN pg_catalog.pg_attribute a ON c.oid = a.attrelid
     WHERE n.nspname = $1
       AND c.relname = $2
       AND a.attnum > 0
       AND NOT a.attisdropped
       AND a.attname = $3

Function: public._has_group(name)

Returns: boolean

Language: SQL

    SELECT EXISTS(
        SELECT true
          FROM pg_catalog.pg_group
         WHERE groname = $1
    );

Function: public._has_role(name)

Returns: boolean

Language: SQL

    SELECT EXISTS(
        SELECT true
          FROM pg_catalog.pg_roles
         WHERE rolname = $1
    );

Function: public._has_type(name, bpchar[])

Returns: boolean

Language: SQL

    SELECT EXISTS(
        SELECT true
          FROM pg_catalog.pg_type t
         WHERE t.typisdefined
           AND pg_catalog.pg_type_is_visible(t.oid)
           AND t.typname = $1
           AND t.typtype = ANY( COALESCE($2, ARRAY['b', 'c', 'd', 'p', 'e']) )
    );

Function: public._has_type(name, name, bpchar[])

Returns: boolean

Language: SQL

    SELECT EXISTS(
        SELECT true
          FROM pg_catalog.pg_type t
          JOIN pg_catalog.pg_namespace n ON t.typnamespace = n.oid
         WHERE t.typisdefined
           AND n.nspname = $1
           AND t.typname = $2
           AND t.typtype = ANY( COALESCE($3, ARRAY['b', 'c', 'd', 'p', 'e']) )
    );

Function: public._has_user(name)

Returns: boolean

Language: SQL

    SELECT EXISTS( SELECT true FROM pg_catalog.pg_user WHERE usename = $1);

Function: public._hasc(name, bpchar)

Returns: boolean

Language: SQL

    SELECT EXISTS(
            SELECT true
              FROM pg_catalog.pg_class c
              JOIN pg_catalog.pg_constraint x ON c.oid = x.conrelid
             WHERE pg_table_is_visible(c.oid)
               AND c.relname = $1
               AND x.contype = $2
    );

Function: public._hasc(name, name, bpchar)

Returns: boolean

Language: SQL

    SELECT EXISTS(
            SELECT true
              FROM pg_catalog.pg_namespace n
              JOIN pg_catalog.pg_class c      ON c.relnamespace = n.oid
              JOIN pg_catalog.pg_constraint x ON c.oid = x.conrelid
             WHERE n.nspname = $1
               AND c.relname = $2
               AND x.contype = $3
    );

Function: public._have_index(name, name)

Returns: boolean

Language: SQL

    SELECT EXISTS (
    SELECT TRUE
      FROM pg_catalog.pg_index x
      JOIN pg_catalog.pg_class ct    ON ct.oid = x.indrelid
      JOIN pg_catalog.pg_class ci    ON ci.oid = x.indexrelid
     WHERE ct.relname = $1
       AND ci.relname = $2
       AND pg_catalog.pg_table_is_visible(ct.oid)
    );

Function: public._have_index(name, name, name)

Returns: boolean

Language: SQL

    SELECT EXISTS (
    SELECT TRUE
      FROM pg_catalog.pg_index x
      JOIN pg_catalog.pg_class ct    ON ct.oid = x.indrelid
      JOIN pg_catalog.pg_class ci    ON ci.oid = x.indexrelid
      JOIN pg_catalog.pg_namespace n ON n.oid = ct.relnamespace
     WHERE n.nspname  = $1
       AND ct.relname = $2
       AND ci.relname = $3
    );

Function: public._ident_array_to_sorted_string(name[], text)

Returns: text

Language: SQL

    SELECT array_to_string(ARRAY(
        SELECT quote_ident($1[i])
          FROM generate_series(1, array_upper($1, 1)) s(i)
         ORDER BY $1[i]
    ), $2);

Function: public._ident_array_to_string(name[], text)

Returns: text

Language: SQL

    SELECT array_to_string(ARRAY(
        SELECT quote_ident($1[i])
          FROM generate_series(1, array_upper($1, 1)) s(i)
         ORDER BY i
    ), $2);

Function: public._ikeys(name, name)

Returns: text[]

Language: SQL

    SELECT ARRAY(
        SELECT pg_catalog.pg_get_indexdef( ci.oid, s.i + 1, false)
          FROM pg_catalog.pg_index x
          JOIN pg_catalog.pg_class ct    ON ct.oid = x.indrelid
          JOIN pg_catalog.pg_class ci    ON ci.oid = x.indexrelid
          JOIN generate_series(0, current_setting('max_index_keys')::int - 1) s(i)
            ON x.indkey[s.i] IS NOT NULL
         WHERE ct.relname = $1
           AND ci.relname = $2
           AND pg_catalog.pg_table_is_visible(ct.oid)
         ORDER BY s.i
    );

Function: public._ikeys(name, name, name)

Returns: text[]

Language: SQL

    SELECT ARRAY(
        SELECT pg_catalog.pg_get_indexdef( ci.oid, s.i + 1, false)
          FROM pg_catalog.pg_index x
          JOIN pg_catalog.pg_class ct    ON ct.oid = x.indrelid
          JOIN pg_catalog.pg_class ci    ON ci.oid = x.indexrelid
          JOIN pg_catalog.pg_namespace n ON n.oid = ct.relnamespace
          JOIN generate_series(0, current_setting('max_index_keys')::int - 1) s(i)
            ON x.indkey[s.i] IS NOT NULL
         WHERE ct.relname = $2
           AND ci.relname = $3
           AND n.nspname  = $1
         ORDER BY s.i
    );

Function: public._inherited(name)

Returns: boolean

Language: SQL

    SELECT EXISTS(
        SELECT true
          FROM pg_catalog.pg_class c
         WHERE c.relkind = 'r'
           AND pg_catalog.pg_table_is_visible( c.oid )
           AND c.relname = $1
           AND c.relhassubclass = true
    );

Function: public._inherited(name, name)

Returns: boolean

Language: SQL

    SELECT EXISTS(
        SELECT true
          FROM pg_catalog.pg_namespace n
          JOIN pg_catalog.pg_class c ON n.oid = c.relnamespace
         WHERE c.relkind = 'r'
           AND n.nspname = $1
           AND c.relname = $2
           AND c.relhassubclass = true
  );

Function: public._is_indexed(name, name, text[])

Returns: boolean

Language: SQL

SELECT EXISTS( SELECT TRUE FROM (
        SELECT _ikeys(coalesce($1, n.nspname), $2, ci.relname) AS cols
          FROM pg_catalog.pg_index x
          JOIN pg_catalog.pg_class ct    ON ct.oid = x.indrelid
          JOIN pg_catalog.pg_class ci    ON ci.oid = x.indexrelid
          JOIN pg_catalog.pg_namespace n ON n.oid = ct.relnamespace
         WHERE ($1 IS NULL OR n.nspname  = $1)
           AND ct.relname = $2
    ) icols
    WHERE cols = $3 )

Function: public._is_instead(name, name)

Returns: boolean

Language: SQL

    SELECT r.is_instead
      FROM pg_catalog.pg_rewrite r
      JOIN pg_catalog.pg_class c     ON c.oid = r.ev_class
     WHERE r.rulename = $2
       AND c.relname  = $1
       AND pg_catalog.pg_table_is_visible(c.oid)

Function: public._is_instead(name, name, name)

Returns: boolean

Language: SQL

    SELECT r.is_instead
      FROM pg_catalog.pg_rewrite r
      JOIN pg_catalog.pg_class c     ON c.oid = r.ev_class
      JOIN pg_catalog.pg_namespace n ON c.relnamespace = n.oid
     WHERE r.rulename = $3
       AND c.relname  = $2
       AND n.nspname  = $1

Function: public._is_schema(name)

Returns: boolean

Language: SQL

    SELECT EXISTS(
        SELECT true
          FROM pg_catalog.pg_namespace
          WHERE nspname = $1
    );

Function: public._is_super(name)

Returns: boolean

Language: SQL

    SELECT rolsuper
      FROM pg_catalog.pg_roles
     WHERE rolname = $1

Function: public._is_trusted(name)

Returns: boolean

Language: SQL

    SELECT lanpltrusted FROM pg_catalog.pg_language WHERE lanname = $1;

Function: public._is_verbose()

Returns: boolean

Language: SQL

    SELECT current_setting('client_min_messages') NOT IN (
        'warning', 'error', 'fatal', 'panic'
    );

Function: public._keys(name, bpchar)

Returns: SET OF name[]

Language: SQL

    SELECT _pg_sv_column_array(x.conrelid,x.conkey) -- name[] doesn't support collation
      FROM pg_catalog.pg_class c
      JOIN pg_catalog.pg_constraint x  ON c.oid = x.conrelid
       AND c.relname = $1
       AND x.contype = $2
     WHERE pg_catalog.pg_table_is_visible(c.oid)
  ORDER BY 1

Function: public._keys(name, name, bpchar)

Returns: SET OF name[]

Language: SQL

    SELECT _pg_sv_column_array(x.conrelid,x.conkey) -- name[] doesn't support collation
      FROM pg_catalog.pg_namespace n
      JOIN pg_catalog.pg_class c       ON n.oid = c.relnamespace
      JOIN pg_catalog.pg_constraint x  ON c.oid = x.conrelid
     WHERE n.nspname = $1
       AND c.relname = $2
       AND x.contype = $3
  ORDER BY 1

Function: public._lang(name)

Returns: name

Language: SQL

    SELECT l.lanname
      FROM tap_funky f
      JOIN pg_catalog.pg_language l ON f.langoid = l.oid
     WHERE f.name = $1
       AND f.is_visible;

Function: public._lang(name, name)

Returns: name

Language: SQL

    SELECT l.lanname
      FROM tap_funky f
      JOIN pg_catalog.pg_language l ON f.langoid = l.oid
     WHERE f.schema = $1
       and f.name   = $2

Function: public._lang(name, name, name[])

Returns: name

Language: SQL

    SELECT l.lanname
      FROM tap_funky f
      JOIN pg_catalog.pg_language l ON f.langoid = l.oid
     WHERE f.schema = $1
       and f.name   = $2
       AND f.args   = array_to_string($3, ',')

Function: public._lang(name, name[])

Returns: name

Language: SQL

    SELECT l.lanname
      FROM tap_funky f
      JOIN pg_catalog.pg_language l ON f.langoid = l.oid
     WHERE f.name = $1
       AND f.args = array_to_string($2, ',')
       AND f.is_visible;

Function: public._missing(bpchar, name, name[])

Returns: name[]

Language: SQL

    SELECT _missing(ARRAY[$1], $2, $3);

Function: public._missing(bpchar, name[])

Returns: name[]

Language: SQL

    SELECT _missing(ARRAY[$1], $2);

Function: public._missing(bpchar[], name, name[])

Returns: name[]

Language: SQL

    SELECT ARRAY(
        SELECT $3[i]
          FROM generate_series(1, array_upper($3, 1)) s(i)
        EXCEPT
        SELECT c.relname
          FROM pg_catalog.pg_namespace n
          JOIN pg_catalog.pg_class c ON n.oid = c.relnamespace
         WHERE c.relkind = ANY($1)
           AND n.nspname = $2
    );

Function: public._missing(bpchar[], name[])

Returns: name[]

Language: SQL

    SELECT ARRAY(
        SELECT $2[i]
          FROM generate_series(1, array_upper($2, 1)) s(i)
        EXCEPT
        SELECT c.relname
          FROM pg_catalog.pg_namespace n
          JOIN pg_catalog.pg_class c ON n.oid = c.relnamespace
         WHERE pg_catalog.pg_table_is_visible(c.oid)
           AND n.nspname NOT IN ('pg_catalog', 'information_schema')
           AND c.relkind = ANY($1)
    );

Function: public._nosuch(name, name, name[])

Returns: text

Language: SQL

    SELECT E'\n' || diag(
        '    Function '
          || CASE WHEN $1 IS NOT NULL THEN quote_ident($1) || '.' ELSE '' END
          || quote_ident($2) || '('
          || array_to_string($3, ', ') || ') does not exist'
    );

Function: public._op_exists(name, name, name)

Returns: boolean

Language: SQL

    SELECT EXISTS (
       SELECT TRUE
         FROM pg_catalog.pg_operator o
        WHERE pg_catalog.pg_operator_is_visible(o.oid)
          AND o.oprname = $2
          AND CASE o.oprkind WHEN 'l' THEN $1 IS NULL
              ELSE _cmp_types(o.oprleft, $1) END
          AND CASE o.oprkind WHEN 'r' THEN $3 IS NULL
              ELSE _cmp_types(o.oprright, $3) END
   );

Function: public._op_exists(name, name, name, name)

Returns: boolean

Language: SQL

    SELECT EXISTS (
       SELECT TRUE
         FROM pg_catalog.pg_operator o
        WHERE pg_catalog.pg_operator_is_visible(o.oid)
          AND o.oprname = $2
          AND CASE o.oprkind WHEN 'l' THEN $1 IS NULL
              ELSE _cmp_types(o.oprleft, $1) END
          AND CASE o.oprkind WHEN 'r' THEN $3 IS NULL
              ELSE _cmp_types(o.oprright, $3) END
          AND _cmp_types(o.oprresult, $4)
   );

Function: public._op_exists(name, name, name, name, name)

Returns: boolean

Language: SQL

    SELECT EXISTS (
       SELECT TRUE
         FROM pg_catalog.pg_operator o
         JOIN pg_catalog.pg_namespace n ON o.oprnamespace = n.oid
        WHERE n.nspname = $2
          AND o.oprname = $3
          AND CASE o.oprkind WHEN 'l' THEN $1 IS NULL
              ELSE _cmp_types(o.oprleft, $1) END
          AND CASE o.oprkind WHEN 'r' THEN $4 IS NULL
              ELSE _cmp_types(o.oprright, $4) END
          AND _cmp_types(o.oprresult, $5)
   );

Function: public._opc_exists(name)

Returns: boolean

Language: SQL

    SELECT EXISTS (
        SELECT TRUE
          FROM pg_catalog.pg_opclass oc
         WHERE oc.opcname = $1
           AND pg_opclass_is_visible(oid)
    );

Function: public._opc_exists(name, name)

Returns: boolean

Language: SQL

    SELECT EXISTS (
        SELECT TRUE
          FROM pg_catalog.pg_opclass oc
          JOIN pg_catalog.pg_namespace n ON oc.opcnamespace = n.oid
         WHERE n.nspname  = $1
           AND oc.opcname = $2
    );

Function: public._partof(name, name)

Returns: boolean

Language: SQL

    SELECT EXISTS(
        SELECT true
          FROM pg_catalog.pg_class cc
          JOIN pg_catalog.pg_inherits i ON cc.oid = i.inhrelid
          JOIN pg_catalog.pg_class pc ON i.inhparent = pc.oid
         WHERE cc.relname = $1
           AND cc.relispartition
           AND pc.relname = $2
           AND pc.relkind = 'p'
           AND pg_catalog.pg_table_is_visible(cc.oid)
           AND pg_catalog.pg_table_is_visible(pc.oid)
    )

Function: public._partof(name, name, name, name)

Returns: boolean

Language: SQL

    SELECT EXISTS(
        SELECT true
          FROM pg_catalog.pg_namespace cn
          JOIN pg_catalog.pg_class cc ON cn.oid = cc.relnamespace
          JOIN pg_catalog.pg_inherits i ON cc.oid = i.inhrelid
          JOIN pg_catalog.pg_class pc ON i.inhparent = pc.oid
          JOIN pg_catalog.pg_namespace pn ON pc.relnamespace = pn.oid
         WHERE cn.nspname = $1
           AND cc.relname = $2
           AND cc.relispartition
           AND pn.nspname = $3
           AND pc.relname = $4
           AND pc.relkind = 'p'
    )

Function: public._parts(name)

Returns: SET OF name

Language: SQL

    SELECT i.inhrelid::regclass::name
      FROM pg_catalog.pg_class c
      JOIN pg_catalog.pg_inherits i ON c.oid = i.inhparent
     WHERE c.relname = $1
       AND c.relkind = 'p'
       AND pg_catalog.pg_table_is_visible(c.oid)

Function: public._parts(name, name)

Returns: SET OF name

Language: SQL

    SELECT i.inhrelid::regclass::name
      FROM pg_catalog.pg_namespace n
      JOIN pg_catalog.pg_class c ON n.oid = c.relnamespace
      JOIN pg_catalog.pg_inherits i ON c.oid = i.inhparent
     WHERE n.nspname = $1
       AND c.relname = $2
       AND c.relkind = 'p'

Function: public._pg_sv_column_array(oid, smallint[])

Returns: name[]

Language: SQL

    SELECT ARRAY(
        SELECT a.attname
          FROM pg_catalog.pg_attribute a
          JOIN generate_series(1, array_upper($2, 1)) s(i) ON a.attnum = $2[i]
         WHERE attrelid = $1
         ORDER BY i
    )

Function: public._pg_sv_table_accessible(oid, oid)

Returns: boolean

Language: SQL

    SELECT CASE WHEN has_schema_privilege($1, 'USAGE') THEN (
                  has_table_privilege($2, 'SELECT')
               OR has_table_privilege($2, 'INSERT')
               or has_table_privilege($2, 'UPDATE')
               OR has_table_privilege($2, 'DELETE')
               OR has_table_privilege($2, 'RULE')
               OR has_table_privilege($2, 'REFERENCES')
               OR has_table_privilege($2, 'TRIGGER')
           ) ELSE FALSE
    END;

Function: public._pg_sv_type_array(oid[])

Returns: name[]

Language: SQL

    SELECT ARRAY(
        SELECT t.typname
          FROM pg_catalog.pg_type t
          JOIN generate_series(1, array_upper($1, 1)) s(i) ON t.oid = $1[i]
         ORDER BY i
    )

Function: public._prokind(p_oid oid)

Returns: "char"

Language: PLPGSQL

BEGIN
    IF pg_version_num() >= 110000 THEN
        RETURN prokind FROM pg_catalog.pg_proc WHERE oid = p_oid;
    ELSE
        RETURN CASE WHEN proisagg THEN 'a' WHEN proiswindow THEN 'w' ELSE 'f' END
            FROM pg_catalog.pg_proc WHERE oid = p_oid;
    END IF;
END;

Function: public._query(text)

Returns: text

Language: SQL

    SELECT CASE
        WHEN $1 LIKE '"%' OR $1 !~ '[[:space:]]' THEN 'EXECUTE ' || $1
        ELSE $1
    END;

Function: public._quote_ident_like(text, text)

Returns: text

Language: PLPGSQL

DECLARE
    have    TEXT;
    pcision TEXT;
BEGIN
    -- Just return it if rhs isn't quoted.
    IF $2 !~ '"' THEN RETURN $1; END IF;

    -- If it's quoted ident without precision, return it quoted.
    IF $2 ~ '"$' THEN RETURN quote_ident($1); END IF;

    pcision := substring($1 FROM '[(][^")]+[)]$');

    -- Just quote it if thre is no precision.
    if pcision IS NULL THEN RETURN quote_ident($1); END IF;

    -- Quote the non-precision part and concatenate with precision.
    RETURN quote_ident(substring($1 FOR char_length($1) - char_length(pcision)))
        || pcision;
END;

Function: public._refine_vol(text)

Returns: text

Language: SQL

    SELECT _expand_vol(substring(LOWER($1) FROM 1 FOR 1)::char);

Function: public._relcomp(text, anyarray, text, text)

Returns: text

Language: SQL

    SELECT _docomp(
        _temptable( $1, '__taphave__' ),
        _temptable( $2, '__tapwant__' ),
        $3, $4
    );

Function: public._relcomp(text, text, text, text)

Returns: text

Language: SQL

    SELECT _docomp(
        _temptable( $1, '__taphave__' ),
        _temptable( $2, '__tapwant__' ),
        $3, $4
    );

Function: public._relcomp(text, text, text, text, text)

Returns: text

Language: PLPGSQL

DECLARE
    have    TEXT    := _temptable( $1, '__taphave__' );
    want    TEXT    := _temptable( $2, '__tapwant__' );
    results TEXT[]  := '{}';
    res     BOOLEAN := TRUE;
    msg     TEXT    := '';
    rec     RECORD;
BEGIN
    BEGIN
        -- Find relevant records.
        FOR rec in EXECUTE 'SELECT * FROM ' || want || ' ' || $4
                       || ' SELECT * FROM ' || have LOOP
            results := results || rec::text;
        END LOOP;

        -- Drop the temporary tables.
        EXECUTE 'DROP TABLE ' || have;
        EXECUTE 'DROP TABLE ' || want;
    EXCEPTION WHEN syntax_error OR datatype_mismatch THEN
        msg := E'\n' || diag(
            E'    Columns differ between queries:\n'
            || '        have: (' || _temptypes(have) || E')\n'
            || '        want: (' || _temptypes(want) || ')'
        );
        EXECUTE 'DROP TABLE ' || have;
        EXECUTE 'DROP TABLE ' || want;
        RETURN ok(FALSE, $3) || msg;
    END;

    -- What records do we have?
    IF results[1] IS NOT NULL THEN
        res := FALSE;
        msg := msg || E'\n' || diag(
            '    ' || $5 || E' records:\n        '
            ||  array_to_string( results, E'\n        ' )
        );
    END IF;

    RETURN ok(res, $3) || msg;
END;

Function: public._relexists(name)

Returns: boolean

Language: SQL

    SELECT EXISTS(
        SELECT true
          FROM pg_catalog.pg_class c
         WHERE pg_catalog.pg_table_is_visible(c.oid)
           AND c.relname = $1
    );

Function: public._relexists(name, name)

Returns: boolean

Language: SQL

    SELECT EXISTS(
        SELECT true
          FROM pg_catalog.pg_namespace n
          JOIN pg_catalog.pg_class c ON n.oid = c.relnamespace
         WHERE n.nspname = $1
           AND c.relname = $2
    );

Function: public._relne(text, anyarray, text, text)

Returns: text

Language: SQL

    SELECT _do_ne(
        _temptable( $1, '__taphave__' ),
        _temptable( $2, '__tapwant__' ),
        $3, $4
    );

Function: public._relne(text, text, text, text)

Returns: text

Language: SQL

    SELECT _do_ne(
        _temptable( $1, '__taphave__' ),
        _temptable( $2, '__tapwant__' ),
        $3, $4
    );

Function: public._returns(name)

Returns: text

Language: SQL

    SELECT returns FROM tap_funky WHERE name = $1 AND is_visible;

Function: public._returns(name, name)

Returns: text

Language: SQL

    SELECT returns FROM tap_funky WHERE schema = $1 AND name = $2

Function: public._returns(name, name, name[])

Returns: text

Language: SQL

    SELECT returns
      FROM tap_funky
     WHERE schema = $1
       AND name   = $2
       AND args   = array_to_string($3, ',')

Function: public._returns(name, name[])

Returns: text

Language: SQL

    SELECT returns
      FROM tap_funky
     WHERE name = $1
       AND args = array_to_string($2, ',')
       AND is_visible;

Function: public._rexists(bpchar, name)

Returns: boolean

Language: SQL

SELECT _rexists(ARRAY[$1], $2);

Function: public._rexists(bpchar, name, name)

Returns: boolean

Language: SQL

    SELECT _rexists(ARRAY[$1], $2, $3);

Function: public._rexists(bpchar[], name)

Returns: boolean

Language: SQL

    SELECT EXISTS(
        SELECT true
          FROM pg_catalog.pg_class c
         WHERE c.relkind = ANY($1)
           AND pg_catalog.pg_table_is_visible(c.oid)
           AND c.relname = $2
    );

Function: public._rexists(bpchar[], name, name)

Returns: boolean

Language: SQL

    SELECT EXISTS(
        SELECT true
          FROM pg_catalog.pg_namespace n
          JOIN pg_catalog.pg_class c ON n.oid = c.relnamespace
         WHERE c.relkind = ANY($1)
           AND n.nspname = $2
           AND c.relname = $3
    );

Function: public._rule_on(name, name)

Returns: "char"

Language: SQL

    SELECT r.ev_type
      FROM pg_catalog.pg_rewrite r
      JOIN pg_catalog.pg_class c     ON c.oid = r.ev_class
     WHERE r.rulename = $2
       AND c.relname  = $1

Function: public._rule_on(name, name, name)

Returns: "char"

Language: SQL

    SELECT r.ev_type
      FROM pg_catalog.pg_rewrite r
      JOIN pg_catalog.pg_class c     ON c.oid = r.ev_class
      JOIN pg_catalog.pg_namespace n ON c.relnamespace = n.oid
     WHERE r.rulename = $3
       AND c.relname  = $2
       AND n.nspname  = $1

Function: public._runem(text[], boolean)

Returns: SET OF text

Language: PLPGSQL

DECLARE
    tap    text;
    lbound int := array_lower($1, 1);
BEGIN
    IF lbound IS NULL THEN RETURN; END IF;
    FOR i IN lbound..array_upper($1, 1) LOOP
        -- Send the name of the function to diag if warranted.
        IF $2 THEN RETURN NEXT diag( $1[i] || '()' ); END IF;
        -- Execute the tap function and return its results.
        FOR tap IN EXECUTE 'SELECT * FROM ' || $1[i] || '()' LOOP
            RETURN NEXT tap;
        END LOOP;
    END LOOP;
    RETURN;
END;

Function: public._runner(text[], text[], text[], text[], text[])

Returns: SET OF text

Language: PLPGSQL

DECLARE
    startup  ALIAS FOR $1;
    shutdown ALIAS FOR $2;
    setup    ALIAS FOR $3;
    teardown ALIAS FOR $4;
    tests    ALIAS FOR $5;
    tap      TEXT;
    tfaild   INTEGER := 0;
    ffaild   INTEGER := 0;
    tnumb    INTEGER := 0;
    fnumb    INTEGER := 0;
    tok      BOOLEAN := TRUE;
BEGIN
    BEGIN
        -- No plan support.
        PERFORM * FROM no_plan();
        FOR tap IN SELECT * FROM _runem(startup, false) LOOP RETURN NEXT tap; END LOOP;
    EXCEPTION
        -- Catch all exceptions and simply rethrow custom exceptions. This
        -- will roll back everything in the above block.
        WHEN raise_exception THEN RAISE EXCEPTION '%', SQLERRM;
    END;

    -- Record how startup tests have failed.
    tfaild := num_failed();

    FOR i IN 1..COALESCE(array_upper(tests, 1), 0) LOOP

        -- What subtest are we running?
        RETURN NEXT '    ' || diag_test_name('Subtest: ' || tests[i]);

        -- Reset the results.
        tok := TRUE;
        tnumb := COALESCE(_get('curr_test'), 0);

        IF tnumb > 0 THEN
            EXECUTE 'ALTER SEQUENCE __tresults___numb_seq RESTART WITH 1';
            PERFORM _set('curr_test', 0);
            PERFORM _set('failed', 0);
        END IF;

        DECLARE
            errstate text;
            errmsg   text;
            detail   text;
            hint     text;
            context  text;
            schname  text;
            tabname  text;
            colname  text;
            chkname  text;
            typname  text;
        BEGIN
            BEGIN
                -- Run the setup functions.
                FOR tap IN SELECT * FROM _runem(setup, false) LOOP
                    RETURN NEXT regexp_replace(tap, '^', '    ', 'gn');
                END LOOP;

                -- Run the actual test function.
                FOR tap IN EXECUTE 'SELECT * FROM ' || tests[i] || '()' LOOP
                    RETURN NEXT regexp_replace(tap, '^', '    ', 'gn');
                END LOOP;

                -- Run the teardown functions.
                FOR tap IN SELECT * FROM _runem(teardown, false) LOOP
                    RETURN NEXT regexp_replace(tap, '^', '    ', 'gn');
                END LOOP;

                -- Emit the plan.
                fnumb := COALESCE(_get('curr_test'), 0);
                RETURN NEXT '    1..' || fnumb;

                -- Emit any error messages.
                IF fnumb = 0 THEN
                    RETURN NEXT '    # No tests run!';
                    tok = false;
                ELSE
                    -- Report failures.
                    ffaild := num_failed();
                    IF ffaild > 0 THEN
                        tok := FALSE;
                        RETURN NEXT '    ' || diag(
                            'Looks like you failed ' || ffaild || ' test' ||
                             CASE tfaild WHEN 1 THEN '' ELSE 's' END
                             || ' of ' || fnumb
                        );
                    END IF;
                END IF;

            EXCEPTION WHEN raise_exception THEN
                -- Something went wrong. Record that fact.
                errstate := SQLSTATE;
                errmsg := SQLERRM;
                GET STACKED DIAGNOSTICS
                    detail  = PG_EXCEPTION_DETAIL,
                    hint    = PG_EXCEPTION_HINT,
                    context = PG_EXCEPTION_CONTEXT,
                    schname = SCHEMA_NAME,
                    tabname = TABLE_NAME,
                    colname = COLUMN_NAME,
                    chkname = CONSTRAINT_NAME,
                    typname = PG_DATATYPE_NAME;
            END;

            -- Always raise an exception to rollback any changes.
            RAISE EXCEPTION '__TAP_ROLLBACK__';

        EXCEPTION WHEN raise_exception THEN
            IF errmsg IS NOT NULL THEN
                -- Something went wrong. Emit the error message.
                tok := FALSE;
               RETURN NEXT regexp_replace( diag('Test died: ' || _error_diag(
                   errstate, errmsg, detail, hint, context, schname, tabname, colname, chkname, typname
               )), '^', '    ', 'gn');
                errmsg := NULL;
            END IF;
        END;

        -- Restore the sequence.
        EXECUTE 'ALTER SEQUENCE __tresults___numb_seq RESTART WITH ' || tnumb + 1;
        PERFORM _set('curr_test', tnumb);
        PERFORM _set('failed', tfaild);

        -- Record this test.
        RETURN NEXT ok(tok, tests[i]);
        IF NOT tok THEN tfaild := tfaild + 1; END IF;

    END LOOP;

    -- Run the shutdown functions.
    FOR tap IN SELECT * FROM _runem(shutdown, false) LOOP RETURN NEXT tap; END LOOP;

    -- Finish up.
    FOR tap IN SELECT * FROM _finish( COALESCE(_get('curr_test'), 0), 0, tfaild ) LOOP
        RETURN NEXT tap;
    END LOOP;

    -- Clean up and return.
    PERFORM _cleanup();
    RETURN;
END;

Function: public._set(integer, integer)

Returns: integer

Language: PLPGSQL

BEGIN
    EXECUTE 'UPDATE __tcache__ SET value = ' || $2
        || ' WHERE id = ' || $1;
    RETURN $2;
END;

Function: public._set(text, integer)

Returns: integer

Language: SQL

    SELECT _set($1, $2, '')

Function: public._set(text, integer, text)

Returns: integer

Language: PLPGSQL

DECLARE
    rcount integer;
BEGIN
    EXECUTE 'UPDATE __tcache__ SET value = ' || $2
        || CASE WHEN $3 IS NULL THEN '' ELSE ', note = ' || quote_literal($3) END
        || ' WHERE label = ' || quote_literal($1);
    GET DIAGNOSTICS rcount = ROW_COUNT;
    IF rcount = 0 THEN
       RETURN _add( $1, $2, $3 );
    END IF;
    RETURN $2;
END;

Function: public._strict(name)

Returns: boolean

Language: SQL

    SELECT is_strict FROM tap_funky WHERE name = $1 AND is_visible;

Function: public._strict(name, name)

Returns: boolean

Language: SQL

    SELECT is_strict FROM tap_funky WHERE schema = $1 AND name = $2

Function: public._strict(name, name, name[])

Returns: boolean

Language: SQL

    SELECT is_strict
      FROM tap_funky
     WHERE schema = $1
       AND name   = $2
       AND args   = array_to_string($3, ',')

Function: public._strict(name, name[])

Returns: boolean

Language: SQL

    SELECT is_strict
      FROM tap_funky
     WHERE name = $1
       AND args = array_to_string($2, ',')
       AND is_visible;

Function: public._table_privs()

Returns: name[]

Language: PLPGSQL

DECLARE
    pgversion INTEGER := pg_version_num();
BEGIN
    IF pgversion < 80200 THEN RETURN ARRAY[
        'DELETE', 'INSERT', 'REFERENCES', 'RULE', 'SELECT', 'TRIGGER', 'UPDATE'
    ];
    ELSIF pgversion < 80400 THEN RETURN ARRAY[
        'DELETE', 'INSERT', 'REFERENCES', 'SELECT', 'TRIGGER', 'UPDATE'
    ];
    ELSE RETURN ARRAY[
        'DELETE', 'INSERT', 'REFERENCES', 'SELECT', 'TRIGGER', 'TRUNCATE', 'UPDATE'
    ];
    END IF;
END;

Function: public._temptable(anyarray, text)

Returns: text

Language: PLPGSQL

BEGIN
    CREATE TEMP TABLE _____coltmp___ AS
    SELECT $1[i]
    FROM generate_series(array_lower($1, 1), array_upper($1, 1)) s(i);
    EXECUTE 'ALTER TABLE _____coltmp___ RENAME TO ' || $2;
    return $2;
END;

Function: public._temptable(text, text)

Returns: text

Language: PLPGSQL

BEGIN
    EXECUTE 'CREATE TEMP TABLE ' || $2 || ' AS ' || _query($1);
    return $2;
END;

Function: public._temptypes(text)

Returns: text

Language: SQL

    SELECT array_to_string(ARRAY(
        SELECT pg_catalog.format_type(a.atttypid, a.atttypmod)
          FROM pg_catalog.pg_attribute a
          JOIN pg_catalog.pg_class c ON a.attrelid = c.oid
         WHERE c.oid = ('pg_temp.' || $1)::pg_catalog.regclass
           AND attnum > 0
           AND NOT attisdropped
         ORDER BY attnum
    ), ',');

Function: public._time_trials(text, integer, numeric)

Returns: SET OF _time_trial_type

Language: PLPGSQL

DECLARE
    query            TEXT := _query($1);
    iterations       ALIAS FOR $2;
    return_percent   ALIAS FOR $3;
    start_time       TEXT;
    act_time         NUMERIC;
    times            NUMERIC[];
    offset_it        INT;
    limit_it         INT;
    offset_percent   NUMERIC;
    a_time	     _time_trial_type;
BEGIN
    -- Execute the query over and over
    FOR i IN 1..iterations LOOP
        start_time := timeofday();
        EXECUTE query;
        -- Store the execution time for the run in an array of times
        times[i] := extract(millisecond from timeofday()::timestamptz - start_time::timestamptz);
    END LOOP;
    offset_percent := (1.0 - return_percent) / 2.0;
    -- Ensure that offset skips the bottom X% of runs, or set it to 0
    SELECT GREATEST((offset_percent * iterations)::int, 0) INTO offset_it;
    -- Ensure that with limit the query to returning only the middle X% of runs
    SELECT GREATEST((return_percent * iterations)::int, 1) INTO limit_it;

    FOR a_time IN SELECT times[i]
		  FROM generate_series(array_lower(times, 1), array_upper(times, 1)) i
                  ORDER BY 1
                  OFFSET offset_it
                  LIMIT limit_it LOOP
	RETURN NEXT a_time;
    END LOOP;
END;

Function: public._tlike(boolean, text, text, text)

Returns: text

Language: SQL

    SELECT ok( $1, $4 ) || CASE WHEN $1 THEN '' ELSE E'\n' || diag(
           '   error message: ' || COALESCE( quote_literal($2), 'NULL' ) ||
       E'\n   doesn''t match: ' || COALESCE( quote_literal($3), 'NULL' )
    ) END;

Function: public._todo()

Returns: text

Language: PLPGSQL

DECLARE
    todos INT[];
    note text;
BEGIN
    -- Get the latest id and value, because todo() might have been called
    -- again before the todos ran out for the first call to todo(). This
    -- allows them to nest.
    todos := _get_latest('todo');
    IF todos IS NULL THEN
        -- No todos.
        RETURN NULL;
    END IF;
    IF todos[2] = 0 THEN
        -- Todos depleted. Clean up.
        EXECUTE 'DELETE FROM __tcache__ WHERE id = ' || todos[1];
        RETURN NULL;
    END IF;
    -- Decrement the count of counted todos and return the reason.
    IF todos[2] <> -1 THEN
        PERFORM _set(todos[1], todos[2] - 1);
    END IF;
    note := _get_note(todos[1]);

    IF todos[2] = 1 THEN
        -- This was the last todo, so delete the record.
        EXECUTE 'DELETE FROM __tcache__ WHERE id = ' || todos[1];
    END IF;

    RETURN note;
END;

Function: public._trig(name, name)

Returns: boolean

Language: SQL

    SELECT EXISTS(
        SELECT true
          FROM pg_catalog.pg_trigger t
          JOIN pg_catalog.pg_class c     ON c.oid = t.tgrelid
         WHERE c.relname = $1
           AND t.tgname  = $2
           AND pg_catalog.pg_table_is_visible(c.oid)
    );

Function: public._trig(name, name, name)

Returns: boolean

Language: SQL

    SELECT EXISTS(
        SELECT true
          FROM pg_catalog.pg_trigger t
          JOIN pg_catalog.pg_class c     ON c.oid = t.tgrelid
          JOIN pg_catalog.pg_namespace n ON n.oid = c.relnamespace
         WHERE n.nspname = $1
           AND c.relname = $2
           AND t.tgname  = $3
    );

      FROM tap_funky
     WHERE schema = $2
       AND name   = $3
       AND args   = array_to_string($4, ',')

Returns: boolean

      FROM tap_funky
     WHERE name = $2
       AND args = array_to_string($3, ',')
       AND is_visible;

Function: public._types_are(name, name[], text, bpchar[])

Returns: text

Language: SQL

    SELECT _are(
        'types',
        ARRAY(
            SELECT t.typname
              FROM pg_catalog.pg_type t
              LEFT JOIN pg_catalog.pg_namespace n ON n.oid = t.typnamespace
             WHERE (
                     t.typrelid = 0
                 OR (SELECT c.relkind = 'c' FROM pg_catalog.pg_class c WHERE c.oid = t.typrelid)
             )
               AND NOT EXISTS(SELECT 1 FROM pg_catalog.pg_type el WHERE el.oid = t.typelem AND el.typarray = t.oid)
               AND n.nspname = $1
               AND t.typtype = ANY( COALESCE($4, ARRAY['b', 'c', 'd', 'p', 'e']) )
            EXCEPT
            SELECT $2[i]
              FROM generate_series(1, array_upper($2, 1)) s(i)
        ),
        ARRAY(
            SELECT $2[i]
               FROM generate_series(1, array_upper($2, 1)) s(i)
            EXCEPT
            SELECT t.typname
              FROM pg_catalog.pg_type t
              LEFT JOIN pg_catalog.pg_namespace n ON n.oid = t.typnamespace
             WHERE (
                     t.typrelid = 0
                 OR (SELECT c.relkind = 'c' FROM pg_catalog.pg_class c WHERE c.oid = t.typrelid)
             )
               AND NOT EXISTS(SELECT 1 FROM pg_catalog.pg_type el WHERE el.oid = t.typelem AND el.typarray = t.oid)
               AND n.nspname = $1
               AND t.typtype = ANY( COALESCE($4, ARRAY['b', 'c', 'd', 'p', 'e']) )
        ),
        $3
    );

Function: public._types_are(name[], text, bpchar[])

Returns: text

Language: SQL

    SELECT _are(
        'types',
        ARRAY(
            SELECT t.typname
              FROM pg_catalog.pg_type t
              LEFT JOIN pg_catalog.pg_namespace n ON n.oid = t.typnamespace
             WHERE (
                     t.typrelid = 0
                 OR (SELECT c.relkind = 'c' FROM pg_catalog.pg_class c WHERE c.oid = t.typrelid)
             )
               AND NOT EXISTS(SELECT 1 FROM pg_catalog.pg_type el WHERE el.oid = t.typelem AND el.typarray = t.oid)
               AND n.nspname NOT IN ('pg_catalog', 'information_schema')
               AND pg_catalog.pg_type_is_visible(t.oid)
               AND t.typtype = ANY( COALESCE($3, ARRAY['b', 'c', 'd', 'p', 'e']) )
            EXCEPT
            SELECT $1[i]
              FROM generate_series(1, array_upper($1, 1)) s(i)
        ),
        ARRAY(
            SELECT $1[i]
               FROM generate_series(1, array_upper($1, 1)) s(i)
            EXCEPT
            SELECT t.typname
              FROM pg_catalog.pg_type t
              LEFT JOIN pg_catalog.pg_namespace n ON n.oid = t.typnamespace
             WHERE (
                     t.typrelid = 0
                 OR (SELECT c.relkind = 'c' FROM pg_catalog.pg_class c WHERE c.oid = t.typrelid)
             )
               AND NOT EXISTS(SELECT 1 FROM pg_catalog.pg_type el WHERE el.oid = t.typelem AND el.typarray = t.oid)
               AND n.nspname NOT IN ('pg_catalog', 'information_schema')
               AND pg_catalog.pg_type_is_visible(t.oid)
               AND t.typtype = ANY( COALESCE($3, ARRAY['b', 'c', 'd', 'p', 'e']) )
        ),
        $2
    );

Function: public._unalike(boolean, anyelement, text, text)

Returns: text

Language: PLPGSQL

DECLARE
    result ALIAS FOR $1;
    got    ALIAS FOR $2;
    rx     ALIAS FOR $3;
    descr  ALIAS FOR $4;
    output TEXT;
BEGIN
    output := ok( result, descr );
    RETURN output || CASE result WHEN TRUE THEN '' ELSE E'\n' || diag(
           '                  ' || COALESCE( quote_literal(got), 'NULL' ) ||
        E'\n         matches: ' || COALESCE( quote_literal(rx), 'NULL' )
    ) END;
END;

     WHERE f.name = $1 AND f.is_visible;

    SELECT _expand_vol(volatility) FROM tap_funky f
     WHERE f.schema = $1 and f.name = $2

Language: SQL

    SELECT _expand_vol(volatility)
      FROM tap_funky f
     WHERE f.schema = $1
       and f.name   = $2
       AND f.args   = array_to_string($3, ',')

Function: public._vol(name, name[])

Returns: text

Language: SQL

    SELECT _expand_vol(volatility)
      FROM tap_funky f
     WHERE f.name = $1
       AND f.args = array_to_string($2, ',')
       AND f.is_visible;

Function: public.add_result(boolean, boolean, text, text, text)

Returns: integer

Language: PLPGSQL

BEGIN
    IF NOT $1 THEN PERFORM _set('failed', _get('failed') + 1); END IF;
    RETURN nextval('__tresults___numb_seq');
END;

Function: public.any_column_privs_are(name, name, name, name[])

Returns: text

Language: SQL

    SELECT any_column_privs_are(
        $1, $2, $3, $4,
        'Role ' || quote_ident($3) || ' should be granted '
            || CASE WHEN $4[1] IS NULL THEN 'no privileges' ELSE array_to_string($4, ', ') END
            || ' on any column in '|| quote_ident($1) || '.' || quote_ident($2)
    );

Function: public.any_column_privs_are(name, name, name, name[], text)

Returns: text

Language: PLPGSQL

DECLARE
    grants TEXT[] := _get_ac_privs( $3, quote_ident($1) || '.' || quote_ident($2) );
BEGIN
    IF grants[1] = 'undefined_table' THEN
        RETURN ok(FALSE, $5) || E'\n' || diag(
            '    Table ' || quote_ident($1) || '.' || quote_ident($2) || ' does not exist'
        );
    ELSIF grants[1] = 'undefined_role' THEN
        RETURN ok(FALSE, $5) || E'\n' || diag(
            '    Role ' || quote_ident($3) || ' does not exist'
        );
    END IF;
    RETURN _assets_are('privileges', grants, $4, $5);
END;

Function: public.any_column_privs_are(name, name, name[])

Returns: text

Language: SQL

    SELECT any_column_privs_are(
        $1, $2, $3,
        'Role ' || quote_ident($2) || ' should be granted '
            || CASE WHEN $3[1] IS NULL THEN 'no privileges' ELSE array_to_string($3, ', ') END
            || ' on any column in ' || quote_ident($1)
    );

Function: public.any_column_privs_are(name, name, name[], text)

Returns: text

Language: PLPGSQL

DECLARE
    grants TEXT[] := _get_ac_privs( $2, quote_ident($1) );
BEGIN
    IF grants[1] = 'undefined_table' THEN
        RETURN ok(FALSE, $4) || E'\n' || diag(
            '    Table ' || quote_ident($1) || '.' || quote_ident($2) || ' does not exist'
        );
    ELSIF grants[1] = 'undefined_role' THEN
        RETURN ok(FALSE, $4) || E'\n' || diag(
            '    Role ' || quote_ident($2) || ' does not exist'
        );
    END IF;
    RETURN _assets_are('privileges', grants, $3, $4);
END;

Function: public.can(name, name[])

Returns: text

Language: SQL

    SELECT can( $1, $2, 'Schema ' || quote_ident($1) || ' can' );

Function: public.can(name, name[], text)

Returns: text

Language: PLPGSQL

DECLARE
    missing text[];
BEGIN
    SELECT ARRAY(
        SELECT quote_ident($2[i])
          FROM generate_series(1, array_upper($2, 1)) s(i)
          LEFT JOIN tap_funky ON name = $2[i] AND schema = $1
         WHERE oid IS NULL
         GROUP BY $2[i], s.i
         ORDER BY MIN(s.i)
    ) INTO missing;
    IF missing[1] IS NULL THEN
        RETURN ok( true, $3 );
    END IF;
    RETURN ok( false, $3 ) || E'\n' || diag(
        '    ' || quote_ident($1) || '.' ||
        array_to_string( missing, E'() missing\n    ' || quote_ident($1) || '.') ||
        '() missing'
    );
END;

Function: public.can(name[])

Returns: text

Language: SQL

    SELECT can( $1, 'Schema ' || _ident_array_to_string(current_schemas(true), ' or ') || ' can' );

Function: public.can(name[], text)

Returns: text

Language: PLPGSQL

DECLARE
    missing text[];
BEGIN
    SELECT ARRAY(
        SELECT quote_ident($1[i])
          FROM generate_series(1, array_upper($1, 1)) s(i)
          LEFT JOIN pg_catalog.pg_proc p
            ON $1[i] = p.proname
           AND pg_catalog.pg_function_is_visible(p.oid)
         WHERE p.oid IS NULL
         ORDER BY s.i
    ) INTO missing;
    IF missing[1] IS NULL THEN
        RETURN ok( true, $2 );
    END IF;
    RETURN ok( false, $2 ) || E'\n' || diag(
        '    ' ||
        array_to_string( missing, E'() missing\n    ') ||
        '() missing'
    );
END;

Function: public.cash_dist(money, money)

Returns: money

Language: C

cash_dist

Function: public.cast_context_is(name, name, text)

Returns: text

Language: SQL

    SELECT cast_context_is(
        $1, $2, $3,
        'Cast (' || quote_ident($1) || ' AS ' || quote_ident($2)
        || ') context should be ' || _expand_context(substring(LOWER($3) FROM 1 FOR 1))
    );

Function: public.cast_context_is(name, name, text, text)

Returns: text

Language: PLPGSQL

DECLARE
    want char = substring(LOWER($3) FROM 1 FOR 1);
    have char := _get_context($1, $2);
BEGIN
    IF have IS NOT NULL THEN
        RETURN is( _expand_context(have), _expand_context(want), $4 );
    END IF;

    RETURN ok( false, $4 ) || E'\n' || diag(
       '    Cast (' || quote_ident($1) || ' AS ' || quote_ident($2)
      || ') does not exist'
    );
END;

Function: public.casts_are(text[])

Returns: text

Language: SQL

    SELECT casts_are( $1, 'There should be the correct casts');

Function: public.casts_are(text[], text)

Returns: text

Language: SQL

    SELECT _areni(
        'casts',
        ARRAY(
            SELECT pg_catalog.format_type(castsource, NULL)
                   || ' AS ' || pg_catalog.format_type(casttarget, NULL)
              FROM pg_catalog.pg_cast c
            EXCEPT
            SELECT $1[i]
              FROM generate_series(1, array_upper($1, 1)) s(i)
        ),
        ARRAY(
            SELECT $1[i]
              FROM generate_series(1, array_upper($1, 1)) s(i)
            EXCEPT
            SELECT pg_catalog.format_type(castsource, NULL)
                   || ' AS ' || pg_catalog.format_type(casttarget, NULL)
              FROM pg_catalog.pg_cast c
        ),
        $2
    );

Function: public.check_test(text, boolean)

Returns: SET OF text

Language: SQL

    SELECT * FROM check_test( $1, $2, NULL, NULL, NULL, FALSE );

Function: public.check_test(text, boolean, text)

Returns: SET OF text

Language: SQL

    SELECT * FROM check_test( $1, $2, $3, NULL, NULL, FALSE );

Function: public.check_test(text, boolean, text, text)

Returns: SET OF text

Language: SQL

    SELECT * FROM check_test( $1, $2, $3, $4, NULL, FALSE );

Function: public.check_test(text, boolean, text, text, text)

Returns: SET OF text

Language: SQL

    SELECT * FROM check_test( $1, $2, $3, $4, $5, FALSE );

Function: public.check_test(text, boolean, text, text, text, boolean)

Returns: SET OF text

Language: PLPGSQL

DECLARE
    tnumb   INTEGER;
    aok     BOOLEAN;
    adescr  TEXT;
    res     BOOLEAN;
    descr   TEXT;
    adiag   TEXT;
    have    ALIAS FOR $1;
    eok     ALIAS FOR $2;
    name    ALIAS FOR $3;
    edescr  ALIAS FOR $4;
    ediag   ALIAS FOR $5;
    matchit ALIAS FOR $6;
BEGIN
    -- What test was it that just ran?
    tnumb := currval('__tresults___numb_seq');

    -- Fetch the results.
    aok    := substring(have, 1, 2) = 'ok';
    adescr := COALESCE(substring(have FROM  E'(?:not )?ok [[:digit:]]+ - ([^\n]+)'), '');

    -- Now delete those results.
    EXECUTE 'ALTER SEQUENCE __tresults___numb_seq RESTART WITH ' || tnumb;
    IF NOT aok THEN PERFORM _set('failed', _get('failed') - 1); END IF;

    -- Set up the description.
    descr := coalesce( name || ' ', 'Test ' ) || 'should ';

    -- So, did the test pass?
    RETURN NEXT is(
        aok,
        eok,
        descr || CASE eok WHEN true then 'pass' ELSE 'fail' END
    );

    -- Was the description as expected?
    IF edescr IS NOT NULL THEN
        RETURN NEXT is(
            adescr,
            edescr,
            descr || 'have the proper description'
        );
    END IF;

    -- Were the diagnostics as expected?
    IF ediag IS NOT NULL THEN
        -- Remove ok and the test number.
        adiag := substring(
            have
            FROM CASE WHEN aok THEN 4 ELSE 9 END + char_length(tnumb::text)
        );

        -- Remove the description, if there is one.
        IF adescr <> '' THEN
            adiag := substring(
                adiag FROM 1 + char_length( ' - ' || substr(diag( adescr ), 3) )
            );
        END IF;

        IF NOT aok THEN
            -- Remove failure message from ok().
            adiag := substring(adiag FROM 1 + char_length(diag(
                'Failed test ' || tnumb ||
                CASE adescr WHEN '' THEN '' ELSE COALESCE(': "' || adescr || '"', '') END
            )));
        END IF;

        IF ediag <> '' THEN
           -- Remove the space before the diagnostics.
           adiag := substring(adiag FROM 2);
        END IF;

        -- Remove the #s.
        adiag := replace( substring(adiag from 3), E'\n# ', E'\n' );

        -- Now compare the diagnostics.
        IF matchit THEN
            RETURN NEXT matches(
                adiag,
                ediag,
                descr || 'have the proper diagnostics'
            );
        ELSE
            RETURN NEXT is(
                adiag,
                ediag,
                descr || 'have the proper diagnostics'
            );
        END IF;
    END IF;

    -- And we're done
    RETURN;
END;

Function: public.cmp_ok(anyelement, text, anyelement)

Returns: text

Language: SQL

    SELECT cmp_ok( $1, $2, $3, NULL );

Function: public.cmp_ok(anyelement, text, anyelement, text)

Returns: text

Language: PLPGSQL

DECLARE
    have   ALIAS FOR $1;
    op     ALIAS FOR $2;
    want   ALIAS FOR $3;
    descr  ALIAS FOR $4;
    result BOOLEAN;
    output TEXT;
BEGIN
    EXECUTE 'SELECT ' ||
            COALESCE(quote_literal( have ), 'NULL') || '::' || pg_typeof(have) || ' '
            || op || ' ' ||
            COALESCE(quote_literal( want ), 'NULL') || '::' || pg_typeof(want)
       INTO result;
    output := ok( COALESCE(result, FALSE), descr );
    RETURN output || CASE result WHEN TRUE THEN '' ELSE E'\n' || diag(
           '    ' || COALESCE( quote_literal(have), 'NULL' ) ||
           E'\n        ' || op ||
           E'\n    ' || COALESCE( quote_literal(want), 'NULL' )
    ) END;
END;

Returns: text

Language: SQL

    SELECT _cdi( $1, $2, $3 );

Function: public.col_default_is(name, name, text, text)

Returns: text

Language: SQL

    SELECT _cdi( $1, $2, $3, $4 );

Function: public.col_has_default(name, name)

Returns: text

Language: SQL

    SELECT col_has_default( $1, $2, 'Column ' || quote_ident($1) || '.' || quote_ident($2) || ' should have a default' );

Function: public.col_has_default(name, name, name, text)

Returns: text

Language: PLPGSQL

BEGIN
    IF NOT _cexists( $1, $2, $3 ) THEN
        RETURN fail( $4 ) || E'\n'
            || diag ('    Column ' || quote_ident($1) || '.' || quote_ident($2) || '.' || quote_ident($3) || ' does not exist' );
    END IF;
    RETURN ok( _has_def( $1, $2, $3 ), $4 );
END

Function: public.col_has_default(name, name, text)

Returns: text

Language: PLPGSQL

BEGIN
    IF NOT _cexists( $1, $2 ) THEN
        RETURN fail( $3 ) || E'\n'
            || diag ('    Column ' || quote_ident($1) || '.' || quote_ident($2) || ' does not exist' );
    END IF;
    RETURN ok( _has_def( $1, $2 ), $3 );
END;

    SELECT col_hasnt_default( $1, $2, 'Column ' || quote_ident($1) || '.' || quote_ident($2) || ' should not have a default' );

Function: public.col_hasnt_default(name, name, name, text)

Returns: text

Language: PLPGSQL

BEGIN
    IF NOT _cexists( $1, $2, $3 ) THEN
        RETURN fail( $4 ) || E'\n'
            || diag ('    Column ' || quote_ident($1) || '.' || quote_ident($2) || '.' || quote_ident($3) || ' does not exist' );
    END IF;
    RETURN ok( NOT _has_def( $1, $2, $3 ), $4 );
END;

Function: public.col_hasnt_default(name, name, text)

Returns: text

Language: PLPGSQL

BEGIN
    IF NOT _cexists( $1, $2 ) THEN
        RETURN fail( $3 ) || E'\n'
            || diag ('    Column ' || quote_ident($1) || '.' || quote_ident($2) || ' does not exist' );
    END IF;
    RETURN ok( NOT _has_def( $1, $2 ), $3 );
END;

Function: public.col_is_fk(name, name)

Returns: text

Language: SQL

    SELECT col_is_fk( $1, $2, 'Column ' || quote_ident($1) || '(' || quote_ident($2) || ') should be a foreign key' );

Function: public.col_is_fk(name, name, name, text)

Returns: text

Language: SQL

    SELECT col_is_fk( $1, $2, ARRAY[$3], $4 );

Function: public.col_is_fk(name, name, name[], text)

Returns: text

Language: PLPGSQL

DECLARE
    names text[];
BEGIN
    IF _fkexists($1, $2, $3) THEN
        RETURN pass( $4 );
    END IF;

    -- Try to show the columns.
    SELECT ARRAY(
        SELECT _ident_array_to_string(fk_columns, ', ')
          FROM pg_all_foreign_keys
         WHERE fk_schema_name = $1
           AND fk_table_name  = $2
         ORDER BY fk_columns
    ) INTO names;

    IF names[1] IS NOT NULL THEN
        RETURN fail($4) || E'\n' || diag(
            '    Table ' || quote_ident($1) || '.' || quote_ident($2) || E' has foreign key constraints on these columns:\n        '
            ||  array_to_string( names, E'\n        ' )
        );
    END IF;

    -- No FKs in this table.
    RETURN fail($4) || E'\n' || diag(
        '    Table ' || quote_ident($1) || '.' || quote_ident($2) || ' has no foreign key columns'
    );
END;

Function: public.col_is_fk(name, name, text)

Returns: text

Language: SQL

    SELECT col_is_fk( $1, ARRAY[$2], $3 );

Function: public.col_is_fk(name, name[])

Returns: text

Language: SQL

    SELECT col_is_fk( $1, $2, 'Columns ' || quote_ident($1) || '(' || _ident_array_to_string($2, ', ') || ') should be a foreign key' );

Function: public.col_is_fk(name, name[], text)

Returns: text

Language: PLPGSQL

DECLARE
    names text[];
BEGIN
    IF _fkexists($1, $2) THEN
        RETURN pass( $3 );
    END IF;

    -- Try to show the columns.
    SELECT ARRAY(
        SELECT _ident_array_to_string(fk_columns, ', ')
          FROM pg_all_foreign_keys
         WHERE fk_table_name  = $1
         ORDER BY fk_columns
    ) INTO names;

    IF NAMES[1] IS NOT NULL THEN
        RETURN fail($3) || E'\n' || diag(
            '    Table ' || quote_ident($1) || E' has foreign key constraints on these columns:\n        '
            || array_to_string( names, E'\n        ' )
        );
    END IF;

    -- No FKs in this table.
    RETURN fail($3) || E'\n' || diag(
        '    Table ' || quote_ident($1) || ' has no foreign key columns'
    );
END;

Function: public.col_type_is(name, name, name, name, text)

Returns: text

Language: SQL

    SELECT col_type_is( $1, $2, $3, $4, $5, 'Column ' || quote_ident($1) || '.' || quote_ident($2)
        || '.' || quote_ident($3) || ' should be type ' || quote_ident($4) || '.' || $5);

Function: public.col_type_is(name, name, name, name, text, text)

Returns: text

Language: PLPGSQL

DECLARE
    have_type TEXT := _get_col_ns_type($1, $2, $3);
    want_type TEXT;
BEGIN
    IF have_type IS NULL THEN
        RETURN fail( $6 ) || E'\n' || diag (
            '   Column ' || COALESCE(quote_ident($1) || '.', '')
            || quote_ident($2) || '.' || quote_ident($3) || ' does not exist'
        );
    END IF;

    want_type := quote_ident($4) || '.' || _quote_ident_like($5, have_type);
    IF have_type = want_type THEN
        -- We're good to go.
        RETURN ok( true, $6 );
    END IF;

    -- Wrong data type. tell 'em what we really got.
    RETURN ok( false, $6 ) || E'\n' || diag(
           '        have: ' || have_type ||
        E'\n        want: ' || want_type
    );
END;

Function: public.col_type_is(name, name, name, text)

Returns: text

Language: SQL

    SELECT col_type_is( $1, $2, $3, $4, 'Column ' || quote_ident($1) || '.' || quote_ident($2) || '.' || quote_ident($3) || ' should be type ' || $4 );

Function: public.col_type_is(name, name, name, text, text)

Returns: text

Language: PLPGSQL

DECLARE
    have_type TEXT;
    want_type TEXT;
BEGIN
    -- Get the data type.
    IF $1 IS NULL THEN
        have_type := _get_col_type($2, $3);
    ELSE
        have_type := _get_col_type($1, $2, $3);
    END IF;

    IF have_type IS NULL THEN
        RETURN fail( $5 ) || E'\n' || diag (
            '   Column ' || COALESCE(quote_ident($1) || '.', '')
            || quote_ident($2) || '.' || quote_ident($3) || ' does not exist'
        );
    END IF;

    want_type := _quote_ident_like($4, have_type);
    IF have_type = want_type THEN
        -- We're good to go.
        RETURN ok( true, $5 );
    END IF;

    -- Wrong data type. tell 'em what we really got.
    RETURN ok( false, $5 ) || E'\n' || diag(
           '        have: ' || have_type ||
        E'\n        want: ' || want_type
    );
END;

Function: public.col_type_is(name, name, text)

Returns: text

Language: SQL

    SELECT col_type_is( $1, $2, $3, 'Column ' || quote_ident($1) || '.' || quote_ident($2) || ' should be type ' || $3 );

Function: public.col_type_is(name, name, text, text)

Returns: text

Language: SQL

    SELECT col_type_is( NULL, $1, $2, $3, $4 );

Function: public.collect_tap(character varying[])

Returns: text

Language: SQL

    SELECT array_to_string($1, E'\n');

Function: public.collect_tap(text[])

Returns: text

Language: SQL

    SELECT array_to_string($1, E'\n');

Function: public.column_privs_are(name, name, name, name, name[])

Returns: text

Language: SQL

    SELECT column_privs_are(
        $1, $2, $3, $4, $5,
        'Role ' || quote_ident($4) || ' should be granted '
            || CASE WHEN $5[1] IS NULL THEN 'no privileges' ELSE array_to_string($5, ', ') END
            || ' on column ' || quote_ident($1) || '.' || quote_ident($2) || '.' || quote_ident($3)
    );

Function: public.column_privs_are(name, name, name, name, name[], text)

Returns: text

Language: PLPGSQL

DECLARE
    grants TEXT[] := _get_col_privs( $4, quote_ident($1) || '.' || quote_ident($2), $3 );
BEGIN
    IF grants[1] = 'undefined_column' THEN
        RETURN ok(FALSE, $6) || E'\n' || diag(
            '    Column ' || quote_ident($1) || '.' || quote_ident($2) || '.' || quote_ident($3)
            || ' does not exist'
        );
    ELSIF grants[1] = 'undefined_table' THEN
        RETURN ok(FALSE, $6) || E'\n' || diag(
            '    Table ' || quote_ident($1) || '.' || quote_ident($2) || ' does not exist'
        );
    ELSIF grants[1] = 'undefined_role' THEN
        RETURN ok(FALSE, $6) || E'\n' || diag(
            '    Role ' || quote_ident($4) || ' does not exist'
        );
    END IF;
    RETURN _assets_are('privileges', grants, $5, $6);
END;

Function: public.column_privs_are(name, name, name, name[])

Returns: text

Language: SQL

    SELECT column_privs_are(
        $1, $2, $3, $4,
        'Role ' || quote_ident($3) || ' should be granted '
            || CASE WHEN $4[1] IS NULL THEN 'no privileges' ELSE array_to_string($4, ', ') END
            || ' on column ' || quote_ident($1) || '.' || quote_ident($2)
    );

Function: public.column_privs_are(name, name, name, name[], text)

Returns: text

Language: PLPGSQL

DECLARE
    grants TEXT[] := _get_col_privs( $3, quote_ident($1), $2 );
BEGIN
    IF grants[1] = 'undefined_column' THEN
        RETURN ok(FALSE, $5) || E'\n' || diag(
            '    Column ' || quote_ident($1) || '.' || quote_ident($2) || ' does not exist'
        );
    ELSIF grants[1] = 'undefined_table' THEN
        RETURN ok(FALSE, $5) || E'\n' || diag(
            '    Table ' || quote_ident($1) || ' does not exist'
        );
    ELSIF grants[1] = 'undefined_role' THEN
        RETURN ok(FALSE, $5) || E'\n' || diag(
            '    Role ' || quote_ident($3) || ' does not exist'
        );
    END IF;
    RETURN _assets_are('privileges', grants, $4, $5);
END;

Function: public.columns_are(name, name, name[])

Returns: text

Language: SQL

    SELECT columns_are( $1, $2, $3, 'Table ' || quote_ident($1) || '.' || quote_ident($2) || ' should have the correct columns' );

Function: public.columns_are(name, name, name[], text)

Returns: text

Language: SQL

    SELECT _are(
        'columns',
        ARRAY(
            SELECT a.attname
              FROM pg_catalog.pg_namespace n
              JOIN pg_catalog.pg_class c ON n.oid = c.relnamespace
              JOIN pg_catalog.pg_attribute a ON c.oid = a.attrelid
             WHERE n.nspname = $1
               AND c.relname = $2
               AND a.attnum > 0
               AND NOT a.attisdropped
            EXCEPT
            SELECT $3[i]
              FROM generate_series(1, array_upper($3, 1)) s(i)
        ),
        ARRAY(
            SELECT $3[i]
              FROM generate_series(1, array_upper($3, 1)) s(i)
            EXCEPT
            SELECT a.attname
              FROM pg_catalog.pg_namespace n
              JOIN pg_catalog.pg_class c ON n.oid = c.relnamespace
              JOIN pg_catalog.pg_attribute a ON c.oid = a.attrelid
             WHERE n.nspname = $1
               AND c.relname = $2
               AND a.attnum > 0
               AND NOT a.attisdropped
        ),
        $4
    );

Function: public.columns_are(name, name[])

Returns: text

Language: SQL

    SELECT columns_are( $1, $2, 'Table ' || quote_ident($1) || ' should have the correct columns' );

Function: public.columns_are(name, name[], text)

Returns: text

Language: SQL

    SELECT _are(
        'columns',
        ARRAY(
            SELECT a.attname
              FROM pg_catalog.pg_namespace n
              JOIN pg_catalog.pg_class c ON n.oid = c.relnamespace
              JOIN pg_catalog.pg_attribute a ON c.oid = a.attrelid
             WHERE n.nspname NOT IN ('pg_catalog', 'information_schema')
               AND pg_catalog.pg_table_is_visible(c.oid)
               AND c.relname = $1
               AND a.attnum > 0
               AND NOT a.attisdropped
            EXCEPT
            SELECT $2[i]
              FROM generate_series(1, array_upper($2, 1)) s(i)
        ),
        ARRAY(
            SELECT $2[i]
              FROM generate_series(1, array_upper($2, 1)) s(i)
            EXCEPT
            SELECT a.attname
              FROM pg_catalog.pg_namespace n
              JOIN pg_catalog.pg_class c ON n.oid = c.relnamespace
              JOIN pg_catalog.pg_attribute a ON c.oid = a.attrelid
             WHERE n.nspname NOT IN ('pg_catalog', 'information_schema')
               AND pg_catalog.pg_table_is_visible(c.oid)
               AND c.relname = $1
               AND a.attnum > 0
               AND NOT a.attisdropped
        ),
        $3
    );

Function: public.composite_owner_is(name, name)

Returns: text

Language: SQL

    SELECT composite_owner_is(
        $1, $2,
        'Composite type ' || quote_ident($1) || ' should be owned by ' || quote_ident($2)
    );

Function: public.composite_owner_is(name, name, name)

Returns: text

Language: SQL

    SELECT composite_owner_is(
        $1, $2, $3,
        'Composite type ' || quote_ident($1) || '.' || quote_ident($2) || ' should be owned by ' || quote_ident($3)
    );

Function: public.composite_owner_is(name, name, name, text)

Returns: text

Language: PLPGSQL

DECLARE
    owner NAME := _get_rel_owner('c'::char, $1, $2);
BEGIN
    -- Make sure the composite exists.
    IF owner IS NULL THEN
        RETURN ok(FALSE, $4) || E'\n' || diag(
            E'    Composite type ' || quote_ident($1) || '.' || quote_ident($2) || ' does not exist'
        );
    END IF;

    RETURN is(owner, $3, $4);
END;

Function: public.composite_owner_is(name, name, text)

Returns: text

Language: PLPGSQL

DECLARE
    owner NAME := _get_rel_owner('c'::char, $1);
BEGIN
    -- Make sure the composite exists.
    IF owner IS NULL THEN
        RETURN ok(FALSE, $3) || E'\n' || diag(
            E'    Composite type ' || quote_ident($1) || ' does not exist'
        );
    END IF;

    RETURN is(owner, $2, $3);
END;

Language: C

connectby_text

Function: public.connectby(text, text, text, text, text, integer)

Function: public.connectby(text, text, text, text, text, integer, text)

Returns: SET OF record

Language: C

connectby_text_serial

Function: public.cron_partition_helper_by_month()

Returns: boolean

Language: PLPGSQL

  DECLARE _partitioned TEXT;
  BEGIN

  FOR _partitioned IN SELECT
                        DISTINCT parent.relname
                      FROM pg_inherits
                          JOIN pg_class parent            ON pg_inherits.inhparent = parent.oid
                          JOIN pg_class child             ON pg_inherits.inhrelid   = child.oid
                          JOIN pg_namespace nmsp_parent   ON nmsp_parent.oid  = parent.relnamespace
                          JOIN pg_namespace nmsp_child    ON nmsp_child.oid   = child.relnamespace
                      WHERE child.relname ~ '_\d{6}$' AND nmsp_parent.nspname = 'public'
  LOOP

    PERFORM partition_helper_by_month(_partitioned);

  END LOOP;


  RETURN TRUE;

  END;

Function: public.database_privs_are(name, name, name[])

Returns: text

Language: SQL

    SELECT database_privs_are(
        $1, $2, $3,
        'Role ' || quote_ident($2) || ' should be granted '
            || CASE WHEN $3[1] IS NULL THEN 'no privileges' ELSE array_to_string($3, ', ') END
            || ' on database ' || quote_ident($1)
    );

Function: public.database_privs_are(name, name, name[], text)

Returns: text

Language: PLPGSQL

DECLARE
    grants TEXT[] := _get_db_privs( $2, $1::TEXT );
BEGIN
    IF grants[1] = 'invalid_catalog_name' THEN
        RETURN ok(FALSE, $4) || E'\n' || diag(
            '    Database ' || quote_ident($1) || ' does not exist'
        );
    ELSIF grants[1] = 'undefined_role' THEN
        RETURN ok(FALSE, $4) || E'\n' || diag(
            '    Role ' || quote_ident($2) || ' does not exist'
        );
    END IF;
    RETURN _assets_are('privileges', grants, $3, $4);
END;

date_dist

Function: public.db_owner_is(name, name)

Returns: text

Language: SQL

    SELECT db_owner_is(
        $1, $2,
        'Database ' || quote_ident($1) || ' should be owned by ' || quote_ident($2)
    );

Function: public.db_owner_is(name, name, text)

Returns: text

Language: PLPGSQL

DECLARE
    dbowner NAME := _get_db_owner($1);
BEGIN
    -- Make sure the database exists.
    IF dbowner IS NULL THEN
        RETURN ok(FALSE, $3) || E'\n' || diag(
            E'    Database ' || quote_ident($1) || ' does not exist'
        );
    END IF;

    RETURN is(dbowner, $2, $3);
END;

Function: public.diag(anyarray)

Returns: text

Language: SQL

    SELECT diag(array_to_string($1, ''));

Function: public.diag(msg anyelement)

Returns: text

Language: SQL

    SELECT diag($1::text);

Function: public.diag(msg text)

Returns: text

Language: SQL

    SELECT '# ' || replace(
       replace(
            replace( $1, E'\r\n', E'\n# ' ),
            E'\n',
            E'\n# '
        ),
        E'\r',
        E'\n# '
    );

Function: public.diag(text[])

Returns: text

Language: SQL

    SELECT diag(array_to_string($1, ''));

    SELECT diag($1 || '()');

    SELECT _unalike( $1 !~* $2, $1, $2, $3 );

Language: SQL

    SELECT _unalike( $1 !~ $2, $1, $2, NULL );
