Language: SQL

    SELECT _unalike( $1 !~ $2, $1, $2, $3 );

Function: public.domain_type_is(name, text, name, text)

Returns: text

Language: SQL

    SELECT domain_type_is(
        $1, $2, $3, $4,
        'Domain ' || quote_ident($1) || '.' || $2
        || ' should extend type ' || quote_ident($3) || '.' || $4
    );

Function: public.domain_type_is(name, text, name, text, text)

Returns: text

Language: PLPGSQL

DECLARE
    actual_type TEXT := _get_dtype($1, $2, true);
BEGIN
    IF actual_type IS NULL THEN
        RETURN fail( $5 ) || E'\n' || diag (
            '   Domain ' || quote_ident($1) || '.' || $2
            || ' does not exist'
        );
    END IF;

    RETURN is( actual_type, quote_ident($3) || '.' || _quote_ident_like($4, actual_type), $5 );
END;

Function: public.domain_type_is(name, text, text)

Returns: text

Language: SQL

    SELECT domain_type_is(
        $1, $2, $3,
        'Domain ' || quote_ident($1) || '.' || $2
        || ' should extend type ' || $3
    );

Function: public.domain_type_is(name, text, text, text)

Returns: text

Language: PLPGSQL

DECLARE
    actual_type TEXT := _get_dtype($1, $2, false);
BEGIN
    IF actual_type IS NULL THEN
        RETURN fail( $4 ) || E'\n' || diag (
            '   Domain ' || quote_ident($1) || '.' || $2
            || ' does not exist'
        );
    END IF;

    RETURN is( actual_type, _quote_ident_like($3, actual_type), $4 );
END;

Function: public.domain_type_is(text, text)

Returns: text

Language: SQL

    SELECT domain_type_is(
        $1, $2,
        'Domain ' || $1 || ' should extend type ' || $2
    );

Function: public.domain_type_is(text, text, text)

Returns: text

Language: PLPGSQL

DECLARE
    actual_type TEXT := _get_dtype($1);
BEGIN
    IF actual_type IS NULL THEN
        RETURN fail( $3 ) || E'\n' || diag (
            '   Domain ' ||  $1 || ' does not exist'
        );
    END IF;

    RETURN is( actual_type, _quote_ident_like($2, actual_type), $3 );
END;

Function: public.enum_has_labels(name, name, name[])

Returns: text

Language: SQL

    SELECT enum_has_labels(
        $1, $2, $3,
        'Enum ' || quote_ident($1) || '.' || quote_ident($2) || ' should have labels (' || array_to_string( $3, ', ' ) || ')'
    );

Function: public.enum_has_labels(name, name, name[], text)

Returns: text

Language: SQL

    SELECT is(
        ARRAY(
            SELECT e.enumlabel
              FROM pg_catalog.pg_type t
              JOIN pg_catalog.pg_enum e      ON t.oid = e.enumtypid
              JOIN pg_catalog.pg_namespace n ON t.typnamespace = n.oid
              WHERE t.typisdefined
               AND n.nspname = $1
               AND t.typname = $2
               AND t.typtype = 'e'
             ORDER BY e.enumsortorder
        ),
        $3,
        $4
    );

Function: public.enum_has_labels(name, name[])

Returns: text

Language: SQL

    SELECT enum_has_labels(
        $1, $2,
        'Enum ' || quote_ident($1) || ' should have labels (' || array_to_string( $2, ', ' ) || ')'
    );

Function: public.enum_has_labels(name, name[], text)

Returns: text

Language: SQL

    SELECT is(
        ARRAY(
            SELECT e.enumlabel
              FROM pg_catalog.pg_type t
              JOIN pg_catalog.pg_enum e ON t.oid = e.enumtypid
              WHERE t.typisdefined
               AND pg_catalog.pg_type_is_visible(t.oid)
               AND t.typname = $1
               AND t.typtype = 'e'
             ORDER BY e.enumsortorder
        ),
        $2,
        $3
    );

Function: public.enums_are(name, name[])

Returns: text

Language: SQL

    SELECT _types_are( $1, $2, 'Schema ' || quote_ident($1) || ' should have the correct enums', ARRAY['e'] );

Language: SQL

    SELECT _types_are( $1, $2, $3, ARRAY['e'] );

Function: public.enums_are(name[])

Returns: text

Language: SQL

    SELECT _types_are( $1, 'Search path ' || pg_catalog.current_setting('search_path') || ' should have the correct enums', ARRAY['e'] );

    SELECT _types_are( $1, $2, ARRAY['e'] );

Function: public.extensions_are(name, name[])

Returns: text

Language: SQL

  SELECT extensions_are(
        $1, $2,
        'Schema ' || quote_ident($1) || ' should have the correct extensions'
    );

Function: public.extensions_are(name, name[], text)

Returns: text

Language: SQL

    SELECT _are(
        'extensions',
        ARRAY(SELECT _extensions($1) EXCEPT SELECT unnest($2)),
        ARRAY(SELECT unnest($2) EXCEPT SELECT _extensions($1)),
        $3
    );

Function: public.extensions_are(name[])

Returns: text

Language: SQL

  SELECT extensions_are($1, 'Should have the correct extensions');

Function: public.extensions_are(name[], text)

Returns: text

Language: SQL

    SELECT _are(
        'extensions',
        ARRAY(SELECT _extensions() EXCEPT SELECT unnest($1)),
        ARRAY(SELECT unnest($1) EXCEPT SELECT _extensions()),
        $2
    );

Function: public.fail()

Language: SQL

    SELECT ok( FALSE, NULL );

Function: public.fail(text)

Language: SQL

    SELECT ok( FALSE, $1 );

Function: public.fdw_privs_are(name, name, name[])

Returns: text

Language: SQL

    SELECT fdw_privs_are(
        $1, $2, $3,
        'Role ' || quote_ident($2) || ' should be granted '
            || CASE WHEN $3[1] IS NULL THEN 'no privileges' ELSE array_to_string($3, ', ') END
            || ' on FDW ' || quote_ident($1)
    );

Function: public.fdw_privs_are(name, name, name[], text)

Returns: text

Language: PLPGSQL

DECLARE
    grants TEXT[] := _get_fdw_privs( $2, $1::TEXT );
BEGIN
    IF grants[1] = 'undefined_fdw' THEN
        RETURN ok(FALSE, $4) || E'\n' || diag(
            '    FDW ' || quote_ident($1) || ' does not exist'
        );
    ELSIF grants[1] = 'undefined_role' THEN
        RETURN ok(FALSE, $4) || E'\n' || diag(
            '    Role ' || quote_ident($2) || ' does not exist'
        );
    END IF;
    RETURN _assets_are('privileges', grants, $3, $4);
END;

Function: public.fetchval(public.hstore, text)

Returns: text

Language: C

hstore_fetchval

Function: public.findfuncs(name, text)

Returns: text[]

Language: SQL

    SELECT findfuncs( $1, $2, NULL )

Function: public.findfuncs(name, text, text)

Returns: text[]

Language: SQL

    SELECT ARRAY(
        SELECT DISTINCT (quote_ident(n.nspname) || '.' || quote_ident(p.proname)) COLLATE "C" AS pname
          FROM pg_catalog.pg_proc p
          JOIN pg_catalog.pg_namespace n ON p.pronamespace = n.oid
         WHERE n.nspname = $1
           AND p.proname ~ $2
           AND ($3 IS NULL OR p.proname !~ $3)
         ORDER BY pname
    );

Function: public.findfuncs(text)

Returns: text[]

Language: SQL

    SELECT findfuncs( $1, NULL )

Function: public.findfuncs(text, text)

Returns: text[]

Language: SQL

    SELECT ARRAY(
        SELECT DISTINCT (quote_ident(n.nspname) || '.' || quote_ident(p.proname)) COLLATE "C" AS pname
          FROM pg_catalog.pg_proc p
          JOIN pg_catalog.pg_namespace n ON p.pronamespace = n.oid
         WHERE pg_catalog.pg_function_is_visible(p.oid)
           AND p.proname ~ $1
           AND ($2 IS NULL OR p.proname !~ $2)
         ORDER BY pname
    );

Function: public.finish(exception_on_failure boolean)

Returns: SET OF text

Language: SQL

    SELECT * FROM _finish(
        _get('curr_test'),
        _get('plan'),
        num_failed(),
        $1
    );

Function: public.fk_ok(name, name, name, name)

Returns: text

Language: SQL

    SELECT fk_ok( $1, ARRAY[$2], $3, ARRAY[$4] );

Function: public.fk_ok(name, name, name, name, name, name, text)

Returns: text

Language: SQL

    SELECT fk_ok( $1, $2, ARRAY[$3], $4, $5, ARRAY[$6], $7 );

Function: public.fk_ok(name, name, name, name, name, text)

Returns: text

Language: SQL

    SELECT fk_ok( $1, $2, ARRAY[$3], $4, $5, ARRAY[$6] );

Function: public.fk_ok(name, name, name, name, text)

Returns: text

Language: SQL

    SELECT fk_ok( $1, ARRAY[$2], $3, ARRAY[$4], $5 );

Function: public.fk_ok(name, name, name[], name, name, name[])

Returns: text

Language: SQL

    SELECT fk_ok( $1, $2, $3, $4, $5, $6,
        quote_ident($1) || '.' || quote_ident($2) || '(' || _ident_array_to_string( $3, ', ' )
        || ') should reference ' ||
        $4 || '.' || $5 || '(' || _ident_array_to_string( $6, ', ' ) || ')'
    );

Function: public.fk_ok(name, name, name[], name, name, name[], text)

Returns: text

Language: PLPGSQL

DECLARE
    sch  name;
    tab  name;
    cols name[];
BEGIN
    SELECT pk_schema_name, pk_table_name, pk_columns
      FROM pg_all_foreign_keys
      WHERE fk_schema_name = $1
        AND fk_table_name  = $2
        AND fk_columns     = $3
      INTO sch, tab, cols;

    RETURN is(
        -- have
        quote_ident($1) || '.' || quote_ident($2) || '(' || _ident_array_to_string( $3, ', ' )
        || ') REFERENCES ' || COALESCE ( sch || '.' || tab || '(' || _ident_array_to_string( cols, ', ' ) || ')', 'NOTHING' ),
        -- want
        quote_ident($1) || '.' || quote_ident($2) || '(' || _ident_array_to_string( $3, ', ' )
        || ') REFERENCES ' ||
        $4 || '.' || $5 || '(' || _ident_array_to_string( $6, ', ' ) || ')',
        $7
    );
END;

Function: public.fk_ok(name, name[], name, name[])

Returns: text

Language: SQL

    SELECT fk_ok( $1, $2, $3, $4,
        $1 || '(' || _ident_array_to_string( $2, ', ' )
        || ') should reference ' ||
        $3 || '(' || _ident_array_to_string( $4, ', ' ) || ')'
    );

Function: public.fk_ok(name, name[], name, name[], text)

Returns: text

Language: PLPGSQL

DECLARE
    tab  name;
    cols name[];
BEGIN
    SELECT pk_table_name, pk_columns
      FROM pg_all_foreign_keys
     WHERE fk_table_name = $1
       AND fk_columns    = $2
       AND pg_catalog.pg_table_is_visible(fk_table_oid)
      INTO tab, cols;

    RETURN is(
        -- have
        $1 || '(' || _ident_array_to_string( $2, ', ' )
        || ') REFERENCES ' || COALESCE( tab || '(' || _ident_array_to_string( cols, ', ' ) || ')', 'NOTHING'),
        -- want
        $1 || '(' || _ident_array_to_string( $2, ', ' )
        || ') REFERENCES ' ||
        $3 || '(' || _ident_array_to_string( $4, ', ' ) || ')',
        $5
    );
END;

Function: public.float4_dist(real, real)

Returns: real

Language: C

float4_dist

Function: public.float8_dist(double precision, double precision)

Returns: double precision

Language: C

float8_dist

Function: public.foreign_table_owner_is(name, name)

Returns: text

Language: SQL

    SELECT foreign_table_owner_is(
        $1, $2,
        'Foreign table ' || quote_ident($1) || ' should be owned by ' || quote_ident($2)
    );

Function: public.foreign_table_owner_is(name, name, name)

Returns: text

Language: SQL

    SELECT foreign_table_owner_is(
        $1, $2, $3,
        'Foreign table ' || quote_ident($1) || '.' || quote_ident($2) || ' should be owned by ' || quote_ident($3)
    );

Function: public.foreign_table_owner_is(name, name, name, text)

Returns: text

Language: PLPGSQL

DECLARE
    owner NAME := _get_rel_owner('f'::char, $1, $2);
BEGIN
    -- Make sure the table exists.
    IF owner IS NULL THEN
        RETURN ok(FALSE, $4) || E'\n' || diag(
            E'    Foreign table ' || quote_ident($1) || '.' || quote_ident($2) || ' does not exist'
        );
    END IF;

    RETURN is(owner, $3, $4);
END;

Function: public.foreign_table_owner_is(name, name, text)

Returns: text

Language: PLPGSQL

DECLARE
    owner NAME := _get_rel_owner('f'::char, $1);
BEGIN
    -- Make sure the table exists.
    IF owner IS NULL THEN
        RETURN ok(FALSE, $3) || E'\n' || diag(
            E'    Foreign table ' || quote_ident($1) || ' does not exist'
        );
    END IF;

    RETURN is(owner, $2, $3);
END;

Function: public.foreign_tables_are(name, name[])

Returns: text

Language: SQL

    SELECT _are(
        'foreign tables', _extras('f', $1, $2), _missing('f', $1, $2),
        'Schema ' || quote_ident($1) || ' should have the correct foreign tables'
    );

Function: public.foreign_tables_are(name, name[], text)

Returns: text

Language: SQL

    SELECT _are( 'foreign tables', _extras('f', $1, $2), _missing('f', $1, $2), $3);

Function: public.foreign_tables_are(name[])

Returns: text

Language: SQL

    SELECT _are(
        'foreign tables', _extras('f', $1), _missing('f', $1),
        'Search path ' || pg_catalog.current_setting('search_path') || ' should have the correct foreign tables'
    );

Function: public.foreign_tables_are(name[], text)

Returns: text

Language: SQL

    SELECT _are( 'foreign tables', _extras('f', $1), _missing('f', $1), $2);

Function: public.function_lang_is(name, name)

Returns: text

Language: SQL

    SELECT function_lang_is(
        $1, $2,
        'Function ' || quote_ident($1)
        || '() should be written in ' || quote_ident($2)
    );

Function: public.function_lang_is(name, name, name)

Returns: text

Language: SQL

    SELECT function_lang_is(
        $1, $2, $3,
        'Function ' || quote_ident($1) || '.' || quote_ident($2)
        || '() should be written in ' || quote_ident($3)
    );

Function: public.function_lang_is(name, name, name, text)

Returns: text

Language: SQL

    SELECT _func_compare($1, $2, _lang($1, $2), $3, $4 );

Function: public.function_lang_is(name, name, name[], name)

Returns: text

Language: SQL

    SELECT function_lang_is(
        $1, $2, $3, $4,
        'Function ' || quote_ident($1) || '.' || quote_ident($2) || '(' ||
        array_to_string($3, ', ') || ') should be written in ' || quote_ident($4)
    );

Function: public.function_lang_is(name, name, name[], name, text)

Returns: text

Language: SQL

    SELECT _func_compare($1, $2, $3, _lang($1, $2, $3), $4, $5 );

Function: public.function_lang_is(name, name, text)

Returns: text

Language: SQL

    SELECT _func_compare(NULL, $1, _lang($1), $2, $3 );

Function: public.function_lang_is(name, name[], name)

Returns: text

Language: SQL

    SELECT function_lang_is(
        $1, $2, $3,
        'Function ' || quote_ident($1) || '(' ||
        array_to_string($2, ', ') || ') should be written in ' || quote_ident($3)
    );

Function: public.function_lang_is(name, name[], name, text)

Returns: text

Language: SQL

    SELECT _func_compare(NULL, $1, $2, _lang($1, $2), $3, $4 );

Function: public.function_owner_is(name, name, name[], name)

Returns: text

Language: SQL

    SELECT function_owner_is(
        $1, $2, $3, $4,
        'Function ' || quote_ident($1) || '.' || quote_ident($2) || '(' ||
        array_to_string($3, ', ') || ') should be owned by ' || quote_ident($4)
    );

Function: public.function_owner_is(name, name, name[], name, text)

Returns: text

Language: PLPGSQL

DECLARE
    owner NAME := _get_func_owner($1, $2, $3);
BEGIN
    -- Make sure the function exists.
    IF owner IS NULL THEN
        RETURN ok(FALSE, $5) || E'\n' || diag(
            E'    Function ' || quote_ident($1) || '.' || quote_ident($2) || '(' ||
                    array_to_string($3, ', ') || ') does not exist'
        );
    END IF;

    RETURN is(owner, $4, $5);
END;

Function: public.function_owner_is(name, name[], name)

Returns: text

Language: SQL

    SELECT function_owner_is(
        $1, $2, $3,
        'Function ' || quote_ident($1) || '(' ||
        array_to_string($2, ', ') || ') should be owned by ' || quote_ident($3)
    );

Function: public.function_owner_is(name, name[], name, text)

Returns: text

Language: PLPGSQL

DECLARE
    owner NAME := _get_func_owner($1, $2);
BEGIN
    -- Make sure the function exists.
    IF owner IS NULL THEN
        RETURN ok(FALSE, $4) || E'\n' || diag(
            E'    Function ' || quote_ident($1) || '(' ||
                    array_to_string($2, ', ') || ') does not exist'
        );
    END IF;

    RETURN is(owner, $3, $4);
END;

Function: public.function_privs_are(name, name, name[], name, name[])

Returns: text

Language: SQL

    SELECT function_privs_are(
        $1, $2, $3, $4, $5,
        'Role ' || quote_ident($4) || ' should be granted '
            || CASE WHEN $5[1] IS NULL THEN 'no privileges' ELSE array_to_string($5, ', ') END
            || ' on function ' || quote_ident($1) || '.' || quote_ident($2)
            || '(' || array_to_string($3, ', ') || ')'
    );

Function: public.function_privs_are(name, name, name[], name, name[], text)

Returns: text

Language: SQL

    SELECT _fprivs_are(
        quote_ident($1) || '.' || quote_ident($2) || '(' || array_to_string($3, ', ') || ')',
        $4, $5, $6
    );

Function: public.function_privs_are(name, name[], name, name[])

Returns: text

Language: SQL

    SELECT function_privs_are(
        $1, $2, $3, $4,
        'Role ' || quote_ident($3) || ' should be granted '
            || CASE WHEN $4[1] IS NULL THEN 'no privileges' ELSE array_to_string($4, ', ') END
            || ' on function ' || quote_ident($1) || '(' || array_to_string($2, ', ') || ')'
    );

Function: public.function_privs_are(name, name[], name, name[], text)

Returns: text

Language: SQL

    SELECT _fprivs_are(
        quote_ident($1) || '(' || array_to_string($2, ', ') || ')',
        $3, $4, $5
    );

Function: public.function_returns(name, name, name[], text)

Language: SQL

    SELECT function_returns(
        $1, $2, $3, $4,
        'Function ' || quote_ident($1) || '.' || quote_ident($2) || '(' ||
        array_to_string($3, ', ') || ') should return ' || $4
    );

Function: public.function_returns(name, name, name[], text, text)

Returns: text

Language: SQL

    SELECT _func_compare($1, $2, $3, _returns($1, $2, $3), $4, $5 );

Returns: text

Language: SQL

    SELECT function_returns(
        $1, $2, $3,
        'Function ' || quote_ident($1) || '.' || quote_ident($2)
        || '() should return ' || $3
    );

Returns: text

Language: SQL

    SELECT _func_compare($1, $2, _returns($1, $2), $3, $4 );

Function: public.function_returns(name, name[], text)

Returns: text

Language: SQL

    SELECT function_returns(
        $1, $2, $3,
        'Function ' || quote_ident($1) || '(' ||
        array_to_string($2, ', ') || ') should return ' || $3
    );

Function: public.function_returns(name, name[], text, text)

Returns: text

Language: SQL

    SELECT _func_compare(NULL, $1, $2, _returns($1, $2), $3, $4 );

Function: public.function_returns(name, text)

Returns: text

Language: SQL

    SELECT function_returns(
        $1, $2,
        'Function ' || quote_ident($1) || '() should return ' || $2
    );

Function: public.function_returns(name, text, text)

Returns: text

Language: SQL

    SELECT _func_compare(NULL, $1, _returns($1), $2, $3 );

Function: public.functions_are(name, name[])

Returns: text

Language: SQL

    SELECT functions_are( $1, $2, 'Schema ' || quote_ident($1) || ' should have the correct functions' );

Function: public.functions_are(name, name[], text)

Returns: text

Language: SQL

    SELECT _are(
        'functions',
        ARRAY(
            SELECT name FROM tap_funky WHERE schema = $1
            EXCEPT
            SELECT $2[i]
              FROM generate_series(1, array_upper($2, 1)) s(i)
        ),
        ARRAY(
            SELECT $2[i]
               FROM generate_series(1, array_upper($2, 1)) s(i)
            EXCEPT
            SELECT name FROM tap_funky WHERE schema = $1
        ),
        $3
    );

Function: public.functions_are(name[])

Returns: text

Language: SQL

    SELECT functions_are( $1, 'Search path ' || pg_catalog.current_setting('search_path') || ' should have the correct functions' );

Function: public.functions_are(name[], text)

Returns: text

Language: SQL

    SELECT _are(
        'functions',
        ARRAY(
            SELECT name FROM tap_funky WHERE is_visible
            AND schema NOT IN ('pg_catalog', 'information_schema')
            EXCEPT
            SELECT $1[i]
              FROM generate_series(1, array_upper($1, 1)) s(i)
        ),
        ARRAY(
            SELECT $1[i]
               FROM generate_series(1, array_upper($1, 1)) s(i)
            EXCEPT
            SELECT name FROM tap_funky WHERE is_visible
            AND schema NOT IN ('pg_catalog', 'information_schema')
        ),
        $2
    );

Function: public.get_lhs(u public.mbox)

Returns: lhs

Language: PLPGSQL

Return the leftmost part of the mailbox name before the "@". This is commonly considered the "local-part" of an email address. 

DECLARE
  part TEXT;
BEGIN
  part = split_part(u, '@', 1);
  RETURN part;
END;

Function: public.get_rhs(u public.mbox)

Returns: fqdn

Language: PLPGSQL

Return the rightmost part of the mailbox name after the "@". This is namely the FQDN where the email address is routed to. 

DECLARE
  part TEXT;
BEGIN
  part = split_part(u, '@', 2);
  RETURN part;
END;

Function: public.groups_are(name[])

Returns: text

Language: SQL

    SELECT groups_are( $1, 'There should be the correct groups' );

Function: public.groups_are(name[], text)

Returns: text

Language: SQL

    SELECT _are(
        'groups',
        ARRAY(
            SELECT groname
              FROM pg_catalog.pg_group
            EXCEPT
            SELECT $1[i]
              FROM generate_series(1, array_upper($1, 1)) s(i)
        ),
        ARRAY(
            SELECT $1[i]
              FROM generate_series(1, array_upper($1, 1)) s(i)
            EXCEPT
            SELECT groname
              FROM pg_catalog.pg_group
        ),
        $2
    );

Function: public.has_cast(name, name)

Returns: text

Language: SQL

    SELECT ok(
        _cast_exists( $1, $2 ),
        'Cast (' || quote_ident($1) || ' AS ' || quote_ident($2)
        || ') should exist'
    );

Function: public.has_cast(name, name, name)

Returns: text

Language: SQL

   SELECT ok(
        _cast_exists( $1, $2, $3 ),
        'Cast (' || quote_ident($1) || ' AS ' || quote_ident($2)
        || ') WITH FUNCTION ' || quote_ident($3) || '() should exist'
    );

Function: public.has_cast(name, name, name, name)

Returns: text

Language: SQL

   SELECT ok(
       _cast_exists( $1, $2, $3, $4 ),
        'Cast (' || quote_ident($1) || ' AS ' || quote_ident($2)
        || ') WITH FUNCTION ' || quote_ident($3)
        || '.' || quote_ident($4) || '() should exist'
    );

Function: public.has_cast(name, name, name, name, text)

Returns: text

Language: SQL

   SELECT ok( _cast_exists( $1, $2, $3, $4 ), $5 );

Function: public.has_cast(name, name, name, text)

Returns: text

Language: SQL

   SELECT ok( _cast_exists( $1, $2, $3 ), $4 );

Language: SQL

    SELECT ok( _cast_exists( $1, $2 ), $3 );

Returns: text

Language: SQL

    SELECT ok( _has_group($1), $2 );

Function: public.has_index(name, name)

Returns: text

Language: SQL

    SELECT ok( _have_index( $1, $2 ), 'Index ' || quote_ident($2) || ' should exist' );

Function: public.has_index(name, name, name)

Returns: text

Language: PLPGSQL

BEGIN
   IF _is_schema($1) THEN
       -- ( schema, table, index )
       RETURN ok( _have_index( $1, $2, $3 ), 'Index ' || quote_ident($3) || ' should exist' );
   ELSE
       -- ( table, index, column/expression )
       RETURN has_index( $1, $2, $3, 'Index ' || quote_ident($2) || ' should exist' );
   END IF;
END;

Function: public.has_index(name, name, name, name)

Returns: text

Language: SQL

   SELECT has_index( $1, $2, $3, $4, 'Index ' || quote_ident($3) || ' should exist' );

Function: public.has_index(name, name, name, name, text)

Returns: text

Language: SQL

    SELECT has_index( $1, $2, $3, ARRAY[$4], $5 );

Function: public.has_index(name, name, name, name[])

Returns: text

Language: SQL

   SELECT has_index( $1, $2, $3, $4, 'Index ' || quote_ident($3) || ' should exist' );

Function: public.has_index(name, name, name, name[], text)

Returns: text

Language: PLPGSQL

DECLARE
     index_cols name[];
BEGIN
    index_cols := _ikeys($1, $2, $3 );

    IF index_cols IS NULL OR index_cols = '{}'::name[] THEN
        RETURN ok( false, $5 ) || E'\n'
            || diag( 'Index ' || quote_ident($3) || ' ON ' || quote_ident($1) || '.' || quote_ident($2) || ' not found');
    END IF;

    RETURN is(
        quote_ident($3) || ' ON ' || quote_ident($1) || '.' || quote_ident($2) || '(' || array_to_string( index_cols, ', ' ) || ')',
        quote_ident($3) || ' ON ' || quote_ident($1) || '.' || quote_ident($2) || '(' || array_to_string( $4, ', ' ) || ')',
        $5
    );
END;

Function: public.has_index(name, name, name, text)

Returns: text

Language: SQL

    SELECT CASE WHEN _is_schema( $1 ) THEN
        -- Looking for schema.table index.
            ok ( _have_index( $1, $2, $3 ), $4)
        ELSE
        -- Looking for particular columns.
            has_index( $1, $2, ARRAY[$3], $4 )
      END;

Function: public.has_index(name, name, name[])

Returns: text

Language: SQL

   SELECT has_index( $1, $2, $3, 'Index ' || quote_ident($2) || ' should exist' );

Function: public.has_index(name, name, name[], text)

Returns: text

Language: PLPGSQL

DECLARE
     index_cols name[];
BEGIN
    index_cols := _ikeys($1, $2 );

    IF index_cols IS NULL OR index_cols = '{}'::name[] THEN
        RETURN ok( false, $4 ) || E'\n'
            || diag( 'Index ' || quote_ident($2) || ' ON ' || quote_ident($1) || ' not found');
    END IF;

    RETURN is(
        quote_ident($2) || ' ON ' || quote_ident($1) || '(' || array_to_string( index_cols, ', ' ) || ')',
        quote_ident($2) || ' ON ' || quote_ident($1) || '(' || array_to_string( $3, ', ' ) || ')',
        $4
    );
END;

Function: public.has_index(name, name, text)

Returns: text

Language: SQL

    SELECT CASE WHEN $3 LIKE '%(%'
           THEN has_index( $1, $2, $3::name )
           ELSE ok( _have_index( $1, $2 ), $3 )
           END;

    SELECT ok( _is_trusted($1) IS NOT NULL, $2 );

Returns: text

Language: SQL

    SELECT ok( _relexists( $1, $2 ), $3 );

Function: public.has_relation(name, text)

Returns: text

Language: SQL

    SELECT ok( _relexists( $1 ), $2 );

Function: public.has_rightop(name, name)

Returns: text

Language: SQL

    SELECT ok(
         _op_exists($1, $2, NULL ),
        'Right operator ' || $2 || '(' || $1 || ',NONE) should exist'
    );

Function: public.has_rightop(name, name, name)

Returns: text

Language: SQL

    SELECT ok(
         _op_exists($1, $2, NULL, $3 ),
        'Right operator ' || $2 || '('
        || $1 || ',NONE) RETURNS ' || $3 || ' should exist'
    );

Function: public.has_rightop(name, name, name, name)

Returns: text

Language: SQL

    SELECT ok(
         _op_exists($1, $2, $3, NULL, $4 ),
        'Right operator ' || quote_ident($2) || '.' || $3 || '('
        || $1 || ',NONE) RETURNS ' || $4 || ' should exist'
    );

Function: public.has_rightop(name, name, name, name, text)

Returns: text

Language: SQL

    SELECT ok( _op_exists( $1, $2, $3, NULL, $4), $5 );

Function: public.has_rightop(name, name, name, text)

Returns: text

Language: SQL

    SELECT ok( _op_exists( $1, $2, NULL, $3), $4 );

Function: public.has_rightop(name, name, text)

Returns: text

Language: SQL

    SELECT ok( _op_exists( $1, $2, NULL), $3 );

    SELECT ok( _is_instead($1, $2) IS NOT NULL, 'Relation ' || quote_ident($1) || ' should have rule ' || quote_ident($2) );

Function: public.has_schema(name)

Returns: text

Language: SQL

    SELECT has_schema( $1, 'Schema ' || quote_ident($1) || ' should exist' );

Function: public.has_schema(name, text)

Returns: text

Language: SQL

    SELECT ok(
        EXISTS(
            SELECT true
              FROM pg_catalog.pg_namespace
             WHERE nspname = $1
        ), $2
    );

Function: public.has_table(name)

Returns: text

Language: SQL

    SELECT has_table( $1, 'Table ' || quote_ident($1) || ' should exist' );

Function: public.has_table(name, name)

Returns: text

Language: SQL

    SELECT ok(
        _rexists( '{r,p}'::char[], $1, $2 ),
        'Table ' || quote_ident($1) || '.' || quote_ident($2) || ' should exist'
    );

Function: public.has_table(name, name, text)

Returns: text

Language: SQL

    SELECT ok( _rexists( '{r,p}'::char[], $1, $2 ), $3 );

Function: public.has_table(name, text)

Returns: text

Language: SQL

    SELECT ok( _rexists( '{r,p}'::char[], $1 ), $2 );

Function: public.has_tablespace(name)

Returns: text

Language: SQL

    SELECT has_tablespace( $1, 'Tablespace ' || quote_ident($1) || ' should exist' );

Function: public.has_tablespace(name, text)

Returns: text

Language: SQL

    SELECT ok(
        EXISTS(
            SELECT true
              FROM pg_catalog.pg_tablespace
             WHERE spcname = $1
        ), $2
    );

Function: public.has_tablespace(name, text, text)

Returns: text

Language: PLPGSQL

BEGIN
    IF pg_version_num() >= 90200 THEN
        RETURN ok(
            EXISTS(
                SELECT true
                  FROM pg_catalog.pg_tablespace
                 WHERE spcname = $1
                   AND pg_tablespace_location(oid) = $2
            ), $3
        );
    ELSE
        RETURN ok(
            EXISTS(
                SELECT true
                  FROM pg_catalog.pg_tablespace
                 WHERE spcname = $1
                   AND spclocation = $2
            ), $3
        );
    END IF;
END;

Function: public.has_trigger(name, name)

Returns: text

Language: SQL

    SELECT ok( _trig($1, $2), 'Table ' || quote_ident($1) || ' should have trigger ' || quote_ident($2));

Function: public.has_trigger(name, name, name)

Returns: text

Language: SQL

    SELECT has_trigger(
        $1, $2, $3,
        'Table ' || quote_ident($1) || '.' || quote_ident($2) || ' should have trigger ' || quote_ident($3)
    );

Language: SQL

    SELECT ok( _trig($1, $2, $3), $4);

Language: SQL

    SELECT ok( _trig($1, $2), $3);

Function: public.hasnt_schema(name, text)

Returns: text

Language: SQL

    SELECT ok(
        NOT EXISTS(
            SELECT true
              FROM pg_catalog.pg_namespace
             WHERE nspname = $1
        ), $2
    );

Function: public.hasnt_sequence(name)

Returns: text

Language: SQL

    SELECT hasnt_sequence( $1, 'Sequence ' || quote_ident($1) || ' should not exist' );

Function: public.hasnt_sequence(name, name, text)

Returns: text

Language: SQL

    SELECT ok( NOT _rexists( 'S', $1, $2 ), $3 );

Function: public.hasnt_sequence(name, text)

Returns: text

Language: SQL

    SELECT ok( NOT _rexists( 'S', $1 ), $2 );

Function: public.hasnt_table(name)

Returns: text

Language: SQL

    SELECT hasnt_table( $1, 'Table ' || quote_ident($1) || ' should not exist' );

Function: public.hasnt_table(name, name)

Returns: text

Language: SQL

    SELECT ok(
        NOT _rexists( '{r,p}'::char[], $1, $2 ),
        'Table ' || quote_ident($1) || '.' || quote_ident($2) || ' should not exist'
    );

Function: public.hasnt_table(name, name, text)

Returns: text

Language: SQL

    SELECT ok( NOT _rexists( '{r,p}'::char[], $1, $2 ), $3 );

Function: public.hasnt_table(name, text)

Returns: text

Language: SQL

    SELECT ok( NOT _rexists( '{r,p}'::char[], $1 ), $2 );

Function: public.hasnt_tablespace(name)

Returns: text

Language: SQL

    SELECT hasnt_tablespace( $1, 'Tablespace ' || quote_ident($1) || ' should not exist' );

Function: public.hasnt_tablespace(name, text)

Returns: text

Language: SQL

    SELECT ok(
        NOT EXISTS(
            SELECT true
              FROM pg_catalog.pg_tablespace
             WHERE spcname = $1
        ), $2
    );

Function: public.hasnt_trigger(name, name)

Returns: text

Language: SQL

    SELECT ok( NOT _trig($1, $2), 'Table ' || quote_ident($1) || ' should not have trigger ' || quote_ident($2));

Function: public.hasnt_trigger(name, name, name)

Returns: text

Language: SQL

    SELECT ok(
        NOT _trig($1, $2, $3),
        'Table ' || quote_ident($1) || '.' || quote_ident($2) || ' should not have trigger ' || quote_ident($3)
    );

Function: public.hasnt_trigger(name, name, name, text)

Returns: text

Language: SQL

    SELECT ok( NOT _trig($1, $2, $3), $4);

Function: public.hasnt_trigger(name, name, text)

Returns: text

Language: SQL

    SELECT ok( NOT _trig($1, $2), $3);

Function: public.hasnt_type(name)

Returns: text

Language: SQL

    SELECT ok( NOT _has_type( $1, NULL ), ('Type ' || quote_ident($1) || ' should not exist')::text );

Function: public.hasnt_type(name, name)

Returns: text

Language: SQL

    SELECT hasnt_type( $1, $2, 'Type ' || quote_ident($1) || '.' || quote_ident($2) || ' should not exist' );

Returns: text

Language: SQL

    SELECT ok( NOT _has_type( $1, $2, NULL ), $3 );

Returns: text

Language: SQL

    SELECT ok( NOT _has_type( $1, NULL ), $2 );

Language: SQL

    SELECT ok( NOT _has_user( $1 ), 'User ' || quote_ident($1) || ' should not exist');

Function: public.hasnt_user(name, text)

Returns: text

Language: SQL

    SELECT ok( NOT _has_user($1), $2 );

Function: public.ialike(anyelement, text)

Returns: text

Language: SQL

    SELECT _alike( $1 ~~* $2, $1, $2, NULL );

Function: public.ialike(anyelement, text, text)

Returns: text

Language: SQL

    SELECT _alike( $1 ~~* $2, $1, $2, $3 );

Function: public.imatches(anyelement, text)

Returns: text

Language: SQL

    SELECT _alike( $1 ~* $2, $1, $2, NULL );

Function: public.imatches(anyelement, text, text)

Returns: text

Language: SQL

    SELECT _alike( $1 ~* $2, $1, $2, $3 );

Function: public.in_todo()

Returns: boolean

Language: PLPGSQL

DECLARE
    todos integer;
BEGIN
    todos := _get('todo');
    RETURN CASE WHEN todos IS NULL THEN FALSE ELSE TRUE END;
END;

Function: public.index_is_primary(name)

Returns: text

Language: PLPGSQL

DECLARE
    res boolean;
BEGIN
    SELECT x.indisprimary
      FROM pg_catalog.pg_index x
      JOIN pg_catalog.pg_class ci ON ci.oid = x.indexrelid
      JOIN pg_catalog.pg_class ct ON ct.oid = x.indrelid
     WHERE ci.relname = $1
       AND pg_catalog.pg_table_is_visible(ct.oid)
      INTO res;

      RETURN ok(
          COALESCE(res, false),
          'Index ' || quote_ident($1) || ' should be on a primary key'
      );
END;

Function: public.index_is_primary(name, name)

Returns: text

Language: PLPGSQL

DECLARE
    res boolean;
BEGIN
    SELECT x.indisprimary
      FROM pg_catalog.pg_index x
      JOIN pg_catalog.pg_class ct ON ct.oid = x.indrelid
      JOIN pg_catalog.pg_class ci ON ci.oid = x.indexrelid
     WHERE ct.relname = $1
       AND ci.relname = $2
       AND pg_catalog.pg_table_is_visible(ct.oid)
     INTO res;

      RETURN ok(
          COALESCE(res, false),
          'Index ' || quote_ident($2) || ' should be on a primary key'
      );
END;

Function: public.index_is_primary(name, name, name)

Returns: text

Language: SQL

    SELECT index_is_primary(
        $1, $2, $3,
        'Index ' || quote_ident($3) || ' should be on a primary key'
    );

Function: public.index_is_primary(name, name, name, text)

Returns: text

Language: PLPGSQL

DECLARE
    res boolean;
BEGIN
    SELECT x.indisprimary
      FROM pg_catalog.pg_index x
      JOIN pg_catalog.pg_class ct    ON ct.oid = x.indrelid
      JOIN pg_catalog.pg_class ci    ON ci.oid = x.indexrelid
      JOIN pg_catalog.pg_namespace n ON n.oid = ct.relnamespace
     WHERE ct.relname = $2
       AND ci.relname = $3
       AND n.nspname  = $1
      INTO res;

      RETURN ok( COALESCE(res, false), $4 );
END;

Function: public.index_is_type(name, name)

Returns: text

Language: PLPGSQL

DECLARE
    aname name;
BEGIN
    SELECT am.amname
      FROM pg_catalog.pg_index x
      JOIN pg_catalog.pg_class ci ON ci.oid = x.indexrelid
      JOIN pg_catalog.pg_am am    ON ci.relam = am.oid
     WHERE ci.relname = $1
      INTO aname;

      return is(
          aname, $2,
          'Index ' || quote_ident($1) || ' should be a ' || quote_ident($2) || ' index'
      );
END;

Function: public.index_is_type(name, name, name)

Returns: text

Language: PLPGSQL

DECLARE
    aname name;
BEGIN
    SELECT am.amname
      FROM pg_catalog.pg_index x
      JOIN pg_catalog.pg_class ct ON ct.oid = x.indrelid
      JOIN pg_catalog.pg_class ci ON ci.oid = x.indexrelid
      JOIN pg_catalog.pg_am am    ON ci.relam = am.oid
     WHERE ct.relname = $1
       AND ci.relname = $2
      INTO aname;

      return is(
          aname, $3,
          'Index ' || quote_ident($2) || ' should be a ' || quote_ident($3) || ' index'
      );
END;

Function: public.index_is_type(name, name, name, name)

Returns: text

Language: SQL

    SELECT index_is_type(
        $1, $2, $3, $4,
        'Index ' || quote_ident($3) || ' should be a ' || quote_ident($4) || ' index'
    );

Function: public.index_is_type(name, name, name, name, text)

Returns: text

Language: PLPGSQL

DECLARE
    aname name;
BEGIN
    SELECT am.amname
      FROM pg_catalog.pg_index x
      JOIN pg_catalog.pg_class ct    ON ct.oid = x.indrelid
      JOIN pg_catalog.pg_class ci    ON ci.oid = x.indexrelid
      JOIN pg_catalog.pg_namespace n ON n.oid = ct.relnamespace
      JOIN pg_catalog.pg_am am       ON ci.relam = am.oid
     WHERE ct.relname = $2
       AND ci.relname = $3
       AND n.nspname  = $1
      INTO aname;

      return is( aname, $4, $5 );
END;

Function: public.index_is_unique(name)

Returns: text

Language: PLPGSQL

DECLARE
    res boolean;
BEGIN
    SELECT x.indisunique
      FROM pg_catalog.pg_index x
      JOIN pg_catalog.pg_class ci ON ci.oid = x.indexrelid
      JOIN pg_catalog.pg_class ct ON ct.oid = x.indrelid
     WHERE ci.relname = $1
       AND pg_catalog.pg_table_is_visible(ct.oid)
      INTO res;

      RETURN ok(
          COALESCE(res, false),
          'Index ' || quote_ident($1) || ' should be unique'
      );
END;

Function: public.index_is_unique(name, name)

Returns: text

Language: PLPGSQL

DECLARE
    res boolean;
BEGIN
    SELECT x.indisunique
      FROM pg_catalog.pg_index x
      JOIN pg_catalog.pg_class ct ON ct.oid = x.indrelid
      JOIN pg_catalog.pg_class ci ON ci.oid = x.indexrelid
     WHERE ct.relname = $1
       AND ci.relname = $2
       AND pg_catalog.pg_table_is_visible(ct.oid)
      INTO res;

      RETURN ok(
          COALESCE(res, false),
          'Index ' || quote_ident($2) || ' should be unique'
      );
END;

Function: public.index_is_unique(name, name, name)

Returns: text

Language: SQL

    SELECT index_is_unique(
        $1, $2, $3,
        'Index ' || quote_ident($3) || ' should be unique'
    );

Function: public.index_is_unique(name, name, name, text)

Returns: text

Language: PLPGSQL

DECLARE
    res boolean;
BEGIN
    SELECT x.indisunique
      FROM pg_catalog.pg_index x
      JOIN pg_catalog.pg_class ct    ON ct.oid = x.indrelid
      JOIN pg_catalog.pg_class ci    ON ci.oid = x.indexrelid
      JOIN pg_catalog.pg_namespace n ON n.oid = ct.relnamespace
     WHERE ct.relname = $2
       AND ci.relname = $3
       AND n.nspname  = $1
      INTO res;

      RETURN ok( COALESCE(res, false), $4 );
END;

Function: public.index_owner_is(name, name, name)

Returns: text

Language: SQL

    SELECT index_owner_is(
        $1, $2, $3,
        'Index ' || quote_ident($2) || ' ON '
        || quote_ident($1) || ' should be owned by ' || quote_ident($3)
    );

Function: public.index_owner_is(name, name, name, name)

Returns: text

Language: SQL

    SELECT index_owner_is(
        $1, $2, $3, $4,
        'Index ' || quote_ident($3) || ' ON '
        || quote_ident($1) || '.' || quote_ident($2)
        || ' should be owned by ' || quote_ident($4)
    );

Function: public.index_owner_is(name, name, name, name, text)

Returns: text

Language: PLPGSQL

DECLARE
    owner NAME := _get_index_owner($1, $2, $3);
BEGIN
    -- Make sure the index exists.
    IF owner IS NULL THEN
        RETURN ok(FALSE, $5) || E'\n' || diag(
            E'    Index ' || quote_ident($3) || ' ON '
            || quote_ident($1) || '.' || quote_ident($2) || ' not found'
        );
    END IF;

    RETURN is(owner, $4, $5);
END;

Function: public.index_owner_is(name, name, name, text)

Returns: text

Language: PLPGSQL

DECLARE
    owner NAME := _get_index_owner($1, $2);
BEGIN
    -- Make sure the index exists.
    IF owner IS NULL THEN
        RETURN ok(FALSE, $4) || E'\n' || diag(
            E'    Index ' || quote_ident($2) || ' ON ' || quote_ident($1) || ' not found'
        );
    END IF;

    RETURN is(owner, $3, $4);
END;

Function: public.indexes_are(name, name, name[])

Returns: text

Language: SQL

    SELECT indexes_are( $1, $2, $3, 'Table ' || quote_ident($1) || '.' || quote_ident($2) || ' should have the correct indexes' );

Function: public.indexes_are(name, name, name[], text)

Returns: text

Language: SQL

    SELECT _are(
        'indexes',
        ARRAY(
            SELECT ci.relname
              FROM pg_catalog.pg_index x
              JOIN pg_catalog.pg_class ct    ON ct.oid = x.indrelid
              JOIN pg_catalog.pg_class ci    ON ci.oid = x.indexrelid
              JOIN pg_catalog.pg_namespace n ON n.oid = ct.relnamespace
             WHERE ct.relname = $2
               AND n.nspname  = $1
            EXCEPT
            SELECT $3[i]
              FROM generate_series(1, array_upper($3, 1)) s(i)
        ),
        ARRAY(
            SELECT $3[i]
              FROM generate_series(1, array_upper($3, 1)) s(i)
            EXCEPT
            SELECT ci.relname
              FROM pg_catalog.pg_index x
              JOIN pg_catalog.pg_class ct    ON ct.oid = x.indrelid
              JOIN pg_catalog.pg_class ci    ON ci.oid = x.indexrelid
              JOIN pg_catalog.pg_namespace n ON n.oid = ct.relnamespace
             WHERE ct.relname = $2
               AND n.nspname  = $1
        ),
        $4
    );

Function: public.indexes_are(name, name[])

Returns: text

Language: SQL

    SELECT indexes_are( $1, $2, 'Table ' || quote_ident($1) || ' should have the correct indexes' );

Function: public.indexes_are(name, name[], text)

Returns: text

Language: SQL

    SELECT _are(
        'indexes',
        ARRAY(
            SELECT ci.relname
              FROM pg_catalog.pg_index x
              JOIN pg_catalog.pg_class ct ON ct.oid = x.indrelid
              JOIN pg_catalog.pg_class ci ON ci.oid = x.indexrelid
              JOIN pg_catalog.pg_namespace n ON n.oid = ct.relnamespace
             WHERE ct.relname = $1
               AND pg_catalog.pg_table_is_visible(ct.oid)
               AND n.nspname NOT IN ('pg_catalog', 'information_schema')
            EXCEPT
            SELECT $2[i]
              FROM generate_series(1, array_upper($2, 1)) s(i)
        ),
        ARRAY(
            SELECT $2[i]
              FROM generate_series(1, array_upper($2, 1)) s(i)
            EXCEPT
            SELECT ci.relname
              FROM pg_catalog.pg_index x
              JOIN pg_catalog.pg_class ct ON ct.oid = x.indrelid
              JOIN pg_catalog.pg_class ci ON ci.oid = x.indexrelid
              JOIN pg_catalog.pg_namespace n ON n.oid = ct.relnamespace
             WHERE ct.relname = $1
               AND pg_catalog.pg_table_is_visible(ct.oid)
               AND n.nspname NOT IN ('pg_catalog', 'information_schema')
        ),
        $3
    );

Function: public.int2_dist(smallint, smallint)

Language: C

Function: public.int4_dist(integer, integer)

Function: public.interval_dist(interval, interval)

Returns: interval

Language: C

interval_dist

Function: public.is(anyelement, anyelement)

Returns: text

Language: SQL

    SELECT is( $1, $2, NULL);

Function: public.is(anyelement, anyelement, text)

Returns: text

Language: PLPGSQL

DECLARE
    result BOOLEAN;
    output TEXT;
BEGIN
    -- Would prefer $1 IS NOT DISTINCT FROM, but that's not supported by 8.1.
    result := NOT $1 IS DISTINCT FROM $2;
    output := ok( result, $3 );
    RETURN output || CASE result WHEN TRUE THEN '' ELSE E'\n' || diag(
           '        have: ' || CASE WHEN $1 IS NULL THEN 'NULL' ELSE $1::text END ||
        E'\n        want: ' || CASE WHEN $2 IS NULL THEN 'NULL' ELSE $2::text END
    ) END;
END;

Function: public.is_aggregate(name)

Returns: text

Language: SQL

    SELECT _func_compare(
        NULL, $1,  _type_func('a', $1),
        'Function ' || quote_ident($1) || '() should be an aggregate function'
    );

Function: public.is_aggregate(name, name)

Returns: text

Language: SQL

    SELECT _func_compare(
        $1, $2, _type_func('a', $1, $2),
        'Function ' || quote_ident($1) || '.' || quote_ident($2) || '() should be an aggregate function'
    );

Function: public.is_aggregate(name, name, name[])

Returns: text

Language: SQL

    SELECT _func_compare(
        $1, $2, $3, _type_func('a', $1, $2, $3),
        'Function ' || quote_ident($1) || '.' || quote_ident($2) || '(' ||
        array_to_string($3, ', ') || ') should be an aggregate function'
    );

Returns: text

Language: SQL

    SELECT _func_compare($1, $2, $3, _type_func( 'a', $1, $2, $3), $4 );

Function: public.is_aggregate(name, name, text)

Returns: text

Language: SQL

    SELECT _func_compare($1, $2, _type_func('a', $1, $2), $3 );

Function: public.is_aggregate(name, name[])

Returns: text

Language: SQL

    SELECT _func_compare(
        NULL, $1, $2, _type_func('a', $1, $2),
        'Function ' || quote_ident($1) || '(' ||
        array_to_string($2, ', ') || ') should be an aggregate function'
    );

Function: public.is_aggregate(name, name[], text)

Returns: text

Language: SQL

    SELECT _func_compare( NULL, $1, $2, _type_func('a', $1, $2), $3 );

Function: public.is_aggregate(name, text)

Returns: text

Language: SQL

    SELECT _func_compare(NULL, $1, _type_func('a', $1), $2 );

Function: public.is_ancestor_of(name, name)

        _ancestor_of( $1, $2, NULL ),

    );

    SELECT ok(
        _ancestor_of( $1, $2, $3 ),
        'Table ' || quote_ident( $1 ) || ' should be ancestor ' || $3 || ' of ' || quote_ident( $2)
    );

    SELECT ok( _ancestor_of( $1, $2, $3 ), $4 );

    SELECT ok(
        _ancestor_of( $1, $2, $3, $4, NULL ),
        'Table ' || quote_ident( $1 ) || '.' || quote_ident( $2 )
        || ' should be an ancestor of '
        || quote_ident( $3 ) || '.' || quote_ident( $4 )
    );

    SELECT ok(
        _ancestor_of( $1, $2, $3, $4, $5 ),
        'Table ' || quote_ident( $1 ) || '.' || quote_ident( $2 )
        || ' should be ancestor ' || $5 || ' for '
        || quote_ident( $3 ) || '.' || quote_ident( $4 )
    );

Returns: text

Language: SQL

    SELECT ok( _ancestor_of( $1, $2, $3, $4, $5 ), $6 );

Function: public.is_ancestor_of(name, name, name, name, text)

Returns: text

Language: SQL

    SELECT ok( _ancestor_of( $1, $2, $3, $4, NULL ), $5 );

Function: public.is_ancestor_of(name, name, text)

Returns: text

Language: SQL

    SELECT ok( _ancestor_of( $1, $2, NULL ), $3 );

Function: public.is_clustered(name)

Returns: text

Language: PLPGSQL

DECLARE
    res boolean;
BEGIN
    SELECT x.indisclustered
      FROM pg_catalog.pg_index x
      JOIN pg_catalog.pg_class ci ON ci.oid = x.indexrelid
     WHERE ci.relname = $1
      INTO res;

      RETURN ok(
          COALESCE(res, false),
          'Table should be clustered on index ' || quote_ident($1)
      );
END;

Function: public.is_clustered(name, name)

Returns: text

Language: PLPGSQL

DECLARE
    res boolean;
BEGIN
    SELECT x.indisclustered
      FROM pg_catalog.pg_index x
      JOIN pg_catalog.pg_class ct ON ct.oid = x.indrelid
      JOIN pg_catalog.pg_class ci ON ci.oid = x.indexrelid
     WHERE ct.relname = $1
       AND ci.relname = $2
      INTO res;

      RETURN ok(
          COALESCE(res, false),
          'Table ' || quote_ident($1) || ' should be clustered on index ' || quote_ident($2)
      );
END;

Function: public.is_clustered(name, name, name)

Returns: text

Language: SQL

    SELECT is_clustered(
        $1, $2, $3,
        'Table ' || quote_ident($1) || '.' || quote_ident($2) ||
        ' should be clustered on index ' || quote_ident($3)
    );

Function: public.is_clustered(name, name, name, text)

Returns: text

Language: PLPGSQL

DECLARE
    res boolean;
BEGIN
    SELECT x.indisclustered
      FROM pg_catalog.pg_index x
      JOIN pg_catalog.pg_class ct    ON ct.oid = x.indrelid
      JOIN pg_catalog.pg_class ci    ON ci.oid = x.indexrelid
      JOIN pg_catalog.pg_namespace n ON n.oid = ct.relnamespace
     WHERE ct.relname = $2
       AND ci.relname = $3
       AND n.nspname  = $1
      INTO res;

      RETURN ok( COALESCE(res, false), $4 );
END;

    );

    );

        || quote_ident( $3 ) || '.' || quote_ident( $4 )
    );

        || quote_ident( $3 ) || '.' || quote_ident( $4 )
    );

    SELECT ok( _ancestor_of( $2, $1, NULL ), $3 );

Function: public.is_empty(text)

Returns: text

Language: SQL

    SELECT is_empty( $1, NULL );

Function: public.is_empty(text, text)

Returns: text

Language: PLPGSQL

DECLARE
    extras  TEXT[]  := '{}';
    res     BOOLEAN := TRUE;
    msg     TEXT    := '';
    rec     RECORD;
BEGIN
    -- Find extra records.
    FOR rec in EXECUTE _query($1) LOOP
        extras := extras || rec::text;
    END LOOP;

    -- What extra records do we have?
    IF extras[1] IS NOT NULL THEN
        res := FALSE;
        msg := E'\n' || diag(
            E'    Unexpected records:\n        '
            ||  array_to_string( extras, E'\n        ' )
        );
    END IF;

    RETURN ok(res, $2) || msg;
END;

Function: public.is_indexed(name, name)

Returns: text

Language: SQL

   SELECT ok ( _is_indexed( NULL, $1, ARRAY[$2]::NAME[]) );

Function: public.is_indexed(name, name, name)

Returns: text

Language: SQL

    SELECT CASE WHEN _is_schema( $1 ) THEN
                -- Looking for schema.table index.
                is_indexed( $1, $2, ARRAY[$3]::NAME[] )
           ELSE
                -- Looking for particular columns.
                is_indexed( $1, ARRAY[$2]::NAME[], $3 )
           END;

Function: public.is_indexed(name, name, name, text)

Returns: text

Language: SQL

   SELECT ok ( _is_indexed( $1, $2, ARRAY[$3]::NAME[]), $4);

Function: public.is_indexed(name, name, name[])

Returns: text

Language: SQL

   SELECT ok(
       _is_indexed($1, $2, $3),
       'Should have an index on ' ||  quote_ident($1) || '.' || quote_ident($2) || '(' || array_to_string( $3, ', ' ) || ')'
    );

Function: public.is_indexed(name, name, name[], text)

Returns: text

Language: SQL

   SELECT ok( _is_indexed($1, $2, $3), $4 );

Function: public.is_indexed(name, name[])

Returns: text

Language: SQL

   SELECT ok(
       _is_indexed(NULL, $1, $2),
       'Should have an index on ' ||  quote_ident($1) || '(' || array_to_string( $2, ', ' ) || ')'
   );

Returns: text

Language: SQL

   SELECT ok( _is_indexed(NULL, $1, $2), $3 );

Function: public.is_member_of(name, name)

Returns: text

Language: SQL

    SELECT is_member_of( $1, ARRAY[$2] );

Function: public.is_member_of(name, name, text)

Returns: text

Language: SQL

    SELECT is_member_of( $1, ARRAY[$2], $3 );

Function: public.is_member_of(name, name[])

Returns: text

Language: SQL

    SELECT is_member_of( $1, $2, 'Should have members of role ' || quote_ident($1) );

Function: public.is_member_of(name, name[], text)

Returns: text

Language: PLPGSQL

DECLARE
    missing text[];
BEGIN
    IF NOT _has_role($1) THEN
        RETURN fail( $3 ) || E'\n' || diag (
            '    Role ' || quote_ident($1) || ' does not exist'
        );
    END IF;

    SELECT ARRAY(
        SELECT quote_ident($2[i])
          FROM generate_series(1, array_upper($2, 1)) s(i)
          LEFT JOIN pg_catalog.pg_roles r ON rolname = $2[i]
         WHERE r.oid IS NULL
            OR NOT r.oid = ANY ( _grolist($1) )
         ORDER BY s.i
    ) INTO missing;
    IF missing[1] IS NULL THEN
        RETURN ok( true, $3 );
    END IF;
    RETURN ok( false, $3 ) || E'\n' || diag(
        '    Members missing from the ' || quote_ident($1) || E' role:\n        ' ||
        array_to_string( missing, E'\n        ')
    );
END;

    );

Function: public.is_superuser(name, text)

Returns: text

Language: PLPGSQL

DECLARE
    is_super boolean := _is_super($1);
BEGIN
    IF is_super IS NULL THEN
        RETURN fail( $2 ) || E'\n' || diag( '    User ' || quote_ident($1) || ' does not exist') ;
    END IF;
    RETURN ok( is_super, $2 );
END;

Function: public.isa_ok(anyelement, regtype)

Returns: text

Language: SQL

    SELECT isa_ok($1, $2, 'the value');

Function: public.isa_ok(anyelement, regtype, text)

Returns: text

Language: PLPGSQL

DECLARE
    typeof regtype := pg_typeof($1);
BEGIN
    IF typeof = $2 THEN RETURN ok(true, $3 || ' isa ' || $2 ); END IF;
    RETURN ok(false, $3 || ' isa ' || $2 ) || E'\n' ||
        diag('    ' || $3 || ' isn''t a "' || $2 || '" it''s a "' || typeof || '"');
END;

Function: public.isdefined(public.hstore, text)

Returns: boolean

Language: C

hstore_defined

Function: public.isexists(public.hstore, text)

Returns: boolean

Language: C

hstore_exists

Function: public.isnt(anyelement, anyelement)

Returns: text

Language: SQL

    SELECT isnt( $1, $2, NULL);

Function: public.isnt(anyelement, anyelement, text)

Returns: text

Language: PLPGSQL

DECLARE
    result BOOLEAN;
    output TEXT;
BEGIN
    result := $1 IS DISTINCT FROM $2;
    output := ok( result, $3 );
    RETURN output || CASE result WHEN TRUE THEN '' ELSE E'\n' || diag(
           '        have: ' || COALESCE( $1::text, 'NULL' ) ||
        E'\n        want: anything else'
    ) END;
END;

Returns: text

Language: SQL

    SELECT _func_compare(NULL, $1, NOT _definer($1), $2 );

Function: public.isnt_descendent_of(name, name)

Returns: text

Language: SQL

    SELECT ok(
       NOT  _ancestor_of( $2, $1, NULL ),
        'Table ' || quote_ident( $1 ) || ' should not be a descendent of ' || quote_ident( $2)
    );

Function: public.isnt_descendent_of(name, name, integer)

Returns: text

Language: SQL

    SELECT ok(
       NOT  _ancestor_of( $2, $1, $3 ),
        'Table ' || quote_ident( $1 ) || ' should not be descendent ' || $3 || ' from ' || quote_ident( $2)
    );

Function: public.isnt_descendent_of(name, name, integer, text)

Returns: text

Language: SQL

    SELECT ok(NOT  _ancestor_of( $2, $1, $3 ), $4 );

Returns: text

Language: SQL

       NOT  _ancestor_of( $3, $4, $1, $2, NULL ),
        'Table ' || quote_ident( $1 ) || '.' || quote_ident( $2 )
        || ' should not be a descendent of '
        || quote_ident( $3 ) || '.' || quote_ident( $4 )
    );

Returns: text

Language: SQL

    SELECT ok(
       NOT  _ancestor_of( $3, $4, $1, $2, $5 ),
        'Table ' || quote_ident( $1 ) || '.' || quote_ident( $2 )
        || ' should not be descendent ' || $5 || ' from '
        || quote_ident( $3 ) || '.' || quote_ident( $4 )
    );

Language: SQL

Language: SQL

    SELECT ok(NOT  _ancestor_of( $2, $1, NULL ), $3 );

Function: public.isnt_empty(text)

Returns: text

Language: SQL

    SELECT isnt_empty( $1, NULL );

Function: public.isnt_empty(text, text)

Returns: text

Language: PLPGSQL

DECLARE
    res  BOOLEAN := FALSE;
    rec  RECORD;
BEGIN
    -- Find extra records.
    FOR rec in EXECUTE _query($1) LOOP
        res := TRUE;
        EXIT;
    END LOOP;

    RETURN ok(res, $2);
END;

Function: public.isnt_member_of(name, name)

Returns: text

Language: SQL

    SELECT isnt_member_of( $1, ARRAY[$2] );

Function: public.isnt_member_of(name, name, text)

Returns: text

Language: SQL

    SELECT isnt_member_of( $1, ARRAY[$2], $3 );

Function: public.isnt_member_of(name, name[])

Returns: text

Language: SQL

    SELECT isnt_member_of( $1, $2, 'Should not have members of role ' || quote_ident($1) );

Function: public.isnt_member_of(name, name[], text)

Returns: text

Language: PLPGSQL

DECLARE
    extra text[];
BEGIN
    IF NOT _has_role($1) THEN
        RETURN fail( $3 ) || E'\n' || diag (
            '    Role ' || quote_ident($1) || ' does not exist'
        );
    END IF;

    SELECT ARRAY(
        SELECT quote_ident($2[i])
          FROM generate_series(1, array_upper($2, 1)) s(i)
          LEFT JOIN pg_catalog.pg_roles r ON rolname = $2[i]
         WHERE r.oid = ANY ( _grolist($1) )
         ORDER BY s.i
    ) INTO extra;
    IF extra[1] IS NULL THEN
        RETURN ok( true, $3 );
    END IF;
    RETURN ok( false, $3 ) || E'\n' || diag(
        '    Members, who should not be in ' || quote_ident($1) || E' role:\n        ' ||
        array_to_string( extra, E'\n        ')
    );
END;

Function: public.isnt_superuser(name)

Function: public.isnt_superuser(name, text)

Returns: text

Language: PLPGSQL

DECLARE
    is_super boolean := _is_super($1);
BEGIN
    IF is_super IS NULL THEN
        RETURN fail( $2 ) || E'\n' || diag( '    User ' || quote_ident($1) || ' does not exist') ;
    END IF;
    RETURN ok( NOT is_super, $2 );
END;

Function: public.job_create(_tenant_customer_id uuid, _job_type text, _reference_id uuid, _data jsonb)

Returns: uuid

Language: PLPGSQL

creates a new job given a tenant_customer_id UUID,job_type TEXT,reference_id UUID

DECLARE
  _new_job_id      UUID;
BEGIN

  EXECUTE 'INSERT INTO job(
    tenant_customer_id,
    type_id,
    reference_id,
    data
  ) VALUES($1,$2,$3,$4) RETURNING id'
  INTO
    _new_job_id
  USING
    _tenant_customer_id,
    tc_id_from_name('job_type',_job_type),
    _reference_id,
    _data;

  RETURN _new_job_id;

END;

Function: public.job_event_notify()

Returns: trigger

Language: PLPGSQL

DECLARE
    _payload JSONB;
BEGIN

  SELECT
    JSONB_BUILD_OBJECT(
      'job_id',j.job_id,
      'type',j.job_type_name,
      'status',j.job_status_name,
      'reference_id',j.reference_id,
      'reference_table',j.reference_table,
      'routing_key',j.routing_key
    )
  INTO _payload
  FROM v_job j
  WHERE job_id = NEW.id;
  
  PERFORM notify_event('job_event','job_event_notify',_payload::TEXT);

  RETURN NEW;
END;

Function: public.job_finish()

Returns: trigger

Language: PLPGSQL

DECLARE 
  v_job_status RECORD;
BEGIN

  SELECT * INTO v_job_status FROM job_status WHERE id=NEW.status_id;

  IF NOT v_job_status.is_final THEN 
    RETURN NEW;
  END IF;

  NEW.end_date = NOW();

  RETURN NEW;
END;

Function: public.job_prevent_if_final()

Returns: trigger

Language: PLPGSQL

DECLARE 
  v_job_status RECORD;
BEGIN

  SELECT * INTO v_job_status FROM job_status WHERE id=OLD.status_id;

  IF v_job_status.is_final THEN 
    RAISE EXCEPTION 'cannot modify job (%), has status: %',NEW.id,v_job_status.name;
  END IF;

  RETURN NEW;
END;

Function: public.job_reference_status_update()

Returns: trigger

Language: PLPGSQL

DECLARE
_job_type         RECORD;
_job_status       RECORD;
_target_status    RECORD;
BEGIN

   SELECT * INTO _job_type FROM job_type WHERE id = NEW.type_id;

   IF _job_type.reference_table IS NULL THEN 
      RETURN NEW;
   END IF;

   SELECT * INTO _job_status FROM job_status WHERE id = NEW.status_id;

   IF NOT _job_status.is_final THEN 
      RETURN NEW;
   END IF;

   EXECUTE FORMAT('SELECT * FROM %s WHERE is_final AND is_success = $1',_job_type.reference_status_table)
      INTO _target_status
      USING _job_status.is_success;

   IF NOT FOUND THEN 
      RAISE EXCEPTION 'no target status found in table % where is_success=%',
         _job_type.reference_status_table,_job_status.is_success;
   END IF;


   EXECUTE FORMAT('UPDATE "%s" SET %s = $1 WHERE id = $2',
      _job_type.reference_table,
      _job_type.reference_status_column
   )
   USING _target_status.id,NEW.reference_id;
   
   RETURN NEW;
END;

Function: public.language_is_trusted(name)

Returns: text

Language: SQL

    SELECT language_is_trusted($1, 'Procedural language ' || quote_ident($1) || ' should be trusted' );

Function: public.language_is_trusted(name, text)

Returns: text

Language: PLPGSQL

DECLARE
    is_trusted boolean := _is_trusted($1);
BEGIN
    IF is_trusted IS NULL THEN
        RETURN fail( $2 ) || E'\n' || diag( '    Procedural language ' || quote_ident($1) || ' does not exist') ;
    END IF;
    RETURN ok( is_trusted, $2 );
END;

Function: public.language_owner_is(name, name)

Returns: text

Language: SQL

    SELECT language_owner_is(
        $1, $2,
        'Language ' || quote_ident($1) || ' should be owned by ' || quote_ident($2)
    );

Function: public.language_owner_is(name, name, text)

Returns: text

Language: PLPGSQL

DECLARE
    owner NAME := _get_language_owner($1);
BEGIN
    -- Make sure the language exists.
    IF owner IS NULL THEN
        RETURN ok(FALSE, $3) || E'\n' || diag(
            E'    Language ' || quote_ident($1) || ' does not exist'
        );
    END IF;

    RETURN is(owner, $2, $3);
END;

Function: public.language_privs_are(name, name, name[])

Returns: text

Language: SQL

    SELECT language_privs_are(
        $1, $2, $3,
        'Role ' || quote_ident($2) || ' should be granted '
            || CASE WHEN $3[1] IS NULL THEN 'no privileges' ELSE array_to_string($3, ', ') END
            || ' on language ' || quote_ident($1)
    );

Function: public.language_privs_are(name, name, name[], text)

Returns: text

Language: PLPGSQL

DECLARE
    grants TEXT[] := _get_lang_privs( $2, quote_ident($1) );
BEGIN
    IF grants[1] = 'undefined_language' THEN
        RETURN ok(FALSE, $4) || E'\n' || diag(
            '    Language ' || quote_ident($1) || ' does not exist'
        );
    ELSIF grants[1] = 'undefined_role' THEN
        RETURN ok(FALSE, $4) || E'\n' || diag(
            '    Role ' || quote_ident($2) || ' does not exist'
        );
    END IF;
    RETURN _assets_are('privileges', grants, $3, $4);
END;

Function: public.languages_are(name[])

Returns: text

Language: SQL

    SELECT languages_are( $1, 'There should be the correct procedural languages' );

Function: public.languages_are(name[], text)

Returns: text

Language: SQL

    SELECT _are(
        'languages',
        ARRAY(
            SELECT lanname
              FROM pg_catalog.pg_language
             WHERE lanispl
            EXCEPT
            SELECT $1[i]
              FROM generate_series(1, array_upper($1, 1)) s(i)
        ),
        ARRAY(
            SELECT $1[i]
              FROM generate_series(1, array_upper($1, 1)) s(i)
            EXCEPT
            SELECT lanname
              FROM pg_catalog.pg_language
             WHERE lanispl
        ),
        $2
    );

Function: public.lives_ok(text)

Returns: text

Language: SQL

    SELECT lives_ok( $1, NULL );

Function: public.lives_ok(text, text)

Returns: text

Language: PLPGSQL

DECLARE
    code  TEXT := _query($1);
    descr ALIAS FOR $2;
    detail  text;
    hint    text;
    context text;
    schname text;
    tabname text;
    colname text;
    chkname text;
    typname text;
BEGIN
    EXECUTE code;
    RETURN ok( TRUE, descr );
EXCEPTION WHEN OTHERS OR ASSERT_FAILURE THEN
    -- There should have been no exception.
    GET STACKED DIAGNOSTICS
        detail  = PG_EXCEPTION_DETAIL,
        hint    = PG_EXCEPTION_HINT,
        context = PG_EXCEPTION_CONTEXT,
        schname = SCHEMA_NAME,
        tabname = TABLE_NAME,
        colname = COLUMN_NAME,
        chkname = CONSTRAINT_NAME,
        typname = PG_DATATYPE_NAME;
    RETURN ok( FALSE, descr ) || E'\n' || diag(
           '    died: ' || _error_diag(SQLSTATE, SQLERRM, detail, hint, context, schname, tabname, colname, chkname, typname)
    );
END;

Function: public.lookup_error(_id integer)

Returns: jsonb

Language: PLPGSQL

Lookup the given message id in the L<error_dictionary> table, returning a template exception string. If the passed message id is not found, a default error message is composed and returned to the caller, with no interpolation. 

DECLARE
    v_error_r RECORD;
BEGIN

    SELECT * INTO v_error_r FROM v_error_dictionary WHERE id = _id;

    IF NOT FOUND THEN
       RETURN json_build_object( 'id', -1
                               , 'category', NULL
                               , 'message'
                               , format( 'message not defined in dictionary: %s', _id )
                               );
    END IF;

    RETURN to_json(v_error_r)::jsonb;

END;

Function: public.lookup_error(_id integer, _parms text[])

Returns: jsonb

Language: PLPGSQL

Lookup the given message id in the L<error_dictionary> table, returning a properly composed JSONB string to be used in a C<RAISE EXCEPTION> elsewhere in the code. This includes interpolation of additional parameters passed in as a C<TEXT[] ARRAY>. If the passed message id is not found, a default error message is composed and returned to the caller, with no interpolation. 

DECLARE
    v_msg     JSONB;
BEGIN

    v_msg   := lookup_error ( _id );
    RETURN v_msg || json_build_object( 'fields', _parms )::jsonb;

END;

Function: public.maintain_audit_trail()

Returns: trigger

Language: PLPGSQL

This function keeps track of modifications made to an audit table. It stores the previous values and new values. For first insert it stores all values. 

DECLARE
    v_id UUID;
    v_table TEXT;
    v_hnew hstore;
    v_hold hstore;
    v_key  TEXT;
    v_skip BOOLEAN;
BEGIN

    v_id := NULL;
    v_table := regexp_replace ( TG_TABLE_NAME, '_[0-9]{6}$', '' );

    -- For partitioned tables, we will record only the base name of the table

    CASE TG_OP
    WHEN 'INSERT' THEN
        v_hnew := hstore(NEW);

        FOREACH v_key IN ARRAY akeys(v_hnew) LOOP
            IF v_key = 'id' THEN
               v_id := v_hnew->v_key;
               EXIT;
            END IF;
        END LOOP;

        INSERT INTO audit_trail_log ( created_by, table_name, operation, 
                                  object_id, new_value,
                                  statement_date )
        VALUES ( current_user, v_table, TG_OP, v_id, v_hnew, 
                 clock_timestamp() );

        RETURN NEW;

    WHEN 'DELETE' THEN
        v_hold := hstore(OLD);

        FOREACH v_key IN ARRAY akeys(v_hold) LOOP
            IF v_key = 'id' THEN
               v_id := v_hold->v_key;
               EXIT;
            END IF;
        END LOOP;

        INSERT INTO audit_trail_log ( created_by, table_name, operation, 
                                  object_id, old_value,
                                  statement_date )
        VALUES ( current_user, v_table, TG_OP, v_id, v_hold,
                 clock_timestamp() );

        RETURN OLD;

    WHEN 'UPDATE' THEN
        v_hold := hstore(OLD);
        v_hnew := hstore(NEW);

        FOREACH v_key IN ARRAY akeys(v_hnew) LOOP
            IF v_key = 'id' THEN
               v_id := v_hnew->v_key;
               EXIT;
            END IF;
        END LOOP;

        v_hnew = v_hnew - v_hold; -- Do not add items that did not change.

        -- Do not record updates that only touch updated_* columns to
        -- save space.

        v_skip := true;

        FOREACH v_key IN ARRAY akeys(v_hnew) LOOP
            IF v_key !~* '^updated_' THEN
               v_skip := false;
               EXIT;
            END IF;
        END LOOP;

        IF akeys(v_hnew) <> array[]::text[] AND NOT v_skip THEN

           INSERT INTO audit_trail_log ( created_by, table_name, operation, 
                                     object_id, old_value, new_value,
                                     statement_date )
           VALUES ( current_user, v_table, TG_OP, v_id, 
                    v_hold, v_hnew, clock_timestamp() );
        END IF;

        RETURN NEW;
    END CASE;
END;

Function: public.matches(anyelement, text)

Returns: text

Language: SQL

    SELECT _alike( $1 ~ $2, $1, $2, NULL );

Function: public.matches(anyelement, text, text)

Returns: text

Language: SQL

    SELECT _alike( $1 ~ $2, $1, $2, $3 );

Function: public.materialized_view_owner_is(name, name)

Returns: text

Language: SQL

    SELECT materialized_view_owner_is(
        $1, $2,
        'Materialized view ' || quote_ident($1) || ' should be owned by ' || quote_ident($2)
    );

Function: public.materialized_view_owner_is(name, name, name)

Returns: text

Language: SQL

    SELECT materialized_view_owner_is(
        $1, $2, $3,
        'Materialized view ' || quote_ident($1) || '.' || quote_ident($2) || ' should be owned by ' || quote_ident($3)
    );

Function: public.materialized_view_owner_is(name, name, name, text)

Returns: text

Language: PLPGSQL

DECLARE
    owner NAME := _get_rel_owner('m'::char, $1, $2);
BEGIN
    -- Make sure the materialized view exists.
    IF owner IS NULL THEN
        RETURN ok(FALSE, $4) || E'\n' || diag(
            E'    Materialized view ' || quote_ident($1) || '.' || quote_ident($2) || ' does not exist'
        );
    END IF;

    RETURN is(owner, $3, $4);
END;

Function: public.materialized_view_owner_is(name, name, text)

Returns: text

Language: PLPGSQL

DECLARE
    owner NAME := _get_rel_owner('m'::char, $1);
BEGIN
    -- Make sure the materialized view exists.
    IF owner IS NULL THEN
        RETURN ok(FALSE, $3) || E'\n' || diag(
            E'    Materialized view ' || quote_ident($1) || ' does not exist'
        );
    END IF;

    RETURN is(owner, $2, $3);
END;

    );

    RETURN;
END;

Function: public.normalize_email(_e text)

Function: public.normalize_email_tg()

Returns: trigger

Language: PLPGSQL

BEGIN
  NEW.email=normalize_email(NEW.email);
  RETURN NEW;
END;

Function: public.notify_event(_channel text, _msg_type text, _payload text)

Returns: boolean

Language: PLPGSQL

This function is used to send an asynchronous notification to the messaging bus. It is used in combination with a microservice that uses the postgres asynchronous notification service to encode the payload into a message that can be consumed by other services. Since the PG_NOTIFY() function is limited to a maximum of 8000 bytes per message, and considering that some messages may be larger than that, this function will split the payload in chunks and sent in a frame-like approach to ensure that the listener can re-assemble the payload. 

DECLARE 
    part        INT;
    total       INT;
    size        INT;
    chunk_size  INT DEFAULT (8000-10); 
    envelope    TEXT;
    msg         TEXT;
BEGIN


    envelope := JSONB_BUILD_OBJECT(
        'payload',_payload,
        'type',_msg_type,
        'id', gen_random_uuid()
    )::TEXT;

    size := LENGTH(envelope);
    total := CEIL(size::NUMERIC / chunk_size::NUMERIC)::INT;

    FOR part IN SELECT generate_series FROM generate_series(1,total,1)
    LOOP 
        msg := SUBSTRING(envelope,(chunk_size * (part - 1)) + 1 ,chunk_size );
        PERFORM PG_NOTIFY(_channel,FORMAT('%s:%s:%s',part,total,msg));
    END LOOP;

    RETURN TRUE;
END

Function: public.notify_order_status_transition_orderid_tgf()

Returns: trigger

Language: PLPGSQL

 
DECLARE 
  v_channel   TEXT;
BEGIN

  v_channel := FORMAT('notify_chnl_orderstatus_%s',REPLACE(OLD.id::TEXT,'-','_'));

  PERFORM pg_notify(
    v_channel,
    JSONB_BUILD_OBJECT(
      'order_id',OLD.id,
      'status',tc_name_from_id('order_status',NEW.status_id))::TEXT
    );

  RETURN NEW;
END;

Function: public.notify_order_status_transition_tgf()

Returns: trigger

Language: PLPGSQL

 
DECLARE 
  v_channel   TEXT;
BEGIN

  -- v_channel := FORMAT('order_status_%s',NEW.id);
  v_channel := 'notification_channel_order_status';

  PERFORM pg_notify(
    v_channel,
    JSONB_BUILD_OBJECT(
      'order_id',OLD.id,
      'status',tc_name_from_id('order_status',NEW.status_id))::TEXT
    );

  RETURN NEW;
END;

Function: public.num_failed()

Function: public.oid_dist(oid, oid)

Language: C

oid_dist

Function: public.ok(boolean)

Returns: text

Language: SQL

    SELECT ok( $1, NULL );

Function: public.ok(boolean, text)

Returns: text

Language: PLPGSQL

DECLARE
   aok      ALIAS FOR $1;
   descr    text := $2;
   test_num INTEGER;
   todo_why TEXT;
   ok       BOOL;
BEGIN
   todo_why := _todo();
   ok       := CASE
       WHEN aok = TRUE THEN aok
       WHEN todo_why IS NULL THEN COALESCE(aok, false)
       ELSE TRUE
    END;
    IF _get('plan') IS NULL THEN
        RAISE EXCEPTION 'You tried to run a test without a plan! Gotta have a plan';
    END IF;

    test_num := add_result(
        ok,
        COALESCE(aok, false),
        descr,
        CASE WHEN todo_why IS NULL THEN '' ELSE 'todo' END,
        COALESCE(todo_why, '')
    );

    RETURN (CASE aok WHEN TRUE THEN '' ELSE 'not ' END)
           || 'ok ' || _set( 'curr_test', test_num )
           || CASE descr WHEN '' THEN '' ELSE COALESCE( ' - ' || substr(diag( descr ), 3), '' ) END
           || COALESCE( ' ' || diag( 'TODO ' || todo_why ), '')
           || CASE aok WHEN TRUE THEN '' ELSE E'\n' ||
                diag('Failed ' ||
                CASE WHEN todo_why IS NULL THEN '' ELSE '(TODO) ' END ||
                'test ' || test_num ||
                CASE descr WHEN '' THEN '' ELSE COALESCE(': "' || descr || '"', '') END ) ||
                CASE WHEN aok IS NULL THEN E'\n' || diag('    (test result was NULL)') ELSE '' END
           END;
END;

Function: public.opclass_owner_is(name, name)

Language: SQL

    SELECT opclass_owner_is(
        $1, $2,

Returns: text

Language: PLPGSQL

DECLARE
    owner NAME := _get_opclass_owner($1, $2);
BEGIN
    -- Make sure the opclass exists.
    IF owner IS NULL THEN
        RETURN ok(FALSE, $4) || E'\n' || diag(
            E'    Operator class ' || quote_ident($1) || '.' || quote_ident($2)
            || ' not found'
        );
    END IF;

    RETURN is(owner, $3, $4);
END;
