    -- Make sure the opclass exists.
    IF owner IS NULL THEN
        RETURN ok(FALSE, $3) || E'\n' || diag(
            E'    Operator class ' || quote_ident($1) || ' not found'
        );
    END IF;

    RETURN is(owner, $2, $3);
END;

Function: public.opclasses_are(name, name[])

Returns: text

Language: SQL

    SELECT opclasses_are( $1, $2, 'Schema ' || quote_ident($1) || ' should have the correct operator classes' );

Function: public.opclasses_are(name, name[], text)

Returns: text

Language: SQL

    SELECT _are(
        'operator classes',
        ARRAY(
            SELECT oc.opcname
              FROM pg_catalog.pg_opclass oc
              JOIN pg_catalog.pg_namespace n ON oc.opcnamespace = n.oid
             WHERE n.nspname  = $1
            EXCEPT
            SELECT $2[i]
              FROM generate_series(1, array_upper($2, 1)) s(i)
        ),
        ARRAY(
            SELECT $2[i]
               FROM generate_series(1, array_upper($2, 1)) s(i)
            EXCEPT
            SELECT oc.opcname
              FROM pg_catalog.pg_opclass oc
              JOIN pg_catalog.pg_namespace n ON oc.opcnamespace = n.oid
             WHERE n.nspname  = $1
        ),
        $3
    );

Function: public.opclasses_are(name[])

Returns: text

Language: SQL

    SELECT opclasses_are( $1, 'Search path ' || pg_catalog.current_setting('search_path') || ' should have the correct operator classes' );

Function: public.opclasses_are(name[], text)

Returns: text

Language: SQL

    SELECT _are(
        'operator classes',
        ARRAY(
            SELECT oc.opcname
              FROM pg_catalog.pg_opclass oc
              JOIN pg_catalog.pg_namespace n ON oc.opcnamespace = n.oid
               AND n.nspname NOT IN ('pg_catalog', 'information_schema')
               AND pg_catalog.pg_opclass_is_visible(oc.oid)
            EXCEPT
            SELECT $1[i]
              FROM generate_series(1, array_upper($1, 1)) s(i)
        ),
        ARRAY(
            SELECT $1[i]
               FROM generate_series(1, array_upper($1, 1)) s(i)
            EXCEPT
            SELECT oc.opcname
              FROM pg_catalog.pg_opclass oc
              JOIN pg_catalog.pg_namespace n ON oc.opcnamespace = n.oid
               AND n.nspname NOT IN ('pg_catalog', 'information_schema')
               AND pg_catalog.pg_opclass_is_visible(oc.oid)
        ),
        $2
    );

Function: public.operators_are(name, text[])

Returns: text

Language: SQL

    SELECT operators_are($1, $2, 'Schema ' || quote_ident($1) || ' should have the correct operators' );

Function: public.operators_are(name, text[], text)

Returns: text

Language: SQL

    SELECT _areni(
        'operators',
        ARRAY(
            SELECT display_oper(o.oprname, o.oid) || ' RETURNS ' || o.oprresult::regtype
              FROM pg_catalog.pg_operator o
              JOIN pg_catalog.pg_namespace n ON o.oprnamespace = n.oid
             WHERE n.nspname = $1
            EXCEPT
            SELECT $2[i]
              FROM generate_series(1, array_upper($2, 1)) s(i)
        ),
        ARRAY(
            SELECT $2[i]
              FROM generate_series(1, array_upper($2, 1)) s(i)
            EXCEPT
            SELECT display_oper(o.oprname, o.oid) || ' RETURNS ' || o.oprresult::regtype
              FROM pg_catalog.pg_operator o
              JOIN pg_catalog.pg_namespace n ON o.oprnamespace = n.oid
             WHERE n.nspname = $1
        ),
        $3
    );

Function: public.operators_are(text[])

Returns: text

Language: SQL

    SELECT operators_are($1, 'There should be the correct operators')

Function: public.operators_are(text[], text)

Returns: text

Language: SQL

    SELECT _areni(
        'operators',
        ARRAY(
            SELECT display_oper(o.oprname, o.oid) || ' RETURNS ' || o.oprresult::regtype
              FROM pg_catalog.pg_operator o
              JOIN pg_catalog.pg_namespace n ON o.oprnamespace = n.oid
             WHERE pg_catalog.pg_operator_is_visible(o.oid)
               AND n.nspname NOT IN ('pg_catalog', 'information_schema')
            EXCEPT
            SELECT $1[i]
              FROM generate_series(1, array_upper($1, 1)) s(i)
        ),
        ARRAY(
            SELECT $1[i]
              FROM generate_series(1, array_upper($1, 1)) s(i)
            EXCEPT
            SELECT display_oper(o.oprname, o.oid) || ' RETURNS ' || o.oprresult::regtype
              FROM pg_catalog.pg_operator o
              JOIN pg_catalog.pg_namespace n ON o.oprnamespace = n.oid
             WHERE pg_catalog.pg_operator_is_visible(o.oid)
               AND n.nspname NOT IN ('pg_catalog', 'information_schema')
        ),
        $2
    );

Function: public.order_item_finish()

Returns: trigger

Language: PLPGSQL

DECLARE
  v_oi_status RECORD;
BEGIN

  SELECT * INTO v_oi_status FROM order_item_status WHERE id=NEW.status_id;

  IF NOT v_oi_status.is_final THEN 
    RETURN NEW;
  END IF;

  UPDATE "order" 
    SET status_id=order_next_status(NEW.order_id,v_oi_status.is_success) 
  WHERE id = NEW.order_id;

  RETURN NEW;
END;

Function: public.order_item_force_initial_status()

Returns: trigger

Language: PLPGSQL

BEGIN

  NEW.status_id = tc_id_from_name('order_item_status','pending');

  RETURN NEW;
END;

Function: public.order_item_plan_start()

Returns: trigger

Language: PLPGSQL

DECLARE
  v_strategy     RECORD;
BEGIN


  -- check to see if we are waiting for any other object

  SELECT * INTO v_strategy 
    FROM v_order_item_plan_status 
    WHERE 
      order_item_id = NEW.id 
      AND total_new > 0 
    ORDER BY depth DESC LIMIT 1;

  
  IF FOUND THEN 
    UPDATE order_item_plan 
        SET status_id = tc_id_from_name('order_item_plan_status','processing') 
      WHERE 
        order_item_id=NEW.id 
        AND status_id=tc_id_from_name('order_item_plan_status','new')
        AND order_item_object_id = ANY(v_strategy.object_ids);
  ELSE 

    RAISE NOTICE 'order has processing has ended';
  
  END IF;

  RETURN NEW;
END;

Function: public.order_item_plan_update()

Returns: trigger

Language: PLPGSQL

DECLARE
  v_strategy      RECORD;
  v_new_strategy  RECORD;
BEGIN

  -- RAISE NOTICE 'placing lock on related rows...';

  PERFORM * FROM order_item_plan WHERE order_item_id = NEW.order_item_id FOR UPDATE;

  -- check to see if we are waiting for any other object
  SELECT * INTO v_strategy 
    FROM v_order_item_plan_status 
    WHERE 
      NEW.order_item_object_id = ANY(object_ids)
      AND order_item_id = NEW.order_item_id 
    ORDER BY depth DESC LIMIT 1;


  IF v_strategy.total_fail > 0 THEN 
    -- order item should be canceled immediately
    UPDATE order_item 
      SET status_id = (SELECT id FROM order_item_status WHERE is_final AND NOT is_success) 
    WHERE id = NEW.order_item_id AND status_id = tc_id_from_name('order_item_status','ready');

    -- cancel the rest of the plan as well
    UPDATE order_item_plan 
      SET status_id = (SELECT id FROM order_item_plan_status WHERE is_final AND NOT is_success) 
    WHERE 
      order_item_id = NEW.order_item_id AND id <> NEW.id
      AND status_id = tc_id_from_name('order_item_plan_status','new');

    RAISE NOTICE 'at least one of the objects failed item canceled';
    RETURN NEW;
  END IF;  

  -- if no failures, we need to check and see if there's anything pending
  IF v_strategy.total_processing > 0 THEN 
    -- RAISE NOTICE 'Waiting. for other objects to complete (id: %s) remaining: %',NEW.id,v_strategy.total_processing;
    RETURN NEW;
  END IF;

  IF v_strategy.total_success = v_strategy.total THEN 

    SELECT *
      INTO v_new_strategy
    FROM v_order_item_plan_status
    WHERE
      order_item_id = NEW.order_item_id
      AND total_new > 0
    ORDER BY depth DESC LIMIT 1;

    IF NOT FOUND THEN 

        -- nothing more to do, we can mark the order as complete!
      UPDATE order_item 
        SET status_id = (SELECT id FROM order_item_status WHERE is_final AND is_success) 
      WHERE id = NEW.order_item_id AND status_id = tc_id_from_name('order_item_status','ready');

    ELSE 

      -- this should trigger the provisioning of the objects on the next object group
      UPDATE order_item_plan 
          SET status_id = tc_id_from_name('order_item_plan_status','processing') 
        WHERE 
          order_item_id=NEW.order_item_id 
          AND status_id=tc_id_from_name('order_item_plan_status','new')
          AND order_item_object_id = ANY(v_new_strategy.object_ids);

      RAISE NOTICE 'Order %: procesing objects of type %',v_new_strategy.order_id,v_new_strategy.objects;

    END IF;

  END IF;

  RAISE NOTICE 'nothing else to do';
  RETURN NEW;
END;

Function: public.order_item_prevent_insert()

Returns: trigger

Language: PLPGSQL

Ensures that no one can insert into this table directly, since the inserts should be ocurring at the order_item_<action>_<product> table

DECLARE
  _pi     RECORD;
BEGIN

  SELECT * INTO _pi FROM v_order_product_type WHERE type_id = NEW.item_type_id;

  RAISE EXCEPTION 'MUST NOT insert in this table directly, for this product/order type (%/%) please use % instead',_pi.product_name,_pi.type_name,_pi.rel_name;

  RETURN NULL;
END;

Function: public.order_item_set_tld_id()

Returns: trigger

Language: PLPGSQL

DECLARE 
    v_tld  UUID;
    v_part TEXT;
BEGIN

    v_part := tld_part(NEW.name);

    SELECT accreditation_tld_id INTO v_tld 
        FROM v_accreditation_tld
        WHERE tld_name = v_part 
            AND tenant_customer_id=(SELECT tenant_customer_id FROM "order" WHERE id=NEW.order_id) 
            AND is_default;


    IF NOT FOUND THEN 
        RAISE EXCEPTION 'TLD ''%'' not available',v_part;
    END IF;

    NEW.accreditation_tld_id = v_tld;

    RETURN NEW;

END;

Function: public.order_next_status(_order_id uuid, _is_success boolean)

Returns: uuid

Language: PLPGSQL

DECLARE
  _status_transition RECORD;
  _current_status    UUID;
BEGIN

  SELECT t.* INTO _status_transition
    FROM v_order_status_transition t
      JOIN "order" o ON o.id = _order_id AND o.status_id = t.source_status_id
    WHERE
      t.path_id = o.path_id
      AND (_is_success AND t.is_target_success) OR (NOT _is_success AND NOT t.is_target_success);

  IF NOT FOUND THEN
    SELECT status_id INTO _current_status FROM "order" WHERE id=_order_id;
    RAISE NOTICE 'no suitable target status found, keeping same';
    RETURN _current_status;
  END IF;

  RETURN _status_transition.target_status_id;

END;

Function: public.order_process_items()

Returns: trigger

Language: PLPGSQL

BEGIN

  UPDATE order_item SET status_id = tc_id_from_name('order_item_status','ready') 
    WHERE 
      order_id=NEW.id 
      AND status_id=tc_id_from_name('order_item_status','pending');

  RETURN NEW;
END;

Function: public.os_name()

Returns: text

Language: SQL

SELECT 'linux'::text;

Function: public.partition_helper_by_month(_table text)

Returns: boolean

Language: PLPGSQL

DECLARE
  _dates  RECORD;
  _stmt   TEXT;
  _table_exists   BOOLEAN DEFAULT FALSE;
BEGIN

  _table := LOWER(_table);

  FOR _dates IN SELECT
                    FORMAT('%s_%s',_table,TO_CHAR(generate_series,'YYYYMM')) AS table_name,
                    TO_CHAR(generate_series,'YYYY-MM-DD') AS from_date,
                    TO_CHAR(generate_series + '1 month'::INTERVAL,'YYYY-MM-DD') AS to_date,
                    EXTRACT(year FROM generate_series) AS from_year,
                    EXTRACT(month FROM generate_series) AS from_month
                FROM generate_series(
                        DATE_TRUNC('month',NOW()),
                        DATE_TRUNC('month',NOW() + '1 month'::INTERVAL),
                        '1 month'::INTERVAL
                      )
  LOOP

     SELECT EXISTS INTO _table_exists (
        SELECT FROM
          pg_tables
        WHERE
          schemaname = 'public' AND
          tablename  = _dates.table_name
    );

    IF NOT _table_exists THEN

      _stmt := FORMAT(
        'CREATE TABLE %1$s PARTITION OF %2$s FOR VALUES FROM (%3$s) TO (%4$s)',
        _dates.table_name,
        _table,
        QUOTE_LITERAL(_dates.from_date),
        QUOTE_LITERAL(_dates.to_date)
      );
      EXECUTE _stmt;
    ELSE
      RAISE NOTICE 'skipping % (partition of %) since already exists',_dates.table_name,_table;
    END IF;

  END LOOP;

  RETURN TRUE;
END;

Function: public.partitions_are(name, name, name[])

Returns: text

Language: SQL

    SELECT partitions_are(
        $1, $2, $3,
        'Table ' || quote_ident($1) || '.' || quote_ident($2) || ' should have the correct partitions'
    );

Function: public.partitions_are(name, name, name[], text)

Returns: text

Language: SQL

    SELECT _are(
        'partitions',
        ARRAY(SELECT _parts($1, $2) EXCEPT SELECT unnest($3)),
        ARRAY(SELECT unnest($3) EXCEPT SELECT _parts($1, $2)),
        $4
    );

Function: public.partitions_are(name, name[])

Returns: text

Language: SQL

    SELECT partitions_are(
        $1, $2,
        'Table ' || quote_ident($1) || ' should have the correct partitions'
    );

Function: public.partitions_are(name, name[], text)

Returns: text

Language: SQL

    SELECT _are(
        'partitions',
        ARRAY(SELECT _parts($1) EXCEPT SELECT unnest($2)),
        ARRAY(SELECT unnest($2) EXCEPT SELECT _parts($1)),
        $3
    );

Function: public.pass()

Returns: text

Language: SQL

    SELECT ok( TRUE, NULL );

Function: public.pass(text)

Returns: text

Language: SQL

    SELECT ok( TRUE, $1 );

Function: public.performs_ok(text, numeric)

Returns: text

Language: SQL

    SELECT performs_ok(
        $1, $2, 'Should run in less than ' || $2 || ' ms'
    );

Function: public.performs_ok(text, numeric, text)

Returns: text

Language: PLPGSQL

DECLARE
    query     TEXT := _query($1);
    max_time  ALIAS FOR $2;
    descr     ALIAS FOR $3;
    starts_at TEXT;
    act_time  NUMERIC;
BEGIN
    starts_at := timeofday();
    EXECUTE query;
    act_time := extract( millisecond from timeofday()::timestamptz - starts_at::timestamptz);
    IF act_time < max_time THEN RETURN ok(TRUE, descr); END IF;
    RETURN ok( FALSE, descr ) || E'\n' || diag(
           '      runtime: ' || act_time || ' ms' ||
        E'\n      exceeds: ' || max_time || ' ms'
    );
END;

Function: public.performs_within(text, numeric, numeric)

Returns: text

Language: SQL

SELECT performs_within(
          $1, $2, $3, 10,
          'Should run within ' || $2 || ' +/- ' || $3 || ' ms');

Function: public.performs_within(text, numeric, numeric, integer)

Returns: text

Language: SQL

SELECT performs_within(
          $1, $2, $3, $4,
          'Should run within ' || $2 || ' +/- ' || $3 || ' ms');

Function: public.performs_within(text, numeric, numeric, integer, text)

Returns: text

Language: PLPGSQL

DECLARE
    query          TEXT := _query($1);
    expected_avg   ALIAS FOR $2;
    within         ALIAS FOR $3;
    iterations     ALIAS FOR $4;
    descr          ALIAS FOR $5;
    avg_time       NUMERIC;
BEGIN
  SELECT avg(a_time) FROM _time_trials(query, iterations, 0.8) t1 INTO avg_time;
  IF abs(avg_time - expected_avg) < within THEN RETURN ok(TRUE, descr); END IF;
  RETURN ok(FALSE, descr) || E'\n' || diag(' average runtime: ' || avg_time || ' ms'
     || E'\n desired average: ' || expected_avg || ' +/- ' || within || ' ms'
    );
END;

Function: public.performs_within(text, numeric, numeric, text)

Returns: text

Language: SQL

SELECT performs_within(
          $1, $2, $3, 10, $4
        );

Language: C

Function: public.pgtap_version()

Returns: numeric

Language: SQL

SELECT 1.2;

Function: public.plan(integer)

Returns: text

Language: PLPGSQL

DECLARE
    rcount INTEGER;
BEGIN
    BEGIN
        EXECUTE '
            CREATE TEMP SEQUENCE __tcache___id_seq;
            CREATE TEMP TABLE __tcache__ (
                id    INTEGER NOT NULL DEFAULT nextval(''__tcache___id_seq''),
                label TEXT    NOT NULL,
                value INTEGER NOT NULL,
                note  TEXT    NOT NULL DEFAULT ''''
            );
            CREATE UNIQUE INDEX __tcache___key ON __tcache__(id);
            GRANT ALL ON TABLE __tcache__ TO PUBLIC;
            GRANT ALL ON TABLE __tcache___id_seq TO PUBLIC;

            CREATE TEMP SEQUENCE __tresults___numb_seq;
            GRANT ALL ON TABLE __tresults___numb_seq TO PUBLIC;
        ';

    EXCEPTION WHEN duplicate_table THEN
        -- Raise an exception if there's already a plan.
        EXECUTE 'SELECT TRUE FROM __tcache__ WHERE label = ''plan''';
      GET DIAGNOSTICS rcount = ROW_COUNT;
        IF rcount > 0 THEN
           RAISE EXCEPTION 'You tried to plan twice!';
        END IF;
    END;

    -- Save the plan and return.
    PERFORM _set('plan', $1 );
    PERFORM _set('failed', 0 );
    RETURN '1..' || $1;
END;

Function: public.plan_create_domain_provision_contact()

Returns: trigger

Language: PLPGSQL

DECLARE
  v_contact_id     UUID;
  v_create_domain   RECORD;
BEGIN

  SELECT id INTO v_contact_id FROM order_contact WHERE id = NEW.reference_id;
  
  IF NOT FOUND THEN 
    RAISE EXCEPTION 'reference id % not found in order_contact table',NEW.reference_id;
  END IF;

  -- order information
  SELECT * INTO v_create_domain 
    FROM v_order_create_domain 
  WHERE order_item_id = NEW.order_item_id; 

  -- thanks to the magic from inheritance, the contact table already
  -- contains the data, we just need to materialize it there.
  INSERT INTO contact (SELECT * FROM contact WHERE id=NEW.reference_id);
  INSERT INTO contact_postal (SELECT * FROM contact_postal WHERE contact_id=NEW.reference_id);

  -- we now signal the provisioning 
  INSERT INTO provision_contact(
    contact_id,
    accreditation_id,
    tenant_customer_id,
    order_item_plan_ids
  ) VALUES(
    NEW.reference_id,
    v_create_domain.accreditation_id,
    v_create_domain.tenant_customer_id,
    ARRAY[NEW.id]
  ) ON CONFLICT (contact_id,accreditation_id) 
      DO UPDATE 
        SET order_item_plan_ids = provision_contact.order_item_plan_ids || EXCLUDED.order_item_plan_ids;

  RETURN NEW;
END;

Function: public.plan_create_domain_provision_domain()

Returns: trigger

Language: PLPGSQL

DECLARE
  v_domain          RECORD;
  v_create_domain   RECORD;
  v_pd_id           UUID;
BEGIN

    -- order information
  SELECT * INTO v_create_domain 
    FROM v_order_create_domain 
  WHERE order_item_id = NEW.order_item_id; 

  -- we now signal the provisioning 
  WITH pd_ins AS ( 
    INSERT INTO provision_domain(
      name,
      registration_period,
      accreditation_id,
      accreditation_tld_id,
      tenant_customer_id,
      order_item_plan_ids
    ) VALUES(
      v_create_domain.domain_name,
      v_create_domain.registration_period,
      v_create_domain.accreditation_id,
      v_create_domain.accreditation_tld_id,
      v_create_domain.tenant_customer_id,
      ARRAY[NEW.id]
    ) RETURNING id
  )
  SELECT id INTO v_pd_id FROM pd_ins;

  -- insert contacts
  INSERT INTO provision_domain_contact(
    provision_domain_id,
    contact_id,
    contact_type_id
  )
  ( SELECT 
      v_pd_id, 
      order_contact_id,
      domain_contact_type_id
    FROM create_domain_contact
    WHERE create_domain_id = NEW.order_item_id
  );

  -- insert hosts
  INSERT INTO provision_domain_host(
    provision_domain_id,
    host_id
  ) (
    SELECT
      v_pd_id,
      h.id
    FROM host h
    WHERE
      h.name IN (
        SELECT name 
        FROM create_domain_nameserver 
        WHERE create_domain_id = NEW.order_item_id
      ) 
      AND tenant_customer_id = v_create_domain.tenant_customer_id
  );

  UPDATE provision_domain SET is_complete = TRUE WHERE id = v_pd_id;

  RETURN NEW;
END;

Function: public.plan_create_domain_provision_host()

Returns: trigger

Language: PLPGSQL

DECLARE
  v_create_domain   RECORD;
  v_dc_host         RECORD;
  v_new_host_id     UUID;
  v_p_host          RECORD;
BEGIN

  SELECT * INTO v_dc_host FROM create_domain_nameserver n WHERE n.id = NEW.reference_id;

  IF NOT FOUND THEN 
    RAISE EXCEPTION 'reference id % not found in create_domain_nameserver table',
      NEW.reference_id;
  END IF;


  -- load the order information through the v_order_create_domain view
  SELECT * INTO v_create_domain 
    FROM v_order_create_domain 
  WHERE order_item_id = NEW.order_item_id; 
  

  -- check to see if the host is already provisioned in the 
  -- instance 

  SELECT
    ps.name AS status_name,
    ps.is_final AS status_is_final,
    ps.is_success AS status_is_success
  INTO v_p_host FROM provision_host ph 
    JOIN host h ON h.id = ph.host_id
    JOIN provision_status ps ON ps.id = ph.status_id
  WHERE 
      accreditation_id = v_create_domain.accreditation_id
        AND h.name = v_dc_host.name
        AND ps.name='completed';

  IF NOT FOUND THEN 

    -- upsert the host 
    WITH new_host AS (
      INSERT INTO host(tenant_customer_id,name)
        VALUES(v_create_domain.tenant_customer_id,v_dc_host.name) 
        ON CONFLICT (tenant_customer_id,name) 
        DO UPDATE SET updated_date=NOW()
      RETURNING id
    )
    SELECT id INTO v_new_host_id FROM new_host;

    -- insert the addresses 
    INSERT INTO host_addr(host_id,address) 
      ( 
        SELECT 
          v_new_host_id,
          ha.addr 
        FROM create_domain_nameserver_addr ha
          JOIN create_domain_nameserver h ON h.id = ha.nameserver_id 
        WHERE 
          h.create_domain_id = NEW.order_item_id 
          AND h.id = NEW.reference_id
      ) ON CONFLICT DO NOTHING; 

    -- send the host to be provisioned
    -- but if there's a record that's pending
    -- simply add ourselves to those order_item_plan_ids that need
    -- to be updated
    INSERT INTO provision_host(
      accreditation_id,
      host_id,
      tenant_customer_id,
      order_item_plan_ids
    ) VALUES (
      v_create_domain.accreditation_id,
      v_new_host_id,
      v_create_domain.tenant_customer_id,
      ARRAY[NEW.id]
    ) ON CONFLICT (host_id,accreditation_id) 
      DO UPDATE 
        SET order_item_plan_ids = provision_host.order_item_plan_ids || EXCLUDED.order_item_plan_ids;

  ELSE 
    -- host has already been provisioned, we can mark this as complete
      UPDATE create_domain_plan 
        SET status_id = tc_id_from_name('order_item_plan_status','completed')
      WHERE id = NEW.id;

  END IF;

  RETURN NEW;
END;

Function: public.plan_order_item()

Returns: trigger

Language: PLPGSQL

DECLARE
  v_object            RECORD; 
  v_order             RECORD;
  v_accreditation_tld RECORD;
  v_previous_id       UUID;
  v_previous_rank     INT DEFAULT 1;
  v_previous_parent   UUID;
  v_parent            UUID;
  v_related_obj       RECORD;
BEGIN

  -- load the order
  SELECT * INTO v_order FROM "order" WHERE id=NEW.order_id;

  -- load accreditation
  SELECT * INTO v_accreditation_tld FROM v_accreditation_tld WHERE accreditation_tld_id = NEW.accreditation_tld_id;

  -- loop through the strategy to create a plan
  FOR v_object IN SELECT
                      RANK() OVER (ORDER BY provision_order DESC) AS rank,
                      object_name,
                      object_id,
                      provision_order,
                      product_name,
                      order_type_name
                  FROM v_provider_instance_order_item_strategy 
                  WHERE 
                    provider_instance_id=v_accreditation_tld.provider_instance_id
                    AND order_type_id = v_order.type_id
                  ORDER BY 1
  LOOP 

    IF v_previous_id IS NOT NULL THEN 
      IF v_object.rank = v_previous_rank THEN 
        v_parent := v_previous_parent;
      ELSE 
        v_parent := v_previous_id;
      END IF;
    END IF;

    FOR v_related_obj IN SELECT * FROM v_order_item_plan_object 
                            WHERE order_item_id = NEW.id 
                                  AND object_id=v_object.object_id
    LOOP

      EXECUTE FORMAT('INSERT INTO %s_%s_plan(
          order_item_id,
          parent_id,
          order_item_object_id,
          reference_id
        )
        VALUES ($1,$2,$3,$4) 
        RETURNING id',v_object.order_type_name,v_object.product_name)
        INTO v_previous_id
        USING 
          NEW.id, 
          v_parent, 
          v_object.object_id,
          v_related_obj.id;

    END LOOP;

    v_previous_rank := v_object.rank;
    v_previous_parent := v_parent;
  
  END LOOP;

  RETURN NEW;

END;

Function: public.plan_renew_domain_provision()

Returns: trigger

Language: PLPGSQL

DECLARE
  v_domain          RECORD;
  v_renew_domain   RECORD;
  v_pd_id           UUID;
BEGIN

    -- order information
  SELECT * INTO v_renew_domain 
    FROM v_order_renew_domain 
  WHERE order_item_id = NEW.order_item_id; 

  -- -- we now signal the provisioning 
  INSERT INTO provision_domain_renew(
    domain_id,
    period,
    accreditation_id,
    tenant_customer_id,
    current_expiry_date,
    order_item_plan_ids
  ) VALUES(
    v_renew_domain.domain_id,
    v_renew_domain.period,
    v_renew_domain.accreditation_id,
    v_renew_domain.tenant_customer_id,
    v_renew_domain.current_expiry_date,
    ARRAY[NEW.id]
  );


  RETURN NEW;
END;

Function: public.policies_are(name, name, name[])

Returns: text

Language: SQL

    SELECT policies_are( $1, $2, $3, 'Table ' || quote_ident($1) || '.' || quote_ident($2) || ' should have the correct policies' );

Function: public.policies_are(name, name, name[], text)

Returns: text

Language: SQL

    SELECT _are(
        'policies',
        ARRAY(
            SELECT p.polname
              FROM pg_catalog.pg_policy p
              JOIN pg_catalog.pg_class c     ON c.oid = p.polrelid
              JOIN pg_catalog.pg_namespace n ON n.oid = c.relnamespace
             WHERE n.nspname = $1
               AND c.relname = $2
            EXCEPT
            SELECT $3[i]
              FROM generate_series(1, array_upper($3, 1)) s(i)
        ),
        ARRAY(
            SELECT $3[i]
              FROM generate_series(1, array_upper($3, 1)) s(i)
            EXCEPT
            SELECT p.polname
              FROM pg_catalog.pg_policy p
              JOIN pg_catalog.pg_class c     ON c.oid = p.polrelid
              JOIN pg_catalog.pg_namespace n ON n.oid = c.relnamespace
             WHERE n.nspname = $1
               AND c.relname = $2
        ),
        $4
    );

Function: public.policies_are(name, name[])

Returns: text

Language: SQL

    SELECT policies_are( $1, $2, 'Table ' || quote_ident($1) || ' should have the correct policies' );

Function: public.policies_are(name, name[], text)

Returns: text

Language: SQL

    SELECT _are(
        'policies',
        ARRAY(
            SELECT p.polname
              FROM pg_catalog.pg_policy p
              JOIN pg_catalog.pg_class c ON c.oid = p.polrelid
              JOIN pg_catalog.pg_namespace n ON n.oid = c.relnamespace
             WHERE c.relname = $1
               AND n.nspname NOT IN ('pg_catalog', 'information_schema')
            EXCEPT
            SELECT $2[i]
              FROM generate_series(1, array_upper($2, 1)) s(i)
        ),
        ARRAY(
            SELECT $2[i]
              FROM generate_series(1, array_upper($2, 1)) s(i)
            EXCEPT
            SELECT p.polname
              FROM pg_catalog.pg_policy p
              JOIN pg_catalog.pg_class c ON c.oid = p.polrelid
              JOIN pg_catalog.pg_namespace n ON n.oid = c.relnamespace
               AND n.nspname NOT IN ('pg_catalog', 'information_schema')
        ),
        $3
    );

Function: public.policy_cmd_is(name, name, name, text)

Returns: text

Language: SQL

    SELECT policy_cmd_is(
        $1, $2, $3, $4,
        'Policy ' || quote_ident($3)
        || ' for table ' || quote_ident($1) || '.' || quote_ident($2)
        || ' should apply to ' || upper($4) || ' command'
    );

Function: public.policy_cmd_is(name, name, name, text, text)

Returns: text

Language: PLPGSQL

DECLARE
    cmd text;
BEGIN
    SELECT
      CASE pp.polcmd WHEN 'r' THEN 'SELECT'
                     WHEN 'a' THEN 'INSERT'
                     WHEN 'w' THEN 'UPDATE'
                     WHEN 'd' THEN 'DELETE'
                     ELSE 'ALL'
       END
      FROM pg_catalog.pg_policy AS pp
      JOIN pg_catalog.pg_class AS pc ON pc.oid = pp.polrelid
      JOIN pg_catalog.pg_namespace AS pn ON pn.oid = pc.relnamespace
     WHERE pn.nspname = $1
       AND pc.relname = $2
       AND pp.polname = $3
      INTO cmd;

    RETURN is( cmd, upper($4), $5 );
END;

Function: public.policy_cmd_is(name, name, text)

Returns: text

Language: SQL

    SELECT policy_cmd_is(
        $1, $2, $3,
        'Policy ' || quote_ident($2)
        || ' for table ' || quote_ident($1)
        || ' should apply to ' || upper($3) || ' command'
    );

Function: public.policy_cmd_is(name, name, text, text)

Returns: text

Language: PLPGSQL

DECLARE
    cmd text;
BEGIN
    SELECT
      CASE pp.polcmd WHEN 'r' THEN 'SELECT'
                     WHEN 'a' THEN 'INSERT'
                     WHEN 'w' THEN 'UPDATE'
                     WHEN 'd' THEN 'DELETE'
                     ELSE 'ALL'
       END
      FROM pg_catalog.pg_policy AS pp
      JOIN pg_catalog.pg_class AS pc ON pc.oid = pp.polrelid
      JOIN pg_catalog.pg_namespace AS pn ON pn.oid = pc.relnamespace
     WHERE pc.relname = $1
       AND pp.polname = $2
       AND pn.nspname NOT IN ('pg_catalog', 'information_schema')
      INTO cmd;

    RETURN is( cmd, upper($3), $4 );
END;

Function: public.policy_roles_are(name, name, name, name[])

Returns: text

Language: SQL

    SELECT policy_roles_are( $1, $2, $3, $4, 'Policy ' || quote_ident($3) || ' for table ' || quote_ident($1) || '.' || quote_ident($2) || ' should have the correct roles' );

Function: public.policy_roles_are(name, name, name, name[], text)

Returns: text

Language: SQL

    SELECT _are(
        'policy roles',
        ARRAY(
            SELECT pr.rolname
              FROM pg_catalog.pg_policy AS pp
              JOIN pg_catalog.pg_roles AS pr ON pr.oid = ANY (pp.polroles)
              JOIN pg_catalog.pg_class AS pc ON pc.oid = pp.polrelid
              JOIN pg_catalog.pg_namespace AS pn ON pn.oid = pc.relnamespace
             WHERE pn.nspname = $1
               AND pc.relname = $2
               AND pp.polname = $3
            EXCEPT
            SELECT $4[i]
              FROM generate_series(1, array_upper($4, 1)) s(i)
        ),
        ARRAY(
            SELECT $4[i]
              FROM generate_series(1, array_upper($4, 1)) s(i)
            EXCEPT
            SELECT pr.rolname
              FROM pg_catalog.pg_policy AS pp
              JOIN pg_catalog.pg_roles AS pr ON pr.oid = ANY (pp.polroles)
              JOIN pg_catalog.pg_class AS pc ON pc.oid = pp.polrelid
              JOIN pg_catalog.pg_namespace AS pn ON pn.oid = pc.relnamespace
             WHERE pn.nspname = $1
               AND pc.relname = $2
               AND pp.polname = $3
        ),
        $5
    );

Function: public.policy_roles_are(name, name, name[])

Returns: text

Language: SQL

    SELECT policy_roles_are( $1, $2, $3, 'Policy ' || quote_ident($2) || ' for table ' || quote_ident($1) || ' should have the correct roles' );

Function: public.policy_roles_are(name, name, name[], text)

Returns: text

Language: SQL

    SELECT _are(
        'policy roles',
        ARRAY(
            SELECT pr.rolname
              FROM pg_catalog.pg_policy AS pp
              JOIN pg_catalog.pg_roles AS pr ON pr.oid = ANY (pp.polroles)
              JOIN pg_catalog.pg_class AS pc ON pc.oid = pp.polrelid
              JOIN pg_catalog.pg_namespace AS pn ON pn.oid = pc.relnamespace
             WHERE pc.relname = $1
               AND pp.polname = $2
               AND pn.nspname NOT IN ('pg_catalog', 'information_schema')
            EXCEPT
            SELECT $3[i]
              FROM generate_series(1, array_upper($3, 1)) s(i)
        ),
        ARRAY(
            SELECT $3[i]
              FROM generate_series(1, array_upper($3, 1)) s(i)
            EXCEPT
            SELECT pr.rolname
              FROM pg_catalog.pg_policy AS pp
              JOIN pg_catalog.pg_roles AS pr ON pr.oid = ANY (pp.polroles)
              JOIN pg_catalog.pg_class AS pc ON pc.oid = pp.polrelid
              JOIN pg_catalog.pg_namespace AS pn ON pn.oid = pc.relnamespace
             WHERE pc.relname = $1
               AND pp.polname = $2
               AND pn.nspname NOT IN ('pg_catalog', 'information_schema')
        ),
        $4
    );

Function: public.populate_record(anyelement, public.hstore)

Returns: anyelement

Language: C

hstore_populate_record

Function: public.provision_cleanup()

Returns: trigger

Language: PLPGSQL

DECLARE
  v_status      RECORD;
  v_oi_plan_id   UUID;
BEGIN

  SELECT * INTO v_status FROM provision_status WHERE id = NEW.status_id;

  IF NOT v_status.is_final THEN 
    RETURN NEW;
  END IF;

  IF NOT v_status.is_success THEN 
    EXECUTE FORMAT('DELETE FROM %s WHERE id=$1',TG_RELNAME) USING NEW.id;
  END IF;

  RETURN NEW;
END;

Function: public.provision_contact_job()

Returns: trigger

Language: PLPGSQL

DECLARE
  v_contact     RECORD;
BEGIN

  WITH contact_info AS (
    SELECT 
        JSONB_AGG(TO_JSONB(cp.*)) AS postals
    FROM ONLY contact_postal cp 
    WHERE cp.contact_id = NEW.contact_id
  )
  SELECT 
    NEW.id AS provision_contact_id,
    NEW.tenant_customer_id AS tenant_customer_id,
    TO_JSONB(c.*) AS contact,
    contact_info.postals AS postals,
    TO_JSONB(a.*) AS accreditation,
    NEW.pw AS pw
  INTO v_contact
  FROM ONLY contact c 
    JOIN v_accreditation a ON  a.accreditation_id = NEW.accreditation_id
    JOIN contact_info ON TRUE
  WHERE c.id=NEW.contact_id;

  UPDATE provision_contact SET job_id=job_create(
    NEW.tenant_customer_id,
    'provision_contact_create',
    NEW.id,
    TO_JSONB(v_contact.*)
  ) WHERE id = NEW.id;

  RETURN NEW;
END;

Function: public.provision_domain_job()

Returns: trigger

Language: PLPGSQL

DECLARE
  v_domain     RECORD;
  hr           RECORD;
BEGIN

  WITH contacts AS (
    SELECT JSONB_AGG(
      JSONB_BUILD_OBJECT(
        'type',ct.name,
        'handle',pc.handle
      )
    ) AS data
    FROM provision_domain pd  
      JOIN provision_domain_contact pdc 
        ON pdc.provision_domain_id=pd.id  
      JOIN domain_contact_type ct ON ct.id=pdc.contact_type_id
      JOIN provision_contact pc ON pc.contact_id = pdc.contact_id
      JOIN provision_status ps ON ps.id = pc.status_id
    WHERE 
      ps.is_success AND ps.is_final
      AND pd.id = NEW.id
  ),
  hosts AS (
    SELECT 
      ARRAY_AGG(
        h.name
      ) AS data
    FROM provision_domain pd 
      JOIN provision_domain_host pdh ON pdh.provision_domain_id=pd.id
      JOIN host h ON h.id = pdh.host_id
      JOIN provision_host ph ON ph.host_id = h.id
      JOIN provision_status ps ON ps.id = ph.status_id 
    WHERE 
      ps.is_success AND ps.is_final 
      AND pdh.provision_domain_id=NEW.id
  )
  SELECT 
    NEW.id AS provision_contact_id,
    tnc.id AS tenant_customer_id,
    d.name AS name,
    d.registration_period,
    d.pw AS pw,
    contacts.data AS contacts,
    hosts.data AS nameservers,
    TO_JSONB(a.*) AS accreditation,
    TO_JSONB(vat.*) AS accreditation_tld
  INTO v_domain 
  FROM provision_domain d 
    JOIN contacts ON TRUE 
    JOIN hosts ON TRUE
    JOIN v_accreditation a ON a.accreditation_id = NEW.accreditation_id
    JOIN v_accreditation_tld vat ON vat.accreditation_tld_id = d.accreditation_tld_id
    JOIN tenant_customer tnc ON tnc.tenant_id = a.tenant_id
  WHERE d.id = NEW.id;
  
  UPDATE provision_domain SET 
    job_id = job_create(
    v_domain.tenant_customer_id,
    'provision_domain_create',
    NEW.id,
    TO_JSONB(v_domain.*)
  ) WHERE id=NEW.id;

  RETURN NEW;
END;

Function: public.provision_domain_renew_check_exp_date()

Returns: trigger

Language: PLPGSQL

DECLARE 
valid_date BOOL;
BEGIN 

  SELECT EXISTS( 
    SELECT TRUE FROM domain WHERE DATE(ry_expiry_date)=DATE(NEW.current_expiry_date)
    AND id = NEW.domain_id
  ) INTO valid_date;

  IF NOT valid_date THEN
    RAISE EXCEPTION 'request current_expiry_date does not match ry_expiry_date in domain table';
  END IF;

  RETURN NEW;

END;

Function: public.provision_domain_renew_job()

Returns: trigger

Language: PLPGSQL

DECLARE
  v_renew     RECORD;
BEGIN

  SELECT 
    NEW.id AS provision_domain_renew_id,
    tnc.id AS tenant_customer_id,
    TO_JSONB(a.*) AS accreditation,
    d.name AS domain_name,
    d.ry_expiry_date AS expiry_date,
    pr.period  AS period
  INTO v_renew
  FROM provision_domain_renew pr 
    JOIN v_accreditation a ON  a.accreditation_id = NEW.accreditation_id
    JOIN tenant_customer tnc ON tnc.tenant_id = a.tenant_id
    JOIN domain d ON d.id=pr.domain_id
  WHERE pr.id = NEW.id;

  UPDATE provision_domain_renew SET job_id=job_create(
    v_renew.tenant_customer_id,
    'provision_domain_renew',
    NEW.id,
    TO_JSONB(v_renew.*)
  ) WHERE id = NEW.id;

  RETURN NEW;
END;

Function: public.provision_domain_renew_success()

Returns: trigger

Language: PLPGSQL

DECLARE
  v_add     INTERVAL;
BEGIN

  v_add := FORMAT('%s years',NEW.period)::INTERVAL;

  UPDATE domain 
    SET 
      expiry_date=expiry_date + v_add, 
      ry_expiry_date=COALESCE(NEW.ry_expiry_date,expiry_date + v_add)
    WHERE id = NEW.domain_id;
  
  RETURN NEW;
END;

Function: public.provision_domain_success()

Returns: trigger

Language: PLPGSQL


BEGIN

  -- domain 
  INSERT INTO domain(
    id,
    tenant_customer_id,
    accreditation_tld_id,
    name,
    auth_info,
    roid,
    ry_created_date,
    ry_expiry_date,
    expiry_date
  ) (
    SELECT 
      pd.id,    -- domain id
      pd.tenant_customer_id,
      pd.accreditation_tld_id,
      pd.name,
      pd.pw,
      pd.roid,
      COALESCE(pd.ry_created_date,pd.created_date),
      COALESCE(pd.ry_expiry_date,pd.created_date + FORMAT('%d years',pd.registration_period)::INTERVAL),
      COALESCE(pd.ry_expiry_date,pd.created_date + FORMAT('%d years',pd.registration_period)::INTERVAL)
    FROM provision_domain pd
    WHERE id = NEW.id
  );

  -- contact association
  INSERT INTO domain_contact(
    domain_id,
    contact_id,
    domain_contact_type_id
  ) (
    SELECT 
      provision_domain_id,
      contact_id,
      contact_type_id
    FROM provision_domain_contact 
    WHERE provision_domain_id = NEW.id
  );

  -- host association
  INSERT INTO domain_host(
    domain_id,
    host_id
  ) (
    SELECT 
      provision_domain_id,
      host_id
    FROM provision_domain_host 
    WHERE provision_domain_id = NEW.id
  );


  RETURN NEW;
END;

Function: public.provision_finish()

Returns: trigger

Language: PLPGSQL

DECLARE
  v_status      RECORD;
  v_oi_plan_id   UUID;
BEGIN

  SELECT * INTO v_status FROM provision_status WHERE id = NEW.status_id;

  IF NOT v_status.is_final THEN 
    RETURN NEW;
  END IF;

  -- notify all the order_item_plan_ids that are pending 
  IF NEW.order_item_plan_ids IS NOT NULL THEN 

    FOR v_oi_plan_id IN SELECT UNNEST(NEW.order_item_plan_ids) AS id 
    LOOP 
      UPDATE order_item_plan 
      SET 
        status_id = (
          SELECT 
           id 
          FROM order_item_plan_status 
          WHERE is_success = v_status.is_success AND is_final
        ),
        result_data=(SELECT result_data FROM job WHERE id=NEW.job_id),
        result_message=(SELECT result_message FROM job WHERE id=NEW.job_id)
      WHERE id = v_oi_plan_id;
    END LOOP;

  END IF;

  IF v_status.is_success THEN 
    UPDATE class.provision SET provisioned_date=NOW() WHERE id = NEW.id;
  END IF;

  RETURN NEW;
END;

Function: public.provision_host_job()

Returns: trigger

Language: PLPGSQL

DECLARE
  v_host     RECORD;
BEGIN

  WITH _host_info  AS (
    SELECT 
      h.id AS host_id,
      name AS host_name,
      ARRAY_AGG(ha.address) FILTER (WHERE FAMILY(ha.address) = 4) AS ipv4_addr,
      ARRAY_AGG(ha.address) FILTER (WHERE FAMILY(ha.address) = 6) AS ipv6_addr
    FROM host h  
      LEFT JOIN host_addr ha ON ha.host_id = h.id
    WHERE h.id = NEW.host_id
    GROUP BY 1,2
  )
  SELECT 
    NEW.id AS provision_host_id,
    NEW.tenant_customer_id AS tenant_customer_id,
    TO_JSONB(hi.*) AS host,
    TO_JSONB(a.*) AS accreditation 
  INTO v_host 
  FROM _host_info hi
    JOIN v_accreditation a ON  a.accreditation_id = NEW.accreditation_id;


  UPDATE provision_host SET 
    job_id=job_create(
    NEW.tenant_customer_id,
    'provision_host_create',
    NEW.id,
    TO_JSONB(v_host.*)
  ) WHERE id = NEW.id;

  RETURN NEW;
END;

Function: public.random_color()

Returns: integer[]

Language: SQL


  SELECT  ARRAY_AGG(a.value) FROM (
    SELECT (FLOOR(RANDOM() * (200-10 ) + 10))::INT AS value FROM generate_series(1,3)
  ) a

Function: public.relation_owner_is(name, name)

Returns: text

Language: SQL

    SELECT relation_owner_is(
        $1, $2,
        'Relation ' || quote_ident($1) || ' should be owned by ' || quote_ident($2)
    );

Function: public.relation_owner_is(name, name, name)

Returns: text

Language: SQL

    SELECT relation_owner_is(
        $1, $2, $3,
        'Relation ' || quote_ident($1) || '.' || quote_ident($2) || ' should be owned by ' || quote_ident($3)
    );

Function: public.relation_owner_is(name, name, name, text)

Returns: text

Language: PLPGSQL

DECLARE
    owner NAME := _get_rel_owner($1, $2);
BEGIN
    -- Make sure the relation exists.
    IF owner IS NULL THEN
        RETURN ok(FALSE, $4) || E'\n' || diag(
            E'    Relation ' || quote_ident($1) || '.' || quote_ident($2) || ' does not exist'
        );
    END IF;

    RETURN is(owner, $3, $4);
END;

Function: public.relation_owner_is(name, name, text)

Returns: text

Language: PLPGSQL

DECLARE
    owner NAME := _get_rel_owner($1);
BEGIN
    -- Make sure the relation exists.
    IF owner IS NULL THEN
        RETURN ok(FALSE, $3) || E'\n' || diag(
            E'    Relation ' || quote_ident($1) || ' does not exist'
        );
    END IF;

    RETURN is(owner, $2, $3);
END;

Function: public.results_eq(refcursor, anyarray)

Returns: text

Language: SQL

    SELECT results_eq( $1, $2, NULL::text );

Function: public.results_eq(refcursor, anyarray, text)

Returns: text

Language: PLPGSQL

DECLARE
    want REFCURSOR;
    res  TEXT;
BEGIN
    OPEN want FOR SELECT $2[i]
    FROM generate_series(array_lower($2, 1), array_upper($2, 1)) s(i);
    res := results_eq($1, want, $3);
    CLOSE want;
    RETURN res;
END;

Function: public.results_eq(refcursor, refcursor)

Returns: text

Language: SQL

    SELECT results_eq( $1, $2, NULL::text );

Function: public.results_eq(refcursor, refcursor, text)

Returns: text

Language: PLPGSQL

DECLARE
    have       ALIAS FOR $1;
    want       ALIAS FOR $2;
    have_rec   RECORD;
    want_rec   RECORD;
    have_found BOOLEAN;
    want_found BOOLEAN;
    rownum     INTEGER := 1;
    err_msg    text := 'details not available in pg <= 9.1';
BEGIN
    FETCH have INTO have_rec;
    have_found := FOUND;
    FETCH want INTO want_rec;
    want_found := FOUND;
    WHILE have_found OR want_found LOOP
        IF have_rec IS DISTINCT FROM want_rec OR have_found <> want_found THEN
            RETURN ok( false, $3 ) || E'\n' || diag(
                '    Results differ beginning at row ' || rownum || E':\n' ||
                '        have: ' || CASE WHEN have_found THEN have_rec::text ELSE 'NULL' END || E'\n' ||
                '        want: ' || CASE WHEN want_found THEN want_rec::text ELSE 'NULL' END
            );
        END IF;
        rownum = rownum + 1;
        FETCH have INTO have_rec;
        have_found := FOUND;
        FETCH want INTO want_rec;
        want_found := FOUND;
    END LOOP;

    RETURN ok( true, $3 );
EXCEPTION
    WHEN datatype_mismatch THEN
        GET STACKED DIAGNOSTICS err_msg = MESSAGE_TEXT;
        RETURN ok( false, $3 ) || E'\n' || diag(
            E'    Number of columns or their types differ between the queries' ||
            CASE WHEN have_rec::TEXT = want_rec::text THEN '' ELSE E':\n' ||
                '        have: ' || CASE WHEN have_found THEN have_rec::text ELSE 'NULL' END || E'\n' ||
                '        want: ' || CASE WHEN want_found THEN want_rec::text ELSE 'NULL' END
            END || E'\n        ERROR: ' || err_msg
        );
END;

Function: public.results_eq(refcursor, text)

Returns: text

Language: SQL

    SELECT results_eq( $1, $2, NULL::text );

Function: public.results_eq(refcursor, text, text)

Returns: text

Language: PLPGSQL

DECLARE
    want REFCURSOR;
    res  TEXT;
BEGIN
    OPEN want FOR EXECUTE _query($2);
    res := results_eq($1, want, $3);
    CLOSE want;
    RETURN res;
END;

Function: public.results_eq(text, anyarray)

Returns: text

Language: SQL

    SELECT results_eq( $1, $2, NULL::text );

Function: public.results_eq(text, anyarray, text)

Returns: text

Language: PLPGSQL

DECLARE
    have REFCURSOR;
    want REFCURSOR;
    res  TEXT;
BEGIN
    OPEN have FOR EXECUTE _query($1);
    OPEN want FOR SELECT $2[i]
    FROM generate_series(array_lower($2, 1), array_upper($2, 1)) s(i);
    res := results_eq(have, want, $3);
    CLOSE have;
    CLOSE want;
    RETURN res;
END;

Function: public.results_eq(text, refcursor)

Returns: text

Language: SQL

    SELECT results_eq( $1, $2, NULL::text );

Function: public.results_eq(text, refcursor, text)

Returns: text

Language: PLPGSQL

DECLARE
    have REFCURSOR;
    res  TEXT;
BEGIN
    OPEN have FOR EXECUTE _query($1);
    res := results_eq(have, $2, $3);
    CLOSE have;
    RETURN res;
END;

Function: public.results_eq(text, text)

Returns: text

Language: SQL

    SELECT results_eq( $1, $2, NULL::text );

Function: public.results_eq(text, text, text)

Returns: text

Language: PLPGSQL

DECLARE
    have REFCURSOR;
    want REFCURSOR;
    res  TEXT;
BEGIN
    OPEN have FOR EXECUTE _query($1);
    OPEN want FOR EXECUTE _query($2);
    res := results_eq(have, want, $3);
    CLOSE have;
    CLOSE want;
    RETURN res;
END;

Function: public.results_ne(refcursor, anyarray)

Returns: text

Language: SQL

    SELECT results_ne( $1, $2, NULL::text );

Function: public.results_ne(refcursor, anyarray, text)

Returns: text

Language: PLPGSQL

DECLARE
    want REFCURSOR;
    res  TEXT;
BEGIN
    OPEN want FOR SELECT $2[i]
    FROM generate_series(array_lower($2, 1), array_upper($2, 1)) s(i);
    res := results_ne($1, want, $3);
    CLOSE want;
    RETURN res;
END;

Function: public.results_ne(refcursor, refcursor)

Returns: text

Language: SQL

    SELECT results_ne( $1, $2, NULL::text );

Function: public.results_ne(refcursor, refcursor, text)

Returns: text

Language: PLPGSQL

DECLARE
    have       ALIAS FOR $1;
    want       ALIAS FOR $2;
    have_rec   RECORD;
    want_rec   RECORD;
    have_found BOOLEAN;
    want_found BOOLEAN;
    err_msg    text := 'details not available in pg <= 9.1';
BEGIN
    FETCH have INTO have_rec;
    have_found := FOUND;
    FETCH want INTO want_rec;
    want_found := FOUND;
    WHILE have_found OR want_found LOOP
        IF have_rec IS DISTINCT FROM want_rec OR have_found <> want_found THEN
            RETURN ok( true, $3 );
        ELSE
            FETCH have INTO have_rec;
            have_found := FOUND;
            FETCH want INTO want_rec;
            want_found := FOUND;
        END IF;
    END LOOP;
    RETURN ok( false, $3 );
EXCEPTION
    WHEN datatype_mismatch THEN
        GET STACKED DIAGNOSTICS err_msg = MESSAGE_TEXT;
        RETURN ok( false, $3 ) || E'\n' || diag(
            E'    Number of columns or their types differ between the queries' ||
            CASE WHEN have_rec::TEXT = want_rec::text THEN '' ELSE E':\n' ||
                '        have: ' || CASE WHEN have_found THEN have_rec::text ELSE 'NULL' END || E'\n' ||
                '        want: ' || CASE WHEN want_found THEN want_rec::text ELSE 'NULL' END
            END || E'\n        ERROR: ' || err_msg
        );
END;

Function: public.results_ne(refcursor, text)

Returns: text

Language: SQL

    SELECT results_ne( $1, $2, NULL::text );

Function: public.results_ne(refcursor, text, text)

Returns: text

Language: PLPGSQL

DECLARE
    want REFCURSOR;
    res  TEXT;
BEGIN
    OPEN want FOR EXECUTE _query($2);
    res := results_ne($1, want, $3);
    CLOSE want;
    RETURN res;
END;

Function: public.results_ne(text, anyarray)

Returns: text

Language: SQL

    SELECT results_ne( $1, $2, NULL::text );

Function: public.results_ne(text, anyarray, text)

Returns: text

Language: PLPGSQL

DECLARE
    have REFCURSOR;
    want REFCURSOR;
    res  TEXT;
BEGIN
    OPEN have FOR EXECUTE _query($1);
    OPEN want FOR SELECT $2[i]
    FROM generate_series(array_lower($2, 1), array_upper($2, 1)) s(i);
    res := results_ne(have, want, $3);
    CLOSE have;
    CLOSE want;
    RETURN res;
END;

Function: public.results_ne(text, refcursor)

Returns: text

Language: SQL

    SELECT results_ne( $1, $2, NULL::text );

Function: public.results_ne(text, refcursor, text)

Returns: text

Language: PLPGSQL

    have REFCURSOR;
    res  TEXT;
BEGIN
    OPEN have FOR EXECUTE _query($1);
    res := results_ne(have, $2, $3);
    CLOSE have;
    RETURN res;
END;

Function: public.results_ne(text, text)

Returns: text

Language: SQL

    SELECT results_ne( $1, $2, NULL::text );

Function: public.results_ne(text, text, text)

Returns: text

Language: PLPGSQL

DECLARE
    have REFCURSOR;
    want REFCURSOR;
    res  TEXT;
BEGIN
    OPEN have FOR EXECUTE _query($1);
    OPEN want FOR EXECUTE _query($2);
    res := results_ne(have, want, $3);
    CLOSE have;
    CLOSE want;
    RETURN res;
END;

Function: public.roles_are(name[])

Returns: text

Language: SQL

    SELECT roles_are( $1, 'There should be the correct roles' );

Function: public.roles_are(name[], text)

Returns: text

Language: SQL

    SELECT _are(
        'roles',
        ARRAY(
            SELECT rolname
              FROM pg_catalog.pg_roles
            EXCEPT
            SELECT $1[i]
              FROM generate_series(1, array_upper($1, 1)) s(i)
        ),
        ARRAY(
            SELECT $1[i]
              FROM generate_series(1, array_upper($1, 1)) s(i)
            EXCEPT
            SELECT rolname
              FROM pg_catalog.pg_roles
        ),
        $2
    );

Function: public.row_eq(text, anyelement)

Returns: text

Language: SQL

    SELECT row_eq($1, $2, NULL );

Function: public.row_eq(text, anyelement, text)

Returns: text

Language: PLPGSQL

DECLARE
    rec    RECORD;
BEGIN
    EXECUTE _query($1) INTO rec;
    IF NOT rec IS DISTINCT FROM $2 THEN RETURN ok(true, $3); END IF;
    RETURN ok(false, $3 ) || E'\n' || diag(
           '        have: ' || CASE WHEN rec IS NULL THEN 'NULL' ELSE rec::text END ||
        E'\n        want: ' || CASE WHEN $2  IS NULL THEN 'NULL' ELSE $2::text  END
    );
END;

Function: public.rule_is_instead(name, name)

Returns: text

Language: SQL

    SELECT rule_is_instead($1, $2, 'Rule ' || quote_ident($2) || ' on relation ' || quote_ident($1) || ' should be an INSTEAD rule' );

Function: public.rule_is_instead(name, name, name)

Returns: text

Language: SQL

    SELECT rule_is_instead( $1, $2, $3, 'Rule ' || quote_ident($3) || ' on relation ' || quote_ident($1) || '.' || quote_ident($2) || ' should be an INSTEAD rule' );

Function: public.rule_is_instead(name, name, name, text)

Returns: text

Language: PLPGSQL

DECLARE
    is_it boolean := _is_instead($1, $2, $3);
BEGIN
    IF is_it IS NOT NULL THEN RETURN ok( is_it, $4 ); END IF;
    RETURN ok( FALSE, $4 ) || E'\n' || diag(
        '    Rule ' || quote_ident($3) || ' does not exist'
    );
END;

Function: public.rule_is_instead(name, name, text)

Returns: text

Language: PLPGSQL

DECLARE
    is_it boolean := _is_instead($1, $2);
BEGIN
    IF is_it IS NOT NULL THEN RETURN ok( is_it, $3 ); END IF;
    RETURN ok( FALSE, $3 ) || E'\n' || diag(
        '    Rule ' || quote_ident($2) || ' does not exist'
    );
END;

Function: public.rule_is_on(name, name, name, text)

Returns: text

Language: SQL

    SELECT rule_is_on(
        $1, $2, $3, $4,
        'Rule ' || quote_ident($3) || ' should be on ' || _expand_on(_contract_on($4)::char)
        || ' to ' || quote_ident($1) || '.' || quote_ident($2)
    );

Function: public.rule_is_on(name, name, name, text, text)

Returns: text

Language: PLPGSQL

DECLARE
    want char := _contract_on($4);
    have char := _rule_on($1, $2, $3);
BEGIN
    IF have IS NOT NULL THEN
        RETURN is( _expand_on(have), _expand_on(want), $5 );
    END IF;

    RETURN ok( false, $5 ) || E'\n' || diag(
        '    Rule ' || quote_ident($3) || ' does not exist on '
        || quote_ident($1) || '.' || quote_ident($2)
    );
END;

Function: public.rule_is_on(name, name, text)

Returns: text

Language: SQL

    SELECT rule_is_on(
        $1, $2, $3,
        'Rule ' || quote_ident($2) || ' should be on '
        || _expand_on(_contract_on($3)::char) || ' to ' || quote_ident($1)
    );

Function: public.rule_is_on(name, name, text, text)

Returns: text

Language: PLPGSQL

DECLARE
    want char := _contract_on($3);
    have char := _rule_on($1, $2);
BEGIN
    IF have IS NOT NULL THEN
        RETURN is( _expand_on(have), _expand_on(want), $4 );
    END IF;

    RETURN ok( false, $4 ) || E'\n' || diag(
        '    Rule ' || quote_ident($2) || ' does not exist on '
        || quote_ident($1)
    );
END;

Function: public.rules_are(name, name, name[])

Returns: text

Language: SQL

    SELECT rules_are( $1, $2, $3, 'Relation ' || quote_ident($1) || '.' || quote_ident($2) || ' should have the correct rules' );

Function: public.rules_are(name, name, name[], text)

Returns: text

Language: SQL

    SELECT _are(
        'rules',
        ARRAY(
            SELECT r.rulename
              FROM pg_catalog.pg_rewrite r
              JOIN pg_catalog.pg_class c     ON c.oid = r.ev_class
              JOIN pg_catalog.pg_namespace n ON c.relnamespace = n.oid
             WHERE c.relname = $2
               AND n.nspname = $1
            EXCEPT
            SELECT $3[i]
              FROM generate_series(1, array_upper($3, 1)) s(i)
        ),
        ARRAY(
            SELECT $3[i]
              FROM generate_series(1, array_upper($3, 1)) s(i)
            EXCEPT
            SELECT r.rulename
              FROM pg_catalog.pg_rewrite r
              JOIN pg_catalog.pg_class c     ON c.oid = r.ev_class
              JOIN pg_catalog.pg_namespace n ON c.relnamespace = n.oid
             WHERE c.relname = $2
               AND n.nspname = $1
        ),
        $4
    );

Function: public.rules_are(name, name[])

Returns: text

Language: SQL

    SELECT rules_are( $1, $2, 'Relation ' || quote_ident($1) || ' should have the correct rules' );

Function: public.rules_are(name, name[], text)

Returns: text

Language: SQL

    SELECT _are(
        'rules',
        ARRAY(
            SELECT r.rulename
              FROM pg_catalog.pg_rewrite r
              JOIN pg_catalog.pg_class c     ON c.oid = r.ev_class
              JOIN pg_catalog.pg_namespace n ON c.relnamespace = n.oid
             WHERE c.relname = $1
               AND n.nspname NOT IN ('pg_catalog', 'information_schema')
               AND pg_catalog.pg_table_is_visible(c.oid)
            EXCEPT
            SELECT $2[i]
              FROM generate_series(1, array_upper($2, 1)) s(i)
        ),
        ARRAY(
            SELECT $2[i]
              FROM generate_series(1, array_upper($2, 1)) s(i)
            EXCEPT
            SELECT r.rulename
              FROM pg_catalog.pg_rewrite r
              JOIN pg_catalog.pg_class c     ON c.oid = r.ev_class
              JOIN pg_catalog.pg_namespace n ON c.relnamespace = n.oid
               AND c.relname = $1
               AND n.nspname NOT IN ('pg_catalog', 'information_schema')
               AND pg_catalog.pg_table_is_visible(c.oid)
        ),
        $3
    );

Function: public.runtests()

Returns: SET OF text

Language: SQL

    SELECT * FROM runtests( '^test' );

Function: public.runtests(name)

Returns: SET OF text

Language: SQL

    SELECT * FROM runtests( $1, '^test' );

Function: public.runtests(name, text)

Returns: SET OF text

Language: SQL

    SELECT * FROM _runner(
        findfuncs( $1, '^startup' ),
        findfuncs( $1, '^shutdown' ),
        findfuncs( $1, '^setup' ),
        findfuncs( $1, '^teardown' ),
        findfuncs( $1, $2, '^(startup|shutdown|setup|teardown)' )
    );

Function: public.runtests(text)

Returns: SET OF text

Language: SQL

    SELECT * FROM _runner(
        findfuncs( '^startup' ),
        findfuncs( '^shutdown' ),
        findfuncs( '^setup' ),
        findfuncs( '^teardown' ),
        findfuncs( $1, '^(startup|shutdown|setup|teardown)' )
    );

Function: public.schema_owner_is(name, name)

Returns: text

Language: SQL

    SELECT schema_owner_is(
        $1, $2,
        'Schema ' || quote_ident($1) || ' should be owned by ' || quote_ident($2)
    );

Function: public.schema_owner_is(name, name, text)

Returns: text

Language: PLPGSQL

DECLARE
    owner NAME := _get_schema_owner($1);
BEGIN
    -- Make sure the schema exists.
    IF owner IS NULL THEN
        RETURN ok(FALSE, $3) || E'\n' || diag(
            E'    Schema ' || quote_ident($1) || ' does not exist'
        );
    END IF;

    RETURN is(owner, $2, $3);
END;

Function: public.schema_privs_are(name, name, name[])

Returns: text

Language: SQL

    SELECT schema_privs_are(
        $1, $2, $3,
        'Role ' || quote_ident($2) || ' should be granted '
            || CASE WHEN $3[1] IS NULL THEN 'no privileges' ELSE array_to_string($3, ', ') END
            || ' on schema ' || quote_ident($1)
    );

Function: public.schema_privs_are(name, name, name[], text)

Returns: text

Language: PLPGSQL

DECLARE
    grants TEXT[] := _get_schema_privs( $2, $1::TEXT );
BEGIN
    IF grants[1] = 'invalid_schema_name' THEN
        RETURN ok(FALSE, $4) || E'\n' || diag(
            '    Schema ' || quote_ident($1) || ' does not exist'
        );
    ELSIF grants[1] = 'undefined_role' THEN
        RETURN ok(FALSE, $4) || E'\n' || diag(
            '    Role ' || quote_ident($2) || ' does not exist'
        );
    END IF;
    RETURN _assets_are('privileges', grants, $3, $4);
END;

Function: public.schemas_are(name[])

Returns: text

Language: SQL

    SELECT schemas_are( $1, 'There should be the correct schemas' );

Function: public.schemas_are(name[], text)

Returns: text

Language: SQL

    SELECT _are(
        'schemas',
        ARRAY(
            SELECT nspname
              FROM pg_catalog.pg_namespace
             WHERE nspname NOT LIKE 'pg_%'
               AND nspname <> 'information_schema'
             EXCEPT
            SELECT $1[i]
              FROM generate_series(1, array_upper($1, 1)) s(i)
        ),
        ARRAY(
            SELECT $1[i]
              FROM generate_series(1, array_upper($1, 1)) s(i)
            EXCEPT
            SELECT nspname
              FROM pg_catalog.pg_namespace
             WHERE nspname NOT LIKE 'pg_%'
               AND nspname <> 'information_schema'
        ),
        $2
    );

Function: public.sequence_owner_is(name, name)

Returns: text

Language: SQL

    SELECT sequence_owner_is(
        $1, $2,
        'Sequence ' || quote_ident($1) || ' should be owned by ' || quote_ident($2)
    );

Function: public.sequence_owner_is(name, name, name)

Returns: text

Language: SQL

    SELECT sequence_owner_is(
        $1, $2, $3,
        'Sequence ' || quote_ident($1) || '.' || quote_ident($2) || ' should be owned by ' || quote_ident($3)
    );

Function: public.sequence_owner_is(name, name, name, text)

Returns: text

Language: PLPGSQL

DECLARE
    owner NAME := _get_rel_owner('S'::char, $1, $2);
BEGIN
    -- Make sure the sequence exists.
    IF owner IS NULL THEN
        RETURN ok(FALSE, $4) || E'\n' || diag(
            E'    Sequence ' || quote_ident($1) || '.' || quote_ident($2) || ' does not exist'
        );
    END IF;

    RETURN is(owner, $3, $4);
END;

Function: public.sequence_owner_is(name, name, text)

Returns: text

Language: PLPGSQL

DECLARE
    owner NAME := _get_rel_owner('S'::char, $1);
BEGIN
    -- Make sure the sequence exists.
    IF owner IS NULL THEN
        RETURN ok(FALSE, $3) || E'\n' || diag(
            E'    Sequence ' || quote_ident($1) || ' does not exist'
        );
    END IF;

    RETURN is(owner, $2, $3);
END;

Function: public.sequence_privs_are(name, name, name, name[])

Returns: text

Language: SQL

    SELECT sequence_privs_are(
        $1, $2, $3, $4,
        'Role ' || quote_ident($3) || ' should be granted '
            || CASE WHEN $4[1] IS NULL THEN 'no privileges' ELSE array_to_string($4, ', ') END
            || ' on sequence '|| quote_ident($1) || '.' || quote_ident($2)
    );

Function: public.sequence_privs_are(name, name, name, name[], text)

Returns: text

Language: PLPGSQL

DECLARE
    grants TEXT[] := _get_sequence_privs( $3, quote_ident($1) || '.' || quote_ident($2) );
BEGIN
    IF grants[1] = 'undefined_table' THEN
        RETURN ok(FALSE, $5) || E'\n' || diag(
            '    Sequence ' || quote_ident($1) || '.' || quote_ident($2) || ' does not exist'
        );
    ELSIF grants[1] = 'undefined_role' THEN
        RETURN ok(FALSE, $5) || E'\n' || diag(
            '    Role ' || quote_ident($3) || ' does not exist'
        );
    END IF;
    RETURN _assets_are('privileges', grants, $4, $5);
END;

Language: SQL

        $1, $2, $3,
        'Role ' || quote_ident($2) || ' should be granted '
            || CASE WHEN $3[1] IS NULL THEN 'no privileges' ELSE array_to_string($3, ', ') END
            || ' on sequence ' || quote_ident($1)
    );

Language: PLPGSQL

    grants TEXT[] := _get_sequence_privs( $2, quote_ident($1) );

            '    Sequence ' || quote_ident($1) || '.' || quote_ident($2) || ' does not exist'
        );
    ELSIF grants[1] = 'undefined_role' THEN
        RETURN ok(FALSE, $4) || E'\n' || diag(
            '    Role ' || quote_ident($2) || ' does not exist'
        );
    END IF;
    RETURN _assets_are('privileges', grants, $3, $4);
END;

            '    Server ' || quote_ident($1) || ' does not exist'
        );
    ELSIF grants[1] = 'undefined_role' THEN
        RETURN ok(FALSE, $4) || E'\n' || diag(
            '    Role ' || quote_ident($2) || ' does not exist'
        );
    END IF;
    RETURN _assets_are('privileges', grants, $3, $4);
END;

Function: public.shortname_ok(name text)

Returns: boolean

Language: PLPGSQL

BEGIN
  RETURN (name ~ E'^[\\w\\.\\-\\_\\+]+\\w+$');
END;

Function: public.skeys(public.hstore)

Returns: SET OF text

hstore_skeys

Function: public.skip(integer)

Returns: text

Language: SQL

SELECT skip(NULL, $1)

Function: public.skip(integer, text)

Returns: text

Language: SQL

SELECT skip($2, $1)

Function: public.skip(text)

Returns: text

Language: SQL

    SELECT ok( TRUE ) || ' ' || diag( 'SKIP' || COALESCE(' ' || $1, '') );

Function: public.skip(why text, how_many integer)

Returns: text

Language: PLPGSQL

DECLARE
    output TEXT[];
BEGIN
    output := '{}';
    FOR i IN 1..how_many LOOP
        output = array_append(
            output,
            ok( TRUE ) || ' ' || diag( 'SKIP' || COALESCE( ' ' || why, '') )
        );
    END LOOP;
    RETURN array_to_string(output, E'\n');
END;

Function: public.slice(public.hstore, text[])

hstore_slice_to_array

Function: public.soft_delete()

Returns: trigger

Language: PLPGSQL

BEGIN

  EXECUTE 'UPDATE ' || TG_TABLE_NAME || ' SET deleted_date = NOW(), deleted_by = $1 WHERE id = $2'
  USING CURRENT_USER, OLD.id;
  RETURN NULL;

END;

Function: public.svals(public.hstore)

Returns: SET OF text

Language: C

hstore_svals

Function: public.table_event_notify()

Returns: trigger

Language: PLPGSQL

This trigger is used to generate asynchronous notifications when a table is changed

DECLARE
    _payload JSONB;
    _table TEXT;
    _options JSONB DEFAULT '{}'::JSONB;
    _exclude TEXT;
    _new JSONB;
    _old JSONB;
BEGIN

  IF TG_NARGS > 0  THEN
    _table := LOWER(TG_ARGV[0]);


    -- the second argument is options to control
    -- the notify
    IF TG_NARGS > 1 THEN
      _options := TG_ARGV[1]::JSONB;
    END IF;


  ELSE
    _table := LOWER(TG_RELNAME);
  END IF;

  _payload := JSONB_BUILD_OBJECT(
    'TG_NAME',TG_NAME,
    'TG_WHEN',TG_WHEN,
    'TG_LEVEL',TG_LEVEL,
    'TG_OP',TG_OP,
    'TG_RELID',TG_RELID,
    'TG_RELNAME',TG_RELNAME,
    'TG_TABLE_SCHEMA',TG_TABLE_SCHEMA,
    'TG_NARGS',TG_NARGS,
    'TG_ARGV',TO_JSONB(TG_ARGV)
  );


  -- store the NEW and OLD records into a JSONB
  _new := TO_JSONB(NEW.*);
  _old := TO_JSONB(OLD.*);


  -- this is an option to remove the column from the notify.
  -- useful when NOTIFYing about BYTEA columns
  IF _options ? 'exclude' THEN

    FOR _exclude IN SELECT * FROM JSONB_ARRAY_ELEMENTS_TEXT(_options #> '{exclude}')
    LOOP
      _new = _new - _exclude;
      _old = _old - _exclude;
    END LOOP;
  END IF;

  _payload = _payload || JSONB_BUILD_OBJECT('NEW',_new);
  _payload = _payload || JSONB_BUILD_OBJECT('OLD',_old);

  PERFORM notify_event(_table || '_event','table_event_notify',_payload::TEXT);

  RETURN NEW;
END;

Function: public.table_owner_is(name, name)

Returns: text

Language: SQL

    SELECT table_owner_is(
        $1, $2,
        'Table ' || quote_ident($1) || ' should be owned by ' || quote_ident($2)
    );

Function: public.table_owner_is(name, name, name)

Returns: text

Language: SQL

    SELECT table_owner_is(
        $1, $2, $3,
        'Table ' || quote_ident($1) || '.' || quote_ident($2) || ' should be owned by ' || quote_ident($3)
    );

Function: public.table_owner_is(name, name, name, text)

Returns: text

Language: PLPGSQL

DECLARE
    owner NAME := _get_rel_owner('{r,p}'::char[], $1, $2);
BEGIN
    -- Make sure the table exists.
    IF owner IS NULL THEN
        RETURN ok(FALSE, $4) || E'\n' || diag(
            E'    Table ' || quote_ident($1) || '.' || quote_ident($2) || ' does not exist'
        );
    END IF;

    RETURN is(owner, $3, $4);
END;

Function: public.table_owner_is(name, name, text)

Returns: text

Language: PLPGSQL

DECLARE
    owner NAME := _get_rel_owner('{r,p}'::char[], $1);
BEGIN
    -- Make sure the table exists.
    IF owner IS NULL THEN
        RETURN ok(FALSE, $3) || E'\n' || diag(
            E'    Table ' || quote_ident($1) || ' does not exist'
        );
    END IF;

    RETURN is(owner, $2, $3);
END;

            '    Role ' || quote_ident($3) || ' does not exist'
        );
    END IF;
    RETURN _assets_are('privileges', grants, $4, $5);

Language: PLPGSQL

    grants TEXT[] := _get_tablespaceprivs( $2, $1::TEXT );
