        RETURN ok(FALSE, $4) || E'\n' || diag(
            '    Tablespace ' || quote_ident($1) || ' does not exist'
        );
    ELSIF grants[1] = 'undefined_role' THEN
        RETURN ok(FALSE, $4) || E'\n' || diag(
            '    Role ' || quote_ident($2) || ' does not exist'
        );
    END IF;
    RETURN _assets_are('privileges', grants, $3, $4);
END;

Function: public.tablespaces_are(name[])

Returns: text

Language: SQL

    SELECT tablespaces_are( $1, 'There should be the correct tablespaces' );

Function: public.tablespaces_are(name[], text)

Returns: text

Language: SQL

    SELECT _are(
        'tablespaces',
        ARRAY(
            SELECT spcname
              FROM pg_catalog.pg_tablespace
            EXCEPT
            SELECT $1[i]
              FROM generate_series(1, array_upper($1, 1)) s(i)
        ),
        ARRAY(
            SELECT $1[i]
               FROM generate_series(1, array_upper($1, 1)) s(i)
            EXCEPT
            SELECT spcname
              FROM pg_catalog.pg_tablespace
        ),
        $2
    );

Function: public.tc_descr_from_id(table_name text, id uuid)

Returns: text

Language: PLPGSQL

DECLARE
  _result TEXT;
BEGIN

  EXECUTE 'SELECT descr FROM '|| table_name ||' WHERE id = $1' INTO STRICT _result
    USING id;
  RETURN _result;

END;

Function: public.tc_descr_from_name(table_name text, name text)

Returns: text

Language: PLPGSQL

DECLARE
  _result TEXT;
BEGIN

  EXECUTE 'SELECT descr FROM '|| table_name ||' WHERE name = $1' INTO STRICT _result
    USING name;
  RETURN _result;

END;

Function: public.tc_gen_password(v_length integer)

Returns: text

Language: PLPGSQL

DECLARE
  v_iter    INT;
  pw        TEXT DEFAULT '';
  v_ch      CHAR;
BEGIN

  FOR v_iter IN 1..v_length LOOP
    SELECT CHR(generate_series) INTO v_ch AS c FROM generate_series(33,127,1) ORDER BY RANDOM() LIMIT 1;
    pw = pw || v_ch;
  END LOOP;

  RETURN pw;

END;

Function: public.tc_id_from_name(table_name text, name text)

Returns: uuid

Language: PLPGSQL

DECLARE
  _result UUID;
BEGIN

  EXECUTE 'SELECT id FROM '|| table_name ||' WHERE name = $1' INTO STRICT _result
    USING name;
  RETURN _result;

END;

Function: public.tc_json_merge(original jsonb, merge jsonb)

Returns: jsonb

Language: PLPGSQL

This function merges two JSONB objects, with keys from the merge object overwriting the keys from the original object. 

DECLARE
  return_json JSON;
BEGIN

  -- NOTE: PG 9.5+ have methods that can do this directly, but we are on 9.4
  SELECT json_object_agg(j.key, j.value) INTO return_json
  FROM (
    WITH to_merge AS (
      SELECT * FROM json_each(merge::JSON)
    )
    SELECT * FROM json_each(original::JSON)
    WHERE key NOT IN (SELECT key FROM to_merge)
    UNION ALL
    SELECT * FROM to_merge
  ) j;
  RETURN return_json::JSONB;
END;

Function: public.tc_lowercase_name()

Returns: trigger

Language: PLPGSQL

BEGIN
  NEW.name := LOWER(NEW.name);
  RETURN NEW;
END;

Function: public.tc_name_from_id(table_name text, id uuid)

Returns: text

Language: PLPGSQL

DECLARE
  _result TEXT;
BEGIN

  EXECUTE 'SELECT name FROM '|| table_name ||' WHERE id = $1' INTO STRICT _result
    USING id;
  RETURN _result;

END;

Function: public.tc_record_from_id(table_name text, id uuid)

Returns: record

Language: PLPGSQL

DECLARE
  _result RECORD;
BEGIN

  EXECUTE 'SELECT * FROM '|| table_name ||' WHERE id = $1' INTO STRICT _result
    USING id;
  RETURN _result;

END;

Function: public.tc_record_from_name(table_name text, name text)

Returns: record

Language: PLPGSQL

DECLARE
  _result RECORD;
BEGIN

  EXECUTE 'SELECT * FROM '|| table_name ||' WHERE name = $1' INTO STRICT _result
    USING name;
  RETURN _result;

END;

Function: public.tc_tmpl(_t text, _tmpl_var public.hstore)

Returns: text

Language: PLPGSQL

DECLARE
  _result    TEXT;
  _var       TEXT[];
  _replace   TEXT;
BEGIN

  _result := _t;

  FOR _var IN SELECT regexp_matches( _t, '{([\w_]+)}', 'g' )
  LOOP
    _replace := _tmpl_var->_var[1];

    IF _replace IS NULL THEN
      _replace := FORMAT( '{%s}', _var[1] );
    END IF;

    _result := REPLACE( _result, FORMAT( '{%s}', _var[1] ), _replace );
  END LOOP;

  RETURN _result;

END;

Function: public.tconvert(text, text)

Returns: hstore

Language: C

hstore_from_text

Function: public.throws_ilike(text, text)

Returns: text

Language: SQL

    SELECT throws_ilike($1, $2, 'Should throw exception like ' || quote_literal($2) );

Function: public.throws_ilike(text, text, text)

Returns: text

Language: PLPGSQL

BEGIN
    EXECUTE _query($1);
    RETURN ok( FALSE, $3 ) || E'\n' || diag( '    no exception thrown' );
EXCEPTION WHEN OTHERS THEN
    return _tlike( SQLERRM ~~* $2, SQLERRM, $2, $3 );
END;

Function: public.throws_imatching(text, text)

Returns: text

Language: SQL

    SELECT throws_imatching($1, $2, 'Should throw exception matching ' || quote_literal($2) );

Function: public.throws_imatching(text, text, text)

Returns: text

Language: PLPGSQL

BEGIN
    EXECUTE _query($1);
    RETURN ok( FALSE, $3 ) || E'\n' || diag( '    no exception thrown' );
EXCEPTION WHEN OTHERS THEN
    return _tlike( SQLERRM ~* $2, SQLERRM, $2, $3 );
END;

Function: public.throws_like(text, text)

Returns: text

Language: SQL

    SELECT throws_like($1, $2, 'Should throw exception like ' || quote_literal($2) );

Function: public.throws_like(text, text, text)

Returns: text

Language: PLPGSQL

BEGIN
    EXECUTE _query($1);
    RETURN ok( FALSE, $3 ) || E'\n' || diag( '    no exception thrown' );
EXCEPTION WHEN OTHERS THEN
    return _tlike( SQLERRM ~~ $2, SQLERRM, $2, $3 );
END;

Function: public.throws_matching(text, text)

Returns: text

Language: SQL

    SELECT throws_matching($1, $2, 'Should throw exception matching ' || quote_literal($2) );

Function: public.throws_matching(text, text, text)

Returns: text

Language: PLPGSQL

BEGIN
    EXECUTE _query($1);
    RETURN ok( FALSE, $3 ) || E'\n' || diag( '    no exception thrown' );
EXCEPTION WHEN OTHERS THEN
    return _tlike( SQLERRM ~ $2, SQLERRM, $2, $3 );
END;

Function: public.throws_ok(text)

Returns: text

Language: SQL

    SELECT throws_ok( $1, NULL, NULL, NULL );

Function: public.throws_ok(text, bpchar, text, text)

Returns: text

Language: PLPGSQL

DECLARE
    query     TEXT := _query($1);
    errcode   ALIAS FOR $2;
    errmsg    ALIAS FOR $3;
    desctext  ALIAS FOR $4;
    descr     TEXT;
BEGIN
    descr := COALESCE(
          desctext,
          'threw ' || errcode || ': ' || errmsg,
          'threw ' || errcode,
          'threw ' || errmsg,
          'threw an exception'
    );
    EXECUTE query;
    RETURN ok( FALSE, descr ) || E'\n' || diag(
           '      caught: no exception' ||
        E'\n      wanted: ' || COALESCE( errcode, 'an exception' )
    );
EXCEPTION WHEN OTHERS OR ASSERT_FAILURE THEN
    IF (errcode IS NULL OR SQLSTATE = errcode)
        AND ( errmsg IS NULL OR SQLERRM = errmsg)
    THEN
        -- The expected errcode and/or message was thrown.
        RETURN ok( TRUE, descr );
    ELSE
        -- This was not the expected errcode or errmsg.
        RETURN ok( FALSE, descr ) || E'\n' || diag(
               '      caught: ' || SQLSTATE || ': ' || SQLERRM ||
            E'\n      wanted: ' || COALESCE( errcode, 'an exception' ) ||
            COALESCE( ': ' || errmsg, '')
        );
    END IF;
END;

Function: public.throws_ok(text, integer)

Returns: text

Language: SQL

    SELECT throws_ok( $1, $2::char(5), NULL, NULL );

Function: public.throws_ok(text, integer, text)

Returns: text

Language: SQL

    SELECT throws_ok( $1, $2::char(5), $3, NULL );

Function: public.throws_ok(text, integer, text, text)

Returns: text

Language: SQL

    SELECT throws_ok( $1, $2::char(5), $3, $4 );

Function: public.throws_ok(text, text)

Returns: text

Language: PLPGSQL

BEGIN
    IF octet_length($2) = 5 THEN
        RETURN throws_ok( $1, $2::char(5), NULL, NULL );
    ELSE
        RETURN throws_ok( $1, NULL, $2, NULL );
    END IF;
END;

Function: public.throws_ok(text, text, text)

Returns: text

Language: PLPGSQL

BEGIN
    IF octet_length($2) = 5 THEN
        RETURN throws_ok( $1, $2::char(5), $3, NULL );
    ELSE
        RETURN throws_ok( $1, NULL, $2, $3 );
    END IF;
END;

Function: public.time_dist(time without time zone, time without time zone)

Returns: interval

Language: C

time_dist

Function: public.tld_part(fqdn text)

Returns: text

Language: PLPGSQL

returns the tld/apex portion of a FQDN

DECLARE
  p INT;
BEGIN
  p := POSITION ( '.' IN fqdn );

  IF p = 0 THEN
    RETURN NULL;
  END IF;

  RETURN LOWER(RIGHT( fqdn, LENGTH(fqdn) - p ));
END;

Function: public.todo(how_many integer)

Returns: SET OF boolean

Language: PLPGSQL

BEGIN
    PERFORM _add('todo', COALESCE(how_many, 1), '');
    RETURN;
END;

Function: public.todo(how_many integer, why text)

Returns: SET OF boolean

Language: PLPGSQL

BEGIN
    PERFORM _add('todo', COALESCE(how_many, 1), COALESCE(why, ''));
    RETURN;
END;

Function: public.todo(why text)

Returns: SET OF boolean

Language: PLPGSQL

BEGIN
    PERFORM _add('todo', 1, COALESCE(why, ''));
    RETURN;
END;

Function: public.todo(why text, how_many integer)

Returns: SET OF boolean

Language: PLPGSQL

BEGIN
    PERFORM _add('todo', COALESCE(how_many, 1), COALESCE(why, ''));
    RETURN;
END;

Function: public.todo_end()

Returns: SET OF boolean

Language: PLPGSQL

DECLARE
    id integer;
BEGIN
    id := _get_latest( 'todo', -1 );
    IF id IS NULL THEN
        RAISE EXCEPTION 'todo_end() called without todo_start()';
    END IF;
    EXECUTE 'DELETE FROM __tcache__ WHERE id = ' || id;
    RETURN;
END;

Function: public.todo_start()

Returns: SET OF boolean

Language: PLPGSQL

BEGIN
    PERFORM _add('todo', -1, '');
    RETURN;
END;

Function: public.todo_start(text)

Returns: SET OF boolean

Language: PLPGSQL

BEGIN
    PERFORM _add('todo', -1, COALESCE($1, ''));
    RETURN;
END;

Function: public.trigger_is(name, name, name)

Returns: text

Language: SQL

    SELECT trigger_is(
        $1, $2, $3,
        'Trigger ' || quote_ident($2) || ' should call ' || quote_ident($3) || '()'
    );

Function: public.trigger_is(name, name, name, name, name)

Returns: text

Language: SQL

    SELECT trigger_is(
        $1, $2, $3, $4, $5,
        'Trigger ' || quote_ident($3) || ' should call ' || quote_ident($4) || '.' || quote_ident($5) || '()'
    );

Function: public.trigger_is(name, name, name, name, name, text)

Returns: text

Language: PLPGSQL

DECLARE
    pname text;
BEGIN
    SELECT quote_ident(ni.nspname) || '.' || quote_ident(p.proname)
      FROM pg_catalog.pg_trigger t
      JOIN pg_catalog.pg_class ct     ON ct.oid = t.tgrelid
      JOIN pg_catalog.pg_namespace nt ON nt.oid = ct.relnamespace
      JOIN pg_catalog.pg_proc p       ON p.oid = t.tgfoid
      JOIN pg_catalog.pg_namespace ni ON ni.oid = p.pronamespace
     WHERE nt.nspname = $1
       AND ct.relname = $2
       AND t.tgname   = $3
      INTO pname;

    RETURN is( pname, quote_ident($4) || '.' || quote_ident($5), $6 );
END;

Function: public.trigger_is(name, name, name, text)

Returns: text

Language: PLPGSQL

DECLARE
    pname text;
BEGIN
    SELECT p.proname
      FROM pg_catalog.pg_trigger t
      JOIN pg_catalog.pg_class ct ON ct.oid = t.tgrelid
      JOIN pg_catalog.pg_proc p   ON p.oid = t.tgfoid
     WHERE ct.relname = $1
       AND t.tgname   = $2
       AND pg_catalog.pg_table_is_visible(ct.oid)
      INTO pname;

    RETURN is( pname, $3::text, $4 );
END;

Function: public.triggers_are(name, name, name[])

Returns: text

Language: SQL

    SELECT triggers_are( $1, $2, $3, 'Table ' || quote_ident($1) || '.' || quote_ident($2) || ' should have the correct triggers' );

Function: public.triggers_are(name, name, name[], text)

Returns: text

Language: SQL

    SELECT _are(
        'triggers',
        ARRAY(
            SELECT t.tgname
              FROM pg_catalog.pg_trigger t
              JOIN pg_catalog.pg_class c     ON c.oid = t.tgrelid
              JOIN pg_catalog.pg_namespace n ON n.oid = c.relnamespace
             WHERE n.nspname = $1
               AND c.relname = $2
               AND NOT t.tgisinternal
            EXCEPT
            SELECT $3[i]
              FROM generate_series(1, array_upper($3, 1)) s(i)
        ),
        ARRAY(
            SELECT $3[i]
              FROM generate_series(1, array_upper($3, 1)) s(i)
            EXCEPT
            SELECT t.tgname
              FROM pg_catalog.pg_trigger t
              JOIN pg_catalog.pg_class c     ON c.oid = t.tgrelid
              JOIN pg_catalog.pg_namespace n ON n.oid = c.relnamespace
             WHERE n.nspname = $1
               AND c.relname = $2
               AND NOT t.tgisinternal
        ),
        $4
    );

Function: public.triggers_are(name, name[])

Returns: text

Language: SQL

    SELECT triggers_are( $1, $2, 'Table ' || quote_ident($1) || ' should have the correct triggers' );

Function: public.triggers_are(name, name[], text)

Returns: text

Language: SQL

    SELECT _are(
        'triggers',
        ARRAY(
            SELECT t.tgname
              FROM pg_catalog.pg_trigger t
              JOIN pg_catalog.pg_class c ON c.oid = t.tgrelid
              JOIN pg_catalog.pg_namespace n ON n.oid = c.relnamespace
             WHERE c.relname = $1
               AND n.nspname NOT IN ('pg_catalog', 'information_schema')
               AND NOT t.tgisinternal
            EXCEPT
            SELECT $2[i]
              FROM generate_series(1, array_upper($2, 1)) s(i)
        ),
        ARRAY(
            SELECT $2[i]
              FROM generate_series(1, array_upper($2, 1)) s(i)
            EXCEPT
            SELECT t.tgname
              FROM pg_catalog.pg_trigger t
              JOIN pg_catalog.pg_class c ON c.oid = t.tgrelid
              JOIN pg_catalog.pg_namespace n ON n.oid = c.relnamespace
               AND n.nspname NOT IN ('pg_catalog', 'information_schema')
               AND NOT t.tgisinternal
        ),
        $3
    );

Function: public.type_owner_is(name, name)

Returns: text

Language: SQL

    SELECT type_owner_is(
        $1, $2,
        'Type ' || quote_ident($1) || ' should be owned by ' || quote_ident($2)
    );

Function: public.type_owner_is(name, name, name)

Returns: text

Language: SQL

    SELECT type_owner_is(
        $1, $2, $3,
        'Type ' || quote_ident($1) || '.' || quote_ident($2) || ' should be owned by ' || quote_ident($3)
    );

Function: public.type_owner_is(name, name, name, text)

Returns: text

Language: PLPGSQL

DECLARE
    owner NAME := _get_type_owner($1, $2);
BEGIN
    -- Make sure the type exists.
    IF owner IS NULL THEN
        RETURN ok(FALSE, $4) || E'\n' || diag(
            E'    Type ' || quote_ident($1) || '.' || quote_ident($2) || ' not found'
        );
    END IF;

    RETURN is(owner, $3, $4);
END;

Function: public.type_owner_is(name, name, text)

Returns: text

Language: PLPGSQL

DECLARE
    owner NAME := _get_type_owner($1);
BEGIN
    -- Make sure the type exists.
    IF owner IS NULL THEN
        RETURN ok(FALSE, $3) || E'\n' || diag(
            E'    Type ' || quote_ident($1) || ' not found'
        );
    END IF;

    RETURN is(owner, $2, $3);
END;

Function: public.update_audit_info()

Returns: trigger

Language: PLPGSQL

This function is used to update the updated_date and updated_by fields in the tables that inherit from _audit. 

BEGIN

  NEW.updated_date := NOW();
  NEW.updated_by   := CURRENT_USER;
  RETURN NEW;

END;

Function: public.users_are(name[])

Returns: text

Language: SQL

    SELECT users_are( $1, 'There should be the correct users' );

Function: public.users_are(name[], text)

Returns: text

Language: SQL

    SELECT _are(
        'users',
        ARRAY(
            SELECT usename
              FROM pg_catalog.pg_user
            EXCEPT
            SELECT $1[i]
              FROM generate_series(1, array_upper($1, 1)) s(i)
        ),
        ARRAY(
            SELECT $1[i]
              FROM generate_series(1, array_upper($1, 1)) s(i)
            EXCEPT
            SELECT usename
              FROM pg_catalog.pg_user
        ),
        $2
    );

Function: public.validfqdn(d text)

Returns: boolean

Language: SQL

Validate that the passed text string resembles a valid fully qualified domain name. This includes validating that no label is longer than 63 characters and the total string does not exceed 255 characters. Also, this enforces lower case folding. The length restrictions are taken from RFC-1035 2.3.4. 

  SELECT $1 ~ '^[a-z0-9][-a-z0-9]{0,62}(\.[a-z0-9][-a-z0-9]{0,62})+$'
         AND LENGTH($1) < 255;

Function: public.validlhs(u text)

Returns: boolean

Language: SQL

Validate that the passed text string is a valid left hand side for a mailbox. 

  SELECT $1 ~ '^[-_a-z0-9.^\$]{1,}$'
    AND LENGTH($1) <= 64;

Function: public.validmbox(u text)

Returns: boolean

Language: SQL

Validate that the passed text string is considered a valid email address in our system. This is, has the form local-part@FQDN. 

  SELECT $1 ~ '^[-_a-z0-9.^\$]{1,}@.{1,}$'
  AND public.ValidLHS(split_part($1, '@', 1))
    AND public.ValidFQDN(split_part($1, '@', 2))
    AND split_part($1, '@', 3) = '';

Function: public.view_owner_is(name, name, name)

Returns: text

Language: SQL

    SELECT view_owner_is(
        $1, $2, $3,
        'View ' || quote_ident($1) || '.' || quote_ident($2) || ' should be owned by ' || quote_ident($3)
    );

Function: public.view_owner_is(name, name, name, text)

Returns: text

Language: PLPGSQL

DECLARE
    owner NAME := _get_rel_owner('v'::char, $1, $2);
BEGIN
    -- Make sure the view exists.
    IF owner IS NULL THEN
        RETURN ok(FALSE, $4) || E'\n' || diag(
            E'    View ' || quote_ident($1) || '.' || quote_ident($2) || ' does not exist'
        );
    END IF;

    RETURN is(owner, $3, $4);
END;

Function: public.view_owner_is(name, name, text)

Returns: text

Language: PLPGSQL

DECLARE
    owner NAME := _get_rel_owner('v'::char, $1);
BEGIN
    -- Make sure the view exists.
    IF owner IS NULL THEN
        RETURN ok(FALSE, $3) || E'\n' || diag(
            E'    View ' || quote_ident($1) || ' does not exist'
        );
    END IF;

    RETURN is(owner, $2, $3);
END;

    SELECT volatility_is(

        'Function ' || quote_ident($1) || '.' || quote_ident($2) || '(' ||
        array_to_string($3, ', ') || ') should be ' || _refine_vol($4)
    );
